en: Now king David was old and stricken in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he gat no heat.
hmr: Tûn lal David chu a kumhai a hung tam a, a hung tar ta hleh a, chuongchun, puonhaiin ama chu an inkhum hlak a, nisienlakhawm, a lum thei chuong nawh a.

en: Wherefore his servants said unto him, Let there be sought for my lord the king a young virgin: and let her stand before the king, and cherish him; and let her lie in thy bosom, that my lord the king may get heat.
hmr: Chuongchun, a siehlawhai chun a kuomah, “Ka lalpa lal ta ding hinnunghâk tleirawl zawng ei tiu khai, lal bula hin um zing sienla, enkawl raw se; chun, i ângsûnga hin hung zâl sienla, ka lalpa hi a lum thei ding a nih,” an tih a.

en: So they sought for a fair damsel throughout all the borders of Israel, and found Abishag the Shunammite, and brought her to the king.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel ram sûng po poa chun nunghâk hmêlṭha an zawng tah a; Sunam mi Abisag chu an va hmuh a, lal kuoma chun an hung ṭhuoi tah a.

en: And the damsel was very fair; and she cherished the king, and ministered to him; but the king knew her not.
hmr: Nunghâk chu a hmêl a ṭha hle el a, lal chu a enkawl a, a rawng a bâwlpêk hlak a; nisienlakhawm, lal chun a pâwl nawh a.

en: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, I will be king: and he prepared him chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.
hmr: Chun, Haggith naupa Adonija chu ama le ama inchawisângin, “Kei hi lal ka la ni ngei âwm hi maw,” a ta, tawlailîr le sakawr chung chuong mihai, mi sâwmnga a hmaa tlân dinghai leh a buotsai a.

en: And his father had not displeased him at any time in saying, Why hast thou done so? and he was also a very goodly man; and he was born after Absalom.
hmr: A pa hlak chun ieng lai khawma, “Iengdinga hienga i thaw am a ni leh?” tiin a suklungawi naw ngai si nawh a; chun, ama hi hmêl ṭhatak a na, Absalom hnuoia mi a nih.

en: And he conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest: and they following Adonijah helped him.
hmr: Ama chun Zeruia naupa Joab le thiempu Abiathar chu a râwn a, anni chu Adonija tieng chun an ṭhang a, an ṭhangpui hlak a.

en: But Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and Nathan the prophet, and Shimei, and Rei, and the mighty men that belonged to David, were not with Adonijah.
hmr: Thiempu Zadok hai, Jehoiada naupa Benaia hai, zâwlnei Nathan hai, Simei hai, Rei hai le David mi huoisenhai ruok chu Adonija tieng an ṭhang ve nawh a.

en: And Adonijah slew sheep and oxen and fatlings by the stone of Zoheleth, which is beside En-rogel; and he called all his brethren, the king’s sons, and all the men of Judah, the king’s servants:
hmr: Chun, Adonija chun berâmhai, sebâwngchalhai, ran châwm thâuhai Zoheleth lungah a that a; chu chu En-rogel bula um a nih; chun, lal naupahai, a unauhai po po le, Juda rama lal upahai po po chu a fiel a.

en: but Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, and the mighty men, and Solomon his brother, he called not.
hmr: Zâwlnei Nathan hai, Benaia hai, mi huoisenhai le a unaupa Solomon ruok chu a fiel ve nawh a.

en: Then Nathan spake unto Bath-sheba the mother of Solomon, saying, Hast thou not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith doth reign, and David our lord knoweth it not?
hmr: Chuongchun, Nathan chun Solomon nu Bathseba kuoma chun, “Haggith naupa Adonija hi ei lalpa David hriet loin ân lal el a ni ta hi ti i hriet naw am a nih?

en: Now therefore come, let me, I pray thee, give thee counsel, that thou mayest save thine own life, and the life of thy son Solomon.
hmr: Chuongchun, nangma himna ding le i naupa Solomon himna ding lo hril ka ti che.

en: Go and get thee in unto king David, and say unto him, Didst not thou, my lord, O king, swear unto thy handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne? why then doth Adonijah reign?
hmr: Lal David kuoma chun va lût la, a kuomah, ‘Aw lalpa ka pu, i suoknu kuoma hin i naupa Solomon hi ka hnungah ân lal ngei ngei ding a na, ama hi ka lalṭhungphaa hin a la ṭhung ding a nih, ti khan ṭawng în khâm a ni naw am a ni kha? Ieng- dinga Adonija hi lala um el am a ni ta leh?’ va ti hrim ta.

en: Behold, while thou yet talkest there with the king, I also will come in after thee, and confirm thy words.
hmr: Ngai ta, lal i va biek lai tak chun kei khawma hung zui lût vêng ka ti cheh a, i thuhril chu ka hung sukdet- pui ding che a nih,” tiin a hril a.

en: And Bath-sheba went in unto the king into the chamber: and the king was very old; and Abishag the Shunammite was ministering unto the king.
hmr: Chun, Bathseba chu lal pindana chun a va lût tah a, lal chu a upa ta hle el a, Sunam mi Abisag chun lal rawng chu a lo bâwl a.

en: And Bath-sheba bowed, and did obeisance unto the king. And the king said, What wouldest thou?
hmr: Bathseba chun kûnin lal chu chibai a bûk a. Chun, lal chun, “Ieng am i dit a?” a lo tih a.

en: And she said unto him, My lord, thou swarest by Jehovah thy God unto thy handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne.
hmr: Ama chun, “Ka lalpa, LALPA i Pathien hming sâlin i suoknu kuoma hin, ‘I naupa Solomon hi ka hnungah ân lal ngei ngei ding a na, ama hi ka lalṭhungphaa hin a la ṭhung ding a nih,’ ti khan ṭawng în khâm tah a.

en: And now, behold, Adonijah reigneth; and thou, my lord the king, knowest it not:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ngai ta, tuhin Adonija chun ro a rêl ta hi, lalpa nang ka pu hlaka i hriet si nawh a;

en: and he hath slain oxen and fatlings and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the sons of the king, and Abiathar the priest, and Joab the captain of the host; but Solomon thy servant hath he not called.
hmr: bâwngchalhai, ran châwm thâuhai, berâmhai a that ṭeu a, lal naupahai po po le thiempu Abiathar le sipai pâwl hotu Joab a ko a; nisien- lakhawm, i siehlaw Solomon ruok hi chu a ko ve naw a nih.

en: And thou, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are upon thee, that thou shouldest tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka pu lalpa hnunga hin lalṭhungphaah tu am a ṭhung ding a na ti i hril theina dingin Israelhai po po mit hi nang ka pu chunga hin a fu ṭhuop el a ni hi.

en: Otherwise it will come to pass, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be counted offenders.
hmr: Chuong naw chun chu hieng hi hung nîng a ta, ka pu lal hi a puhai kuoma a in ve pha chun, kei le ka naupa Solomon hi thil suksuoltuah an mi ruot el ding a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And, lo, while she yet talked with the king, Nathan the prophet came in.
hmr: Chun, chuonga lal kuoma thu a la hril zing lai chun zâwlnei, Nathan chu a va lût veh a;

en: And they told the king, saying, Behold, Nathan the prophet. And when he was come in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.
hmr: “En ta, zâwlnei Nathan a hung ie,” tiin lal chu an hril a. Chun, lal kuom a va tlung chun, lal hmaa chun a hmaia hnuoi sikin a bawkkhup a.

en: And Nathan said, My lord, O king, hast thou said, Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne?
hmr: Chun, Nathan chun, “Aw lalpa ka pu, ‘Keia hnungah Adonija hi inlal a ta, ka lalṭhungphaah ṭhung a tih,’ i ti am a nih?

en: For he is gone down this day, and hath slain oxen and fatlings and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the king’s sons, and the captains of the host, and Abiathar the priest; and, behold, they are eating and drinking before him, and say, Long live king Adonijah.
hmr: Vawisûn hin a fe thlah a, ran châwm thâuhai, bâwngchalhai, be- râmhai a that ṭeu a, lal naupahai po po le sipai hotuhai le, thiempu Abiathar hai dâm a fiel a, chun, ngai ta, an dâwnin an fâk tâwl a, ‘Pathien chun lal Adonija hi humhim raw se,’ an ti a nih.

en: But me, even me thy servant, and Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and thy servant Solomon, hath he not called.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, kei i siehlaw ngei le, thiempu Zadok le Jehoiada naupa Benaia le i siehlaw Solomon hi chu an mi fiel ve nawh a.

en: Is this thing done by my lord the king, and thou hast not showed unto thy servants who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?
hmr: Hi thil hi ka pu lalpa thilthaw a ni si chun, ka pu lalpa hnunga hin i lalṭhungphaa ṭhung ding chu a tu tak am a ni i siehlawhai hi i lân hriettir naw hrim nîng a ti maw?” a ta.

en: Then king David answered and said, Call to me Bath-sheba. And she came into the king’s presence, and stood before the king.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal David chun a dawn a, “Bathseba mi hung kopêk ro,” a tih a. Chun, lal kuoma chun a va feh a, lal hmaa chun a va ngîr a.

en: And the king sware, and said, As Jehovah liveth, who hath redeemed my soul out of all adversity,
hmr: Chun, lal chun ṭawng inkhâm- in, “Lunginzîngna po poa ka hringna humhimtu LALPA hringna sâlin,

en: verily as I sware unto thee by Jehovah, the God of Israel, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne in my stead; verily so will I do this day.
hmr: i kuoma Israelhai LALPA hming sâla, ‘I naupa Solomon hi ka hnunga chun lân lal ngei ngei a ta, keia aiah ka lalṭhungphaa hin a la ṭhung ding a nih,’ tiha ṭawng kân khâm ang ngei khan, vawisûn ngei hin ka thaw ding a nih,” a ta.

en: Then Bath-sheba bowed with her face to the earth, and did obeisance to the king, and said, Let my lord king David live for ever.
hmr: Chuongchun, Bathseba chu a hmaia hnuoi sikin a bawkkhup a, lal chu chibai a bûk a, “Ka pu lal David hi kumkhawtluongin dam zing raw se,” a ta.

en: And king David said, Call to me Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada. And they came before the king.
hmr: Chun, lal David chun, “Thiempu Zadok hai, zâwlnei Nathan hai, Jehoiada naupa Benaia hai mi hung kopêk ro,” a ta. Chun, anni chu lal hmaa chun an va fe tah a.

en: And the king said unto them, Take with you the servants of your lord, and cause Solomon my son to ride upon mine own mule, and bring him down to Gihon:
hmr: Chun, lal chun an kuomah, “In lalpa siehlawhai hi ṭhuoi unla, chun, ka naupa Solomon hi keima sabeng- tung lien chia ngei inchuongtir unla, Gihonah ṭhuoi thla ro,

en: and let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there king over Israel; and blow ye the trumpet, and say, Long live king Solomon.
hmr: chun, chutaka chun thiempu Zadok le zâwlnei Nathanin ama chu Israelhai po po chunga lal dingin hriek zu nâl raw hai se, chun, in tawtawrâwthai mût in ta, ‘Pathienin lal Solomon hi humhim raw se,’ ti ro.

en: Then ye shall come up after him, and he shall come and sit upon my throne; for he shall be king in my stead; and I have appointed him to be prince over Israel and over Judah.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chu hung zui in ta, ka lalṭhungphaa hin a hung ṭhung ding a nih, ama hi ka aia lal ding a ni sih a; chun, ama hi Israel ram le Juda ram lal dinga ka ruot a nih,” a ta.

en: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king, and said, Amen: Jehovah, the God of my lord the king, say so too.
hmr: Chun, Jehoiada naupa Benaia chun lal chu a dawn a, “Amen, LALPA ka pu lalpa Pathien khawma remti raw se.

en: As Jehovah hath been with my lord the king, even so be he with Solomon, and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord king David.
hmr: LALPA chu ka pu lalpa kuoma hin a um hlak angin, Solomon kuoma khawm um ve pei sienla, ka pu lal David lalṭhungpha nêkin a lalṭhung- pha chu sukropui lem raw se,” a ta.

en: So Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, went down, and caused Solomon to ride upon king David’s mule, and brought him to Gihon.
hmr: Chuongchun, thiempu Zadok hai, zâwlnei Nathan hai, Jehoiada naupa Benaia hai, Kereth mihai, Peleth mihai chu an zu feh a, Solomon chu David sabengtung chunga chun an inchuongtir a, Gihon hmuna chun an ṭhuoi a.

en: And Zadok the priest took the horn of oil out of the Tent, and anointed Solomon. And they blew the trumpet; and all the people said, Long live king Solomon.
hmr: Chun, thiempu Zadok chun Puon ina inthawkin hriek siena ki chu a lâk a, Solomon chu a nâl tah a. Chun, tawtawrâwt an mût a, chuong- chun, mi po po chun, “Pathienin lal Solomon hi humhim raw se,” an tih a.

en: And all the people came up after him, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth rent with the sound of them.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai po po chun ama chu an zui a, mipuihai chun theihle dâm an mût a, an lâwm nasa khawp a, an rihâu chun hnuoi chu a nghawr kak hiel a.

en: And Adonijah and all the guests that were with him heard it as they had made an end of eating. And when Joab heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, Wherefore is this noise of the city being in an uproar?
hmr: Chun, Adonija le mi fielhai a kuoma umhai po po chun an ruoiṭhe zo chun an hei hriet a. Chun, Joab chun tawtawrâwt mût rîk a hei hriet chun, “Khawpui sûnga ri nasatak um ta dur dur el chu iengtizie am a ni ta leh?” a ta.

en: While he yet spake, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came: and Adonijah said, Come in; for thou art a worthy man, and bringest good tidings.
hmr: Chuonga a ti lai tak chun ngai ta, thiempu Abiathar naupa Jona- than a hung a, Adonija chun, “La hung ta khai, nang chu chu mi fel i na, chanchin ṭha intlun ngei i tih,” a lo tih a.

en: And Jonathan answered and said to Adonijah, Verily our lord king David hath made Solomon king:
hmr: Chun, Jonathan chun a dawn a, Adonija kuoma chun, “Tlun lo e, ei pu lal David chun Solomon lalah a siem tah annâwm ie,

en: and the king hath sent with him Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and they have caused him to ride upon the king’s mule;
hmr: ama ruol chun thiempu Zadok hai, zâwlnei Nathan hai, Jehoiada naupa Benaia hai, Kereth mihai, Peleth mihai lalin a tir a, lal sakawr chungah an inchuongtir tah a:

en: and Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king in Gihon; and they are come up from thence rejoicing, so that the city rang again. This is the noise that ye have heard.
hmr: chun, thiempu Zadok le zâwlnei Nathanin Gihon hmunah lal dingin hriek an nâl tah a, chutaka inthawk chun hlimtakin an hung a, chu ri chun khawpui sûng chu a khâwk rum rum el a nih. Chu chu a nih in ri hriet chu.

en: And also Solomon sitteth on the throne of the kingdom.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chu hi ram lal- ṭhungphaa chun a ṭhung ta bawk a.

en: And moreover the king’s servants came to bless our lord king David, saying, Thy God make the name of Solomon better than thy name, and make his throne greater than thy throne: and the king bowed himself upon the bed.
hmr: Chun, lal siehlawhai chun, ‘I Pathienin i hming nêkin Solomon hming chu sukṭha sienla, i lalṭhung- pha nêkin Solomon a lalṭhungpha chu sukropui lem raw se,’ tiha ei lal David chu lâwmpui dingin an fe huoi huoi bawk a; chun, lal chu khum sikin a lo kûn pei bawk a.

en: And also thus said the king, Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, who hath given one to sit on my throne this day, mine eyes even seeing it.
hmr: Chun, lal khawm chun hieng ang hin a tih a, ‘LALPA Israelhai Pathien, vawisûn ngeia ka lalṭhung- phaa ṭhung ding hung ruottu chu inpâkin um raw se, ka mit ngeiin a hmu ta hi, tiin,’” a ta.

en: And all the guests of Adonijah were afraid, and rose up, and went every man his way.
hmr: Chun, Adonija mi fielhai po po chun an ṭi tah a, an tho a, mâni lampui sengah an fe ta vawng a.

en: And Adonijah feared because of Solomon; and he arose, and went, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.
hmr: Chun, Adonija chun Solomon chu a ṭi tah a, a tho a, maichâm ki a va chel tah a.

en: And it was told Solomon, saying, Behold, Adonijah feareth king Solomon; for, lo, he hath laid hold on the horns of the altar, saying, Let king Solomon swear unto me first that he will not slay his servant with the sword.
hmr: Chun, “Ngai ta, Adonija chun lal Solomon a ṭih a, ‘Lal Solomon hin a siehlaw kâwlhnâma sukhlum lo dingin ka kuomah ṭawng inkhâm phawt raw se,’ tiin maichâm ki a chel ie,” tiin Solomon chu an hril a.

en: And Solomon said, If he shall show himself a worthy man, there shall not a hair of him fall to the earth; but if wickedness be found in him, he shall die.
hmr: Solomon chun, “Mi ringumtak a ni ti a suklang phawt chun a sam zâi khat khawm hnuoiah tla naw nih, amiruokchu, rîtlona a nei ti hriet a ni ruok chun thîng a tih,” a ta.

en: So king Solomon sent, and they brought him down from the altar. And he came and did obeisance to king Solomon; and Solomon said unto him, Go to thy house.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Solomon chun mi a tir a, maichâma inthawk chun an va ṭhuoi tah a. Chun, a va feh a, Solomon chu chibai a bûk a, Solomon chun a kuomah, “I inah fe ta raw khai,” a lo tih a.

en: And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning the name of Jehovah, she came to prove him with hard questions.
hmr: Chun, LALPA hming dinga a thilthaw chungchâng thua Solomon hming inthangzie chu Seba lalnuin a lo hriet chun thu khirtak taka fie tumin a kuomah a feh a.

en: And she came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels that bare spices, and very much gold, and precious stones; and when she was come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem khuoah, hnung zuitu tamtak ṭhuoiin, thil rim inhnik le rângkachak tamtak le lunghluhai phur sanghâwngseihai ṭhuoiin a feh a; chun, Solomon kuom a tlung chun a lungrila a thu pai po po chu phawr fai rêtin ama a biek a.

en: And Solomon told her all her questions: there was not anything hid from the king which he told her not.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun a thu in- dawnhai po po chu a dawn fai vawng a, lal ihriet naw, a hrilfie thei naw hrim a um dêr nawh a.

en: And when the queen of Sheba had seen all the wisdom of Solomon, and the house that he had built,
hmr: Chun, Seba lalnuin Solomon varzie po pohai, a in bâwl dâm,

en: and the food of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their apparel, and his cupbearers, and his ascent by which he went up unto the house of Jehovah; there was no more spirit in her.
hmr: a dawkâna fâk ding dâm, a upahai ṭhung dân dâm, a rawngbâwl- tuhai chângvêl dân dâm, an inchei dân dâm, a no inhlântuhai dâm, LALPA ina ân hlân pumrawhmang thilinhlâna ân hlânhai a hei hmu chun lungril alêm a nei ta nawh a.

en: And she said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in mine own land of thine acts, and of thy wisdom.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal kuoma chun, “I thilthawhai le i varzie hai, keia rama inthawka ka lo hriethai kha thuthang indik tak a lo ni ngei hi tie.

en: Howbeit I believed not the words, until I came, and mine eyes had seen it: and, behold, the half was not told me; thy wisdom and prosperity exceed the fame which I heard.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, keiin ka mit ngeia ka hung hmu hmakhat chun an hril chu ka lo awi nawh a, chuong- chun, ngai ta, a zâtve khawm an mi lo hril naw a nih, an hril ka lo hriet nêkin i varzie le i ṭhatzie a lo nasa hle lem a ni hi.

en: Happy are thy men, happy are these thy servants, that stand continually before thee, and that hear thy wisdom.
hmr: I mihai, hieng i siehlaw, i bula um rawpa i varna thu ngai zing zing hlakhai hi an va hamṭha de aw!

en: Blessed be Jehovah thy God, who delighted in thee, to set thee on the throne of Israel: because Jehovah loved Israel for ever, therefore made he thee king, to do justice and righteousness.
hmr: LALPA i Pathien, i chunga lâwm êm êm, Israelhai lalṭhungphaa in- ṭhungtirtu che hi inpâkin um raw se; LALPAIN kumkhuoin Israelhai hi a hmangai a, chuleiin, feltaka ro rêl dingin lalah a siem che a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And she gave the king a hundred and twenty talents of gold, and of spices very great store, and precious stones: there came no more such abundance of spices as these which the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
hmr: Chun, lal chu rângkachak ta- lent za le sâwmhni le thil riminhnik tamtak el le, lunghluhai a pêk a, Seba lalnuin Solomon thil riminhnik a pêk ang zozaia tam hi a lût ta ngai nawh a.

en: And the navy also of Hiram, that brought gold from Ophir, brought in from Ophir great plenty of almug-trees and precious stones.
hmr: Chun, Hiram lawngruol, Ophira inthawka rângkachak va phurtuhai khawm chun Ophira inthawk chun almug thing tamtak le lunghluhai an hung phur a.

en: And the king made of the almug-trees pillars for the house of Jehovah, and for the king’s house, harps also and psalteries for the singers: there came no such almug-trees, nor were seen, unto this day.
hmr: Chun, lal chun almug thinghai chu LALPA in le lal in inhuonna dingin le hlasaktuhai ta dinga ṭing- ṭang le perkhuonghai siemna ding chenin a hmang a; tu chen hin chuong ang almug thing hrim hrim chu a lûtin hmu khawm hmu a ni ta ngai nawh.

en: And king Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatsoever she asked, besides that which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she turned, and went to her own land, she and her servants.
hmr: Chun, a hni sa naw Solomonin a pêk tihai naw khawm chu lal Solomon chun Seba lalnu chu a dit taphawt, a hni taphawthai chu a pêk a. Chuongchun, a rawihai leh a umna ram tieng chun a fe nâwk tah a.

en: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred threescore and six talents of gold,
hmr: Solomon kuoma kum khat sûnga rângkachak lût rikzie chu, rângkachak talent za ruk sâwmruk paruk a nih;

en: besides that which the traders brought, and the traffic of the merchants, and of all the kings of the mingled people, and of the governors of the country.
hmr: sumdâwngtuhaia inthawka sie- chawi lâklût le, thil zawrtuhai suk- hlâwk, Arab lalhai sie-chawi po po le ram awptuhaia inthawka lût tiem loin.

en: And king Solomon made two hundred bucklers of beaten gold; six hundred shekels of gold went to one buckler.
hmr: Chun, lal Solomon chun rângka- chak sut phêkin phaw lien za hni a siem a, phaw pakhat chun shekel za ruk a dit a nih.

en: And he made three hundred shields of beaten gold; three pounds of gold went to one shield: and the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
hmr: Chun, rângkachak sut phêkin phaw dang za thum a siem a, phaw pakhat chun rângkachak maneh thum pei a ngai a; chuonghai chu lal chun Lebanon rampui ina chun a sieh a.

en: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with the finest gold.
hmr: Chun, lal chun saiha lal- ṭhungpha ropuitak a siem bawk a, chu chu rângkachak ṭha chi takin ân luon a.

en: There were six steps to the throne, and the top of the throne was round behind; and there were stays on either side by the place of the seat, and two lions standing beside the stays.
hmr: Lalṭhungpha hang lâwnnaa chun kalbi paruk a um a, chu lal- ṭhungpha hnungtieng chun a hung inkûm a, a ṭhungna sîrtuoka chun a dona a um ve veh a, chun a dona bulhaia chun sakeibaknei pahni an ngîr a.

en: And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps: there was not the like made in any kingdom.
hmr: Chun, kalbi paruka chun a sîrtuokah sakeibaknei sâwm le pahni an ngîr a, chuong ang chu khâwlai rama khawm an siem ngai hrim hrim nawh a.

en: And all king Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: none were of silver; it was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
hmr: Chun, lal Solomon nohai po po chu rângkachak vawng an na, chun, Lebanon Rampui Ina bûr le bêlhai po po khawm chu rângkachak hlîr hlak vawng an nih; tangkaruo hrim hrim a ṭhang nawh, Solomon dam lai chun, chu chu ieng hûa khawm an ngai nawh.

en: For the king had at sea a navy of Tarshish with the navy of Hiram: once every three years came the navy of Tarshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.
hmr: Lal chun tuisuorieta chun Hiram lawng ruol inkawppuitu ding Tarsis lawng ruol a nei a, Tarsis lawng ruol chun kum thum dan peiah rângkachak dâm, tangkaruo dâm, saiha dâm, zâwng dâm, ârâwnhai dâm, a hung phur hlak a.

en: So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth in riches and in wisdom.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Solomon chun khawvêla lal po po chu hausaka le vara chun a khûm vawng a nih.

en: And all the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
hmr: Pathienin a lungrila varna thu a siepêk chu ngai dingin khawvêla mi po pohai chun Solomon chu an hung pan huoi huoi hlak a.

en: And they brought every man his tribute, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and raiment, and armor, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.
hmr: Mi tinin lâwmman kum tina pêk bi neiin tangkaraw bûr le bêlhai, rângkachak bûr le bêlhai, puonhai dâm, râlthuomhai dâm, thil rimin- hnikhai dâm, sakawrhai dâm, sa- bengtung lien chi hai dâm an hung pêk hlak a.

en: And Solomon gathered together chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, that he bestowed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun tawlai- lîrhai le sakawr chung chuong mihai a ko khâwm ṭeu a, tawlailîr sâng khat le za li le sakawr chung chuong mi sîng khat le sâng hni a nei a, chuonghai chu tawlailîr siena khuo- haia, Jerusalem khuoa lal umnaa dâm chun ân umtir a.

en: And the king made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made he to be as the sycomore-trees that are in the lowland, for abundance.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Jerusalem khuoa chun a tam êm leiin tangka- ruohai chu lung ang ela ngai khawpin ân umtir a, Sidar thinghai dâm chu phaia theichang thing ang ela ngai khawpin ân umtir a.

en: And the horses which Solomon had were brought out of Egypt; and the king’s merchants received them in droves, each drove at a price.
hmr: Chun, Solomon inei sakawrhai chu Aigupta rama inthawka hung tawl suok an na, chun, lal sumdâwng- tuhai chun aruol ruolin an lo khâr hlak a, aruola inchâwk pei an nih.

en: And a chariot came up and went out of Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty; and so for all the kings of the Hittites, and for the kings of Syria, did they bring them out by their means.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawka taw- lailîr chu tangkaruo shekel za ruk peiin an suktlung hlak a, chun, sakawr chu tangkaruo shekel za le sâwmnga peiin; chuong ang bawk chun Hit mihai lalhai po po le Suria lalhai khawm an suktlung pêk hlak a nih.

en: Now king Solomon loved many foreign women, together with the daughter of Pharaoh, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Sidonians, and Hittites;
hmr: Solomon chun Pharao naunu chau naw khawm hnam dang nuhmei tamtak Moab mi dâm, Ammon mi dâm, Edom mi dâm, Zidon mi dâm, Hit mi nuhmeihai dâm chu a hmangai a;

en: of the nations concerning which Jehovah said unto the children of Israel, Ye shall not go among them, neither shall they come among you; for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods: Solomon clave unto these in love.
hmr: chuong hnamhai chungchâng thu chu LALPAIN Israel thlahai kuomah, “Anni chu pâwl naw unla, anni khawma pâwl naw raw hai se cheu; an pathienhai tieng in lungril an kei kâwi ngei âwm sih a,” tiin a lo hril ta hrim a; chuonghai chu Solomon chun hmangainain a chel tlat a.

en: And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines; and his wives turned away his heart.
hmr: Chuongchun, nuhmei za sari, lal naunu a nei a, thaikêm za thum leh; chun, a nuhmeihai chun a lungril an ṭhuoi kâwipêk tah a.

en: For it came to pass, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned away his heart after other gods; and his heart was not perfect with Jehovah his God, as was the heart of David his father.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chu a hung upat hnung chun, a nuhmeihai chun pathien dang kuom tienga chun a lungril an ṭhuoi kâwipêk tah a, chuongchun, a pa David lungril angin LALPA a Pathien tienga chun a lung- ril chu a hung ṭha famkim ta nawh a.

en: For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
hmr: Solomon chun Zidon mihai pathiennu Astoreth le Ammon mihai pathien tirdakumtak Milkom chu a lo zui ve tah a.

en: And Solomon did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, and went not fully after Jehovah, as did David his father.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun LALPA mithmua chun thil suol a lo thaw tah a; a pa David ang khan LALPA chu a zui tlat ve ta nawh a.

en: Then did Solomon build a high place for Chemosh the abomination of Moab, in the mount that is before Jerusalem, and for Molech the abomination of the children of Ammon.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun Jerusalem bula tlângah Moab mihai pathien tirdakumtak Kemos ta ding- in le, Ammon mihai pathien tirdak- umtak Molek ta dingin bâwlhmun a lo siem tah a.

en: And so did he for all his foreign wives, who burnt incense and sacrificed unto their gods.
hmr: Chuong ang bawk chun hnam dang a nuhmeihai po po an pathien kuoma inthâwia riminhnik raw hlakhai ta ding khawma a siempêk a.

en: And Jehovah was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned away from Jehovah, the God of Israel, who had appeared unto him twice,
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chu Solo- mon chunga chun a lunginsen tah a, LALPA Israelhai Pathien a kuoma vawihni lai inlâr chu a lungrila phatsanin,

en: and had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods: but he kept not that which Jehovah commanded.
hmr: pathien danghai a zui ding a ni nawh ti a LALPAIN thu a pêk chu a zâwm naw leiin.

en: Wherefore Jehovah said unto Solomon, Forasmuch as this is done of thee, and thou hast not kept my covenant and my statutes, which I have commanded thee, I will surely rend the kingdom from thee, and will give it to thy servant.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPAIN Solomon kuoma chun, “Hieng ang hin i hung um tah a, ka thuthlung le ka thuruot pawm dinga thu ka pêk che hi i pawm ta si nawh a, ram hi lâkpêk ngei ngei ka ti cheh a, i siehlaw kuomah pêng ka tih.

en: Notwithstanding in thy days I will not do it, for David thy father’s sake: but I will rend it out of the hand of thy son.
hmr: Amiruokchu, i pa David zârah i dam sûng êm chun thaw naw ningah; nisienlakhawm, i naupa chu ka lâkpêk ding a nih.

en: Howbeit I will not rend away all the kingdom; but I will give one tribe to thy son, for David my servant’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake which I have chosen.
hmr: Ram po po ruok chu lâkpêk vawng naw ning a, nisienlakhawm, ka siehlaw David lei le ka ithlang Jerusalem lei hin hnam khat chu i naupa kuomah pêng ka tih,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah raised up an adversary unto Solomon, Hadad the Edomite: he was of the king’s seed in Edom.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Edom mi Hadad chu Solomon hmêlma dingin a hung inngîrsuok tah a, ama chu Edom rama lal thla a nih.

en: For it came to pass, when David was in Edom, and Joab the captain of the host was gone up to bury the slain, and had smitten every male in Edom
hmr: Chun, David Edom rama a um laia an mi thathai phûm dinga sipai hotu Joab a hang feh a, Edom mi, naupasal taphawt chu a hang that vawng hnung khan,

en: (for Joab and all Israel remained there six months, until he had cut off every male in Edom);
hmr: Joab le Israel mihai po po chu thla ruk zet Edom rama pasal po po an sukhlum vawng hmakhat chun an um a nih:

en: that Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father’s servants with him, to go into Egypt, Hadad being yet a little child.
hmr: Hadad chu a pa siehlawhai laia Edom mi ṭhenkhathai leh Aigupta rama tlân dingin an feh a, Hadad chu naupang chitê a la nih.

en: And they arose out of Midian, and came to Paran; and they took men with them out of Paran, and they came to Egypt, unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, who gave him a house, and appointed him victuals, and gave him land.
hmr: Midian rama inthawk chun an suok a, Paranah an feh a, chun, Parana inthawk chun mihai an ṭhuoi a, Aigupta ram, Aigupta ram lal Pharao kuom an zu tlung a; ama chun inhai a lo pêk a, fâk dinghai a lo ngaituopêk a, ram dâm a lo pêk bawk a.

en: And Hadad found great favor in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him to wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.
hmr: Hadad chun Pharao mit a tlung hle el a, chuongchun, a nuhmei ngei zuorpuinu, lalnu Tahpenes zuorpui chu nuhmeiah ân neitir a.

en: And the sister of Tahpenes bare him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh’s house; and Genubath was in Pharaoh’s house among the sons of Pharaoh.
hmr: Chun, Tahpenes zuorpuinu chun, naupasal Genubath a neipêk a, Tahpenes chun Pharao ina chun a nêne nêk bânna a siempêk a; chun, Genubath chu Pharao nauhai laia chun a um tah a.

en: And when Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab the captain of the host was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, Let me depart, that I may go to mine own country.
hmr: Chun, Hadad chun Aigupta rama inthawka David chu a puhai kuomah a in ve tah ti le, sipai hotu Joab khawm a thi tah ti a lo hrietin, Hadad chun Pharao kuomah, “Ka rama ka fe theina dingin mîn suoktir ta la,” a ta.

en: Then Pharaoh said unto him, But what hast thou lacked with me, that, behold, thou seekest to go to thine own country? And he answered, Nothing: howbeit only let me depart.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pharao chun a kuomah, “Ka kuoma i um hin tlâksam ieng am i nei leh, ngai ta, chuonga in ram tienga fe nâwk i tum el chu?” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “Ieng dang rak khawm a ni chuong nawh; nisien- lakhawm, mîn fetir hrim hrim el raw khai,” a ta.

en: And God raised up another adversary unto him, Rezon the son of Eliada, who had fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin a hmêlma dingin Eliada naupa Rezon, a pu Hadadezer, Zoba lal kuoma inthawka tlânhmang ta kha a hung inngîrsuok nâwk tah a.

en: And he gathered men unto him, and became captain over a troop, when David slew them of Zobah: and they went to Damascus, and dwelt therein, and reigned in Damascus.
hmr: Davidin Zoba khuoa mihai a that khan, ama chun a kuomah mihai a kei khâwm a, sipai hotuah a hung ṭhang tah a; chun, Damaska khuoah an feh a, chutaka chun an um a, Damaska khuoa chun lalin a um tah a.

en: And he was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon, besides the mischief that Hadad did: and he abhorred Israel, and reigned over Syria.
hmr: Hadad sukrinumna belsain Solomon dam sûng po chu Israelhai hmêlma an ni rawp hrim a; Israelhai chu a theida hle el a, Suria ram sûnga chun ro a rêl a.

en: And Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephraimite of Zeredah, a servant of Solomon, whose mother’s name was Zeruah, a widow, he also lifted up his hand against the king.
hmr: Chun, Nebat naupa Jeroboam, Zereda khuoa Ephraim mi, Solomon siehlaw khawm chun (a nu hming chu Zerua a na, hmeithai a nih) lal chunga chun a kut ân let veh a.

en: And this was the reason why he lifted up his hand against the king: Solomon built Millo, and repaired the breach of the city of David his father.
hmr: Lal chunga a kut a hung inletna san chu hieng ang hi a nih; Solomon chun Millo chu a siem a, a pa David khuo chu a sietna laihai chu a siem ṭhah a.

en: And the man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valor; and Solomon saw the young man that he was industrious, and he gave him charge over all the labor of the house of Joseph.
hmr: Chu Jeroboam chu mi hrât huoisen a na, chuongchun, Solomon chun chu tlangvâl chu mi taima- tak niha a hriet leiin Josef sûnghai po po chunga sinthaw hotuah a siem a.

en: And it came to pass at that time, when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way; now Ahijah had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alone in the field.
hmr: Chun, chuong lai chun hieng ang hi a hung na, Jeroboam chu Jerusalem khuoa a fe suok chu Silo zâwlnei Ahija chun lampuia chun a lo hmuh a; Ahija chun puon thar hi a sil a, an pahni chau chun phûla chun an um hmunkhat a.

en: And Ahijah laid hold of the new garment that was on him, and rent it in twelve pieces.
hmr: Chun, Ahija chun a puon thar sil chu a lâk a, her sâwmpahniah a keithlêr a.

en: And he said to Jeroboam, Take thee ten pieces; for thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, Behold, I will rend the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to thee
hmr: Jeroboam kuoma chun, “Her sâwm hi la raw khai, LALPA Israel- hai Pathien chun hieng ang hin a ti a nih, ‘Ngai ta, ram hi Solomon hi lâkpêk ka ta, hmun sâwm chu ka pêk ding che a nih.

en: (but he shall have one tribe, for my servant David’s sake and for Jerusalem’s sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel);
hmr: Amiruokchu, ka siehlaw David lei le, Israel hnam po po laia ka thlang khawpui Jerusalem lei hin hnam khat chu nei a tih,

en: because that they have forsaken me, and have worshipped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, Chemosh the god of Moab, and Milcom the god of the children of Ammon; and they have not walked in my ways, to do that which is right in mine eyes, and to keep my statutes and mine ordinances, as did David his father.
hmr: ama chun a mi mâksan a, Zidon mi pathiennu Astoreth hai, Moabhai pathien Kemos hai, Ammonhai thlahai pathien Milkom hai dâm a biek lei le ka mithmua thilṭha thaw ding le ka thuruothai le ka rorêlhai hi pawm dinga a pa David anga ka lampuihai a hraw naw leiin.

en: Howbeit I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand; but I will make him prince all the days of his life, for David my servant’s sake whom I chose, who kept my commandments and my statutes;
hmr: Ram pumpui chu lâkpêk naw ning a, amiruokchu, ka thupêkhai le ka thuruothai pawmtu ka thlang, ka siehlaw David leiin a dam sûng chu lalah lân umtir hrîng ka tih,

en: but I will take the kingdom out of his son’s hand, and will give it unto thee, even ten tribes.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, ram hi a naupa chu lâkpêk ka ta, nang hi ka pêk ding che a nih, hnam sâwmhai chu.

en: And unto his son will I give one tribe, that David my servant may have a lamp alway before me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen me to put my name there.
hmr: Chun, ka siehlaw Davidin ka hming inumtirna dinga ka thlang khawpui Jerusalema hin ka hmaa khâwnvar a nei zing theina dingin hnam khat chu a naupa chu pêng ka tih.

en: And I will take thee, and thou shalt reign according to all that thy soul desireth, and shalt be king over Israel.
hmr: Nang hi ruot ka ti cheh a, i nuom ang angin ro rêl i ta; Israelhai lalin um i tih.

en: And it shall be, if thou wilt hearken unto all that I command thee, and wilt walk in my ways, and do that which is right in mine eyes, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with thee, and will build thee a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel unto thee.
hmr: Chun, thu ka pêk ang taphawt che i pawm a, ka lampuihai i hrawh a, ka siehlaw David anga ka thuruothai le ka thupêkhai zâwm dinga ka mithmua thilṭha i thaw chun i kuom- ah um pei ka ta, David kân ngîrpêk ang khan sûngkuo nghettak inngîr- pêk ka ti che a, Israelhai hi pêng ka ti che.

en: And I will for this afflict the seed of David, but not for ever.
hmr: Chuleiin, David thla chu ka sukrinum ding a nih, amiruokchu, kumkhuo chun chu ni naw nih,’ tiin” a tih a.

en: Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam; but Jeroboam arose, and fled into Egypt, unto Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun Jeroboam chu that a tum tah a, nisienlakhawm, Jeroboam chu a tho a, Aigupta ramah, Aigupta ram lal Sisak kuomah a tlân tah a, Solomon thi hmakhat chun Aigupta rama chun a um tah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, and all that he did, and his wisdom, are they not written in the book of the acts of Solomon?
hmr: Solomon chanchin danghai le a thilthaw po pohai le a varna dâm chu Solomon thilthawhai ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.
hmr: Solomon chun Israelhai po po chunga Jerusalem khuoa ro a rêl sûng chu kum sâwmli a nih.

en: And Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chu a puhai kuoma chun a in tah a, a pa David khawpuia chun an phûm tah a; chun, a naupa Rehoboam chu ama aiaw chun ân lal tah a.

en: And Rehoboam went to Shechem: for all Israel were come to Shechem to make him king.
hmr: Chun, Rehoboam chu Sekem khuoah a feh a, Israelhai po po chu Sekem khuoa chun ama lala siem dingin an fe ta sih a.

en: And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard of it (for he was yet in Egypt, whither he had fled from the presence of king Solomon, and Jeroboam dwelt in Egypt,
hmr: Chun, Nebat naupa Jeroboam chun chuong thu chu a lo hriet chun (lal Solomona inthawka a tlânhmang- na Aigupta rama la um a na, chuong- chun Jeroboam Aigupta rama la um zing chu an zûn kotir a),

en: and they sent and called him), that Jeroboam and all the assembly of Israel came, and spake unto Rehoboam, saying,
hmr: Jeroboam le sipai pungkhâwm- hai po po chu an hung a, Rehoboam kuoma chun,

en: Thy father made our yoke grievous: now therefore make thou the grievous service of thy father, and his heavy yoke which he put upon us, lighter, and we will serve thee.
hmr: “I pa khan kan rîngkawl a sukrik êm hlak a, chuleiin, i pa mi sawr rimsikna le, a rîngkawl riktak kan chunga ân nghat hi mi sukzângpêk la, chuongchun, i rawng bâwl kan tih,” tiin an hung hril a.

en: And he said unto them, Depart yet for three days, then come again to me. And the people departed.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Ni thum sûng chu lo va fe kieng phawt unla, chun, ka kuomah hung nâwk ro,” a ta. Chun, mipuihai chu an fe kieng ta phawt a.

en: And king Rehoboam took counsel with the old men, that had stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, saying, What counsel give ye me to return answer to this people?
hmr: Chun, lal Rehoboam chun a pa Solomon dam laia a kâwla um hlak upahai chu, “Hieng mipuihai hi ka dawn dân ding remchâng ieng am mi ruotpui in ta le?” a ta.

en: And they spake unto him, saying, If thou wilt be a servant unto this people this day, and wilt serve them, and answer them, and speak good words to them, then they will be thy servants for ever.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Tuhin hienghai siehlawa hin i um a, an rawng i bâwl a, anni chu i dawn a, an kuoma thu ṭhatak hril i tum chun, kumkhawtluongin i siehlawah um an tih,” tiin an hril a.

en: But he forsook the counsel of the old men which they had given him, and took counsel with the young men that were grown up with him, that stood before him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, upahai rem- ruotpui chu a pawm nawh a, ama ruolpui tlângvâlhai, ama kâwla um hlakhai chu a râwn ta lem a.

en: And he said unto them, What counsel give ye, that we may return answer to this people, who have spoken to me, saying, Make the yoke that thy father did put upon us lighter?
hmr: An kuoma chun, “Hieng mipui- hai, ka kuoma, ‘I pain ka chunga rîngkawl ân nghat hi mi sukzângpêk rawh,’ tiha hriltuhai hi ka dawn dân ding rem ieng am in mi ruotpuia le?” a tih a.

en: And the young men that were grown up with him spake unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou say unto this people that spake unto thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it lighter unto us; thus shalt thou speak unto them, My little finger is thicker than my father’s loins.
hmr: Chun, ama ruolpui tlangvâlhai chun a kuomah, “Hieng mipuihai, ‘I pa khan kan rîngkawl a sukrik êm hlak a, nang chun chu mi sukzângpêk raw khai,’ i kuoma tituhai kuoma chun, hieng ang hin ti la, hieng ang hin an kuoma chun hril rawh, ‘Ka pa kâwng nêk chun ka kutte khawm hi a lien lem a.

en: And now whereas my father did lade you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
hmr: Ka pa khan rîngkawl riktak a lo inbâttir cheu a, kei chun in rîngkawl chu ka belsa ding a nih, ka pa chun vuoknain a lo hrâwk hlak cheu a, kei ruok chun chu ainuvêtin ka hrâwk ding cheu a nih,’ tiin,” an hril a.

en: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king bade, saying, Come to me again the third day.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jeroboam le mi- puihai po po chu lalin, ni thum chinah ka kuomah hung nâwk ro tia a hril ang khan a ni thum ni chun Rehoboam kuoma chun an va feh a.

en: And the king answered the people roughly, and forsook the counsel of the old men which they had given him,
hmr: Chun, lal chun mipuihai chu inrumtakin a lo dawn a, upahai rem- ruotpui kha a pawm nawh a,

en: and spake to them after the counsel of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add to your yoke: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
hmr: tlangvâlhai remruotpui ang khan, “Ka pa chun in rîngkawl a lo sukrik a, kei chun chu in rîngkawl chu ka belsa ding a nih, ka pa chun vuoknain a lo hrâwk hlak cheu a, kei chun chu ainuvêtin ka hrâwk lem ding cheu a nih,” a ta.

en: So the king hearkened not unto the people; for it was a thing brought about of Jehovah, that he might establish his word, which Jehovah spake by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun, mipuihai thuhril kha a pawm ta nawh a, chu chu LALPA lei a nih, LALPA chun Silo mi Ahija hmanga, Nebat naupa Jeroboam kuoma a thu lo hril ta kha a suknghet theina dingin.

en: And when all Israel saw that the king hearkened not unto them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse: to your tents, O Israel: now see to thine own house, David. So Israel departed unto their tents.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai po po chun lalin an thuhril a pawm nawh ti an hrietin, mipuihai chun, “David a hin chanvo ieng am ei nei leh? Jesai naupaa hin rohluo ding ei nei chuong bawk nawh: Aw Israelhai, in puon in tieng fe vawng ro, David, i sûngkuo chu ngai- tuo el rawh,” tiin lal chu an dawn a. Chuongchun, Israelhai chu an puon in tieng chun an fe tah a.

en: But as for the children of Israel that dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.
hmr: Israel thla Juda ram khuoa umhai chunga ruok chun Rehoboam chun ro a rêl a.

en: Then king Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was over the men subject to taskwork; and all Israel stoned him to death with stones. And king Rehoboam made speed to get him up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Rehoboam chun sinthawa ruoi luihai hotu Ado- niram chu a tir a, ama chu Israelhai po po chun lungin an lo dêng a, a thi tah a. Chun, lal Rehoboam chu Jeru- salem khuoa tlân hmang tumin a taw lailîra chun a chuong kai vat tah a.

en: So Israel rebelled against the house of David unto this day.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israelhai chu David sûnghai chunga chun an hung hel tah a nih, tu chen el hin.

en: And it came to pass, when all Israel heard that Jeroboam was returned, that they sent and called him unto the congregation, and made him king over all Israel: there was none that followed the house of David, but the tribe of Judah only.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai po po chun Jeroboam chu a hung kîr nâwk ti an hrietin, pungkhâwmnaa hung dingin an inkotir a, Israelhai po po chunga lalah an siem tah a; Juda hnam ti chau naw chu David sûnghai zui tukhawm an um nawh.

en: And when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, he assembled all the house of Judah, and the tribe of Benjamin, a hundred and fourscore thousand chosen men, that were warriors, to fight against the house of Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam the son of Solomon.
hmr: Chun, Rehoboam chun Jerusa- lem khuo a hang tlung chun, Israel sûnghai chu doa Solomon naupa Rehoboam ram la nâwk dingin Juda sûnghai po po le Benjamin hnam mi huoisen ruok thlang suok, nuoi khat le sîng riet zet ân khâwm a.

en: But the word of God came unto Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathien mi Semaia kuomah Pathien thu a hung tlung a,

en: Speak unto Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and unto all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people, saying,
hmr: “Judai ram lal Solomon naupa Rehoboam le Juda le Benjamin sûng- hai po po kuoma le mipui danghai kuoma chun,

en: Thus saith Jehovah, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brethren the children of Israel: return every man to his house; for this thing is of me. So they hearkened unto the word of Jehovah, and returned and went their way, according to the word of Jehovah.
hmr: ‘LALPAIN hieng ang hin a tih, Hang fe naw rawh, Israel thla in unauhai chu hang do bawk naw ro, mâni in tieng seng fe nâwk ta ro, hi hi keima thaw a nih,’ tiin hril rawh,” tiin. Chuongchun, LALPA thu chu an awi a, LALPA thu ang chun an kîr a, an fe nâwk ta vawng a.

en: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in the hill-country of Ephraim, and dwelt therein; and he went out from thence, and built Penuel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jeroboam chun Ephraim tlâng rama chun Sekem khuo a siem a, chutaka chun a um a, chun, chutaka inthawk chun a suok a, Penuel khuo a siem a.

en: And Jeroboam said in his heart, Now will the kingdom return to the house of David:
hmr: Chun, Jeroboam chun a lung- rilin, “Ram hi David sûnghai ta hi a hung ni nâwk el âwm ie,

en: if this people go up to offer sacrifices in the house of Jehovah at Jerusalem, then will the heart of this people turn again unto their lord, even unto Rehoboam king of Judah; and they will kill me, and return to Rehoboam king of Judah.
hmr: hienghairawi hi Jerusalem khuoa LALPA ina inthâwinahai in- hlân dinga an hang fe chun hienghai lungril hi an lalpa Rehoboam, Juda ram lal tieng hin thle nâwk el a ta, chuongchun, kei hi mi that an ta, Juda ram lal Rehoboam tieng an kawp nâwk el âwm ie,” a ta.

en: Whereupon the king took counsel, and made two calves of gold; and he said unto them, It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem: behold thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee up out of the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun mi a râwn a, rângkachak bâwngte lim, pa- hni a siem a, an kuoma chun, “In ta dingin Jerusalem khuoa hang fe chu ân tak talaw êm a, aw Israelhai, en ta u; Aigupta rama inthawka ṭhuoi suoktu cheu in pathienhai hi,” a ta.

en: And he set the one in Beth-el, and the other put he in Dan.
hmr: Chun, pakhat chu Bethelah a sieh a, pakhat chu Danah a sieh a.

en: And this thing became a sin; for the people went to worship before the one, even unto Dan.
hmr: Chu thil chu suol a hung ni ta a nih, mipuihai chu an pahnia be ding chun Dan chen rauin an va fe hlak sih a.

en: And he made houses of high places, and made priests from among all the people, that were not of the sons of Levi.
hmr: Chun, bâwlhmun inhai a bâwl a, Levi nauhai ni lo, vântlâng laia mihai thiempuah a siem a.

en: And Jeroboam ordained a feast in the eighth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, like unto the feast that is in Judah, and he went up unto the altar; so did he in Beth-el, sacrificing unto the calves that he had made: and he placed in Beth-el the priests of the high places that he had made.
hmr: Chun, Jeroboam chun Juda rama ruoiṭhe an nei hlak ang bawkin thla rietna, chu thla ni sâwm le ni nga ni chu ruoiṭhe niah a ruot veh a, maichâma chun an hang feh a, Bethela chun a bâwngte lim siem kâwla inthâwiin chuong ang chun an thaw a nih; chun, a siem bâwl- hmun thiempuhai chu Bethela chun a sieh a.

en: And he went up unto the altar which he had made in Beth-el on the fifteenth day in the eighth month, even in the month which he had devised of his own heart: and he ordained a feast for the children of Israel, and went up unto the altar, to burn incense.
hmr: Chun, amain a dit anga a ruot thla ngei, thla rietna, ni sâwm le ni nga nia chun Bethela a maichâm siema chun a hang feh a, chun, Israel thlahai ta dingin ruoiṭhe ni a ruot a, maichâma riminhnik raw dingin a hang feh a.

en: And, behold, there came a man of God out of Judah by the word of Jehovah unto Beth-el: and Jeroboam was standing by the altar to burn incense.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, Judai rama inthawkin Pathien mi, LALPA thuin Bethelah a hang feh a, chun, Jeroboam chu riminhnik raw dingin maichâm bula chun a lo ngîr a.

en: And he cried against the altar by the word of Jehovah, and said, O altar, altar, thus saith Jehovah: Behold, a son shall be born unto the house of David, Josiah by name; and upon thee shall he sacrifice the priests of the high places that burn incense upon thee, and men’s bones shall they burn upon thee.
hmr: Chun, LALPA thuin maichâm chu a hrângkhum a, “Aw maichâm, maichâm, LALPA CHUN HIENG ANG HIN A TIH, ‘Ngai ta, David sûnghai laiah naupa a hming Josia la hung pieng a ta, i chunga riminhnik raw hlaktu, bâwlhmun thiempuhai hi i chunga hin inthâwina dingin la hung inhlân a tih, i chunga hin mihriem ruhai la hung râwng an tih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: And he gave a sign the same day, saying, This is the sign which Jehovah hath spoken: Behold, the altar shall be rent, and the ashes that are upon it shall be poured out.
hmr: Chun, chu ni ma chun inchikna a pêk a, “Hi hi LALPAIN inchikna ding a ti chu a nih, ‘Ngai ta, maichâm hi la kawi phawk a ta, a chunga meivâm- hai hi lân baw vawng a tih,’ ti hi,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass, when the king heard the saying of the man of God, which he cried against the altar in Beth-el, that Jeroboam put forth his hand from the altar, saying, Lay hold on him. And his hand, which he put forth against him, dried up, so that he could not draw it back again to him.
hmr: Chun, Pathien miin Bethela maichâm a hang hrângkhum lalin a lo hriet chun, Jeroboam chun, “Man ro,” tiin maichâma inthawk chun a kutin a hei ban a. Chun, man tuma a banna kut chu a hung zeng tah a, chuongchun, a kut chu a lâk nâwk thei ta nawh a.

en: The altar also was rent, and the ashes poured out from the altar, according to the sign which the man of God had given by the word of Jehovah.
hmr: Pathien miin LALPA thua in- chikna ding a hril ang khan maichâm khawm chu a kawi phawk a, mai- châma meivâmhai chu ân baw ta vawng a.

en: And the king answered and said unto the man of God, Entreat now the favor of Jehovah thy God, and pray for me, that my hand may be restored me again. And the man of God entreated Jehovah, and the king’s hand was restored him again, and became as it was before.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a dawn a, Pathien mi kuoma chun, “Ka kut hi a hung dam nâwk theina dingin LALPA i Pathien ngên la, mi ṭawngṭaipêk ta khai,” a ta. Chun, Pathien mi chun LALPA kuoma chun a ngên a; chun, lal kut chu a hung dam nâwk tah a, a hma ang bawkin a hung um nâwk tah a.

en: And the king said unto the man of God, Come home with me, and refresh thyself, and I will give thee a reward.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun Pathien mi kuoma chun, “Ka in tieng ka kuomah hung la, va châwl hadam hri raw khai, chun, lâwmman khawm ka pêk ding che annâwm,” a ta.

en: And the man of God said unto the king, If thou wilt give me half thy house, I will not go in with thee, neither will I eat bread nor drink water in this place;
hmr: Chun, Pathien mi chun lal kuom- ah, “I insûng zâtve khawm mi pe ding ni la, i kuoma chun hung chuong naw ning ah, hi hmuna hin bei ka fâkin tui hrim hrim khawm ka dâwn ding a ni nawh;

en: for so was it charged me by the word of Jehovah, saying, Thou shalt eat no bread, nor drink water, neither return by the way that thou camest.
hmr: ‘Bei va fain, tui hrim hrim khawm va dâwn naw la, i va fena lampuia khawm kîr nâwk ta naw rawh,’ tia LALPA thua tir ka nih i sawnnaw,” a ta.

en: So he went another way, and returned not by the way that he came to Beth-el.
hmr: Chuongchun, lampui dangah a feh a, Bethel hung pana a hungna lampuia chun a fe nâwk ta nawh a.

en: Now there dwelt an old prophet in Beth-el; and one of his sons came and told him all the works that the man of God had done that day in Beth-el: the words which he had spoken unto the king, them also they told unto their father.
hmr: Chuong lai chun Bethel khuoa chun zâwlnei tar pakhat hi a um a, a naupasalhai chun chu nia Bethela Pathien mi thilthawhai po po chu ama chu an hril vawng a; lal kuoma a thu hril khawm chu an pa an hril a.

en: And their father said unto them, What way went he? Now his sons had seen what way the man of God went, that came from Judah.
hmr: Chun, an pa chun an kuomah, “Khaw tieng lampui am a fe ta leh?” a ta. A naupasalhai chun Juda rama inthawka hung Pathien mi fe nâwkna lampui chu an khîkhmuh a.

en: And he said unto his sons, Saddle me the ass. So they saddled him the ass; and he rode thereon.
hmr: Chuongchun, a naupasalhai kuomah, “Sabengtung mi hung siem- pêk ta u,” a ta. Chuongchun, sabeng- tung chu an siempêk a, a chuong tah a.

en: And he went after the man of God, and found him sitting under an oak; and he said unto him, Art thou the man of God that camest from Judah? And he said, I am.
hmr: Chun, Pathien mi chu a hnawt tah a, thingsaisaw hnuoia ṭhung hi a va hmuh a, a kuomah, “Nang hi i ni maw Juda rama inthawka hung Pathien mi chu?” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “Nih e,” a ta.

en: Then he said unto him, Come home with me, and eat bread.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chun a kuomah, “Ka in tieng ka kuomah hung la, bei va fa raw khai,” a ta.

en: And he said, I may not return with thee, nor go in with thee; neither will I eat bread nor drink water with thee in this place:
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “I ruola kîr nâwk thei ka ni nawh a, i kuoma hung thei khawm ka ni bawk nawh; hi hmuna hin i kuomah bei fa naw ning a, tui hrim hrim khawm dâwn naw ning ah.

en: for it was said to me by the word of Jehovah, Thou shalt eat no bread nor drink water there, nor turn again to go by the way that thou camest.
hmr: ‘Bei va fain tui hrim hrim khawm va dâwn naw la, i va fena lampuia khawm kîr nâwk ta naw rawh,’ tiha, LALPA thua hril ka ni sih a” a ta.

en: And he said unto him, I also am a prophet as thou art; and an angel spake unto me by the word of Jehovah, saying, Bring him back with thee into thy house, that he may eat bread and drink water. But he lied unto him.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “Kei khawm nanga ang bawka zâwlnei ka ni annâwm, vântirkoin, LALPA thuin, ‘Bei dâm fah a, tui dâm dâwn dingin i in tieng ṭhuoikîr nâwk raw khai,’ tiin a mi biek i sawnnaw,” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, a kuoma chun khêl a hril a nih.

en: So he went back with him, and did eat bread in his house, and drank water.
hmr: Chuongchun, a kuoma chun a kîr ve nâwk a, a ina chun bei dâm a fâkin tui dâm a dâwn tah a.

en: And it came to pass, as they sat at the table, that the word of Jehovah came unto the prophet that brought him back;
hmr: Chun, dawkân an awt lai chun a ṭhuoi kîrtu zâwlnei kuomah LALPA thu chu a hung tlung a;

en: and he cried unto the man of God that came from Judah, saying, Thus saith Jehovah, Forasmuch as thou hast been disobedient unto the mouth of Jehovah, and hast not kept the commandment which Jehovah thy God commanded thee,
hmr: Juda rama inthawka hung Pathien mi kuoma chun, “LALPAIN hieng ang hin a tih, LALPA thuhril i awi nawh a, LALPA i Pathienin thu a pêk che i pawm naw lei le,

en: but camest back, and hast eaten bread and drunk water in the place of which he said to thee, Eat no bread, and drink no water; thy body shall not come unto the sepulchre of thy fathers.
hmr: i hung kîr nâwk a, ‘Bei va fain, tui hrim hrim khawm va dâwn naw rawh,’ a tina hmun ngeiah, bei i fâk a, tui dâm i dâwn leiin i ruong hi i puhai thlâna sie ni ve naw nih, tiin,” tiin a hril suok tah a.

en: And it came to pass, after he had eaten bread, and after he had drunk, that he saddled for him the ass, to wit, for the prophet whom he had brought back.
hmr: Chun, bei dâm a fâk a, tui dâm a dâwn zo chun zâwlnei a ṭhuoi kîr nâwk chu sabengtung a siem- pêk a.

en: And when he was gone, a lion met him by the way, and slew him: and his body was cast in the way, and the ass stood by it; the lion also stood by the body.
hmr: Chun, a fe chu lampuia chun sakeibaknei leh an intuok tah a; a lo se tah a; a ruong chu lampuia chun inthal dêr hin a um a, sabengtung chu a kâwla chun a ngîr a, sakeibaknei khawm chu ruong bula chun a ngîr ve zing a.

en: And, behold, men passed by, and saw the body cast in the way, and the lion standing by the body; and they came and told it in the city where the old prophet dwelt.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, mihai an va feh a, lampuia ruong inthal dêra um le, ruong bula sakeibaknei ngîr zing chu an va hmuh a, zâwlnei tartak umna khuoa chun an va hril a.

en: And when the prophet that brought him back from the way heard thereof, he said, It is the man of God, who was disobedient unto the mouth of Jehovah: therefore Jehovah hath delivered him unto the lion, which hath torn him, and slain him, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spake unto him.
hmr: Chun, lampuia va ṭhuoi kîr nâwktu zâwlnei chun chu thu chu a lo hriet phing chun, “Pathien mi, LALPA thu hril awi nuom nawpa kha a ni chu; LALPAIN a kuoma a hril, a thu ang peiin, LALPAIN sakeibaknei kuomah a pêk a, a lo ham a, a se hlum tah a ni chu,” a ta.

en: And he spake to his sons, saying, Saddle me the ass. And they saddled it.
hmr: Chun, a naupasalhai kuoma chun, “Sabengtung mi siemrêlpêk ta u,” tiin a hril a. Chun, an siempêk tah a.

en: And he went and found his body cast in the way, and the ass and the lion standing by the body: the lion had not eaten the body, nor torn the ass.
hmr: Chun, a fe tah a, a ruong lampuia inthal dêra lo um le, sabeng- tung le sakeibaknei ruong bula lo ngîr zing chu a va hmuh a; sakeibaknei chun ruong chu a lo la fâk nawh a, sabengtung khawm chu a lo la sukpawp naw bawk a.

en: And the prophet took up the body of the man of God, and laid it upon the ass, and brought it back; and he came to the city of the old prophet, to mourn, and to bury him.
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei chun Pathien mi ruong chu ân hlawm a, sabengtung chunga chun a sie kai a, a kîrpui nâwk tah a; chuongchun, zâwlnei putar umna khuoa chun sûn ding le vûi dingin a lût tah a.

en: And he laid his body in his own grave; and they mourned over him, saying, Alas, my brother!
hmr: Chun, a ruong chu ama thlâna chun ân zâl a, chuongchun, “A va pawi ngei maw, ka unaupa,” tiin a ṭah a.

en: And it came to pass, after he had buried him, that he spake to his sons, saying, When I am dead, then bury me in the sepulchre wherein the man of God is buried; lay my bones beside his bones.
hmr: Chun, a vûi hnung chun a nau- pasalhai kuomah, “Ka thi pha chun Pathien mi phûmna thlâna hin mi hung phûm ve unla; a ru bula chun ka ruhai hi hung sie unla.

en: For the saying which he cried by the word of Jehovah against the altar in Beth-el, and against all the houses of the high places which are in the cities of Samaria, shall surely come to pass.
hmr: Pathien thua Bethela maichâm le, Samari ram khawpuihaia bâwl- hmun inhai po po a hrângkhumna thu kha hung tlung ngei ngei ding a ni sih a,” tiin a hril a.

en: After this thing Jeroboam returned not from his evil way, but made again from among all the people priests of the high places: whosoever would, he consecrated him, that there might be priests of the high places.
hmr: Chuong thil hnunga khawm chun Jeroboam chun a umdân indik- naw chu a la bân chuong nawh a, vântlâng laia mihai bâwlhmun thiempu dingin a la siem ta rawp a; bâwlhmun thiempuhai an um theina dingin a nuom taphawthai chu a la suktum ta rawp a.

en: And this thing became sin unto the house of Jeroboam, even to cut it off, and to destroy it from off the face of the earth.
hmr: Chun, thil chu Jeroboam sûng- kuo suolna, anni ngei sukchimittu le khawvêla inthawka sukbohmang hlautu a hung ni tah a.

en: At that time Abijah the son of Jeroboam fell sick.
hmr: Chuong lai chun Jeroboam naupa Abija chu a damnawh a.

en: And Jeroboam said to his wife, Arise, I pray thee, and disguise thyself, that thou be not known to be the wife of Jeroboam; and get thee to Shiloh: behold, there is Ahijah the prophet, who spake concerning me that I should be king over this people.
hmr: Chun, Jeroboam chun a nuhmei kuomah, “Tho la, Jeroboam nuhmei a nih ti an hriet nawna ding chein insukdanglam la, Silo-ah va fe ta khai; ngai ta, chutaka chun zâwlnei Ahija, hieng mihai chunga lala ka la um dingzie, ka chungchâng thu hriltu kha a um ie.

en: And take with thee ten loaves, and cakes, and a cruse of honey, and go to him: he will tell thee what shall become of the child.
hmr: Beiphêk sâwm le, bei tlang chitê tê, khuoizu bûr khat leh chawi la, a kuomah va fe ta, naupang um dân ding chu lo hril a ti che,” a ta.

en: And Jeroboam’s wife did so, and arose, and went to Shiloh, and came to the house of Ahijah. Now Ahijah could not see; for his eyes were set by reason of his age.
hmr: Chun, Jeroboam nuhmei chun chuong ang chun a thawh a, a tho a, Silo-a chun a feh a, Ahija ina chun a va fe tah a, Ahija chun khuo khawm a hmu thei ta nawh a, a upat leiin a mit ân thim sih a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Ahijah, Behold, the wife of Jeroboam cometh to inquire of thee concerning her son; for he is sick: thus and thus shalt thou say unto her; for it will be, when she cometh in, that she will feign herself to be another woman.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Ahija kuomah, “Ngai ta, Jeroboam nuhmei a naupa chungchâng thua râwn ding chein a hung a; a damnaw a na, hieng ang hin lo hril rawh; hieng ang hi nîng a ta, a hung lût pha chun, nuhmei dang ni âwmtakin a hung insiem ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And it was so, when Ahijah heard the sound of her feet, as she came in at the door, that he said, Come in, thou wife of Jeroboam; why feignest thou thyself to be another? for I am sent to thee with heavy tidings.
hmr: Chun, Ahija chun chuonga kawt- khâra a hung lût laia a ke sir ri a hei hriet phing chun, “Nang Jeroboam nuhmei, hung lût raw khai, iengtiziea mi danga insiem am i nih a? Chanchin ṭha nawtak hril ding chea hril ka nih i sawnnaw.

en: Go, tell Jeroboam, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel: Forasmuch as I exalted thee from among the people, and made thee prince over my people Israel,
hmr: Fe nâwk ta la, Jeroboam kuom- ah, ‘LALPA Israelhai Pathienin hieng ang hin a tih, Mipuihaia inthawk hin ka dawmsâng cheh a, ka mi Israelhai chunga hin hotuah ka siem cheh a,

en: and rent the kingdom away from the house of David, and gave it thee; and yet thou hast not been as my servant David, who kept my commandments, and who followed me with all his heart, to do that only which was right in mine eyes,
hmr: David sûnghai ram ka lâkpêk a, chu chu ka pêk cheh a; nisienla- khawm, nang chu ka siehlaw David angin i um ve nawh a; ama chun chu ka thupêkhai a pawm a, ka mithmua thilṭha chau thaw tumin a lungril po poin a mi zui hlak a;

en: but hast done evil above all that were before thee, and hast gone and made thee other gods, and molten images, to provoke me to anger, and hast cast me behind thy back:
hmr: nang ruok chun chu i hmaa mihai po po nêkin thil i suksuol nasa bîk a, mi suklunginsenna dingin pathien danghai le milim sunghai i siem a, hnung i mîn nghatsan tah a,

en: therefore, behold, I will bring evil upon the house of Jeroboam, and will cut off from Jeroboam every man-child, him that is shut up and him that is left at large in Israel, and will utterly sweep away the house of Jeroboam, as a man sweepeth away dung, till it be all gone.
hmr: chuleiin, ngai ta, Jeroboam sûng- kuo chunga hin thil ṭha naw hung intlungtir ka ta. Jeroboama inthawk hin naupasal taphawt chu Israel rama mi khuokhira um le, khuokhir naw khawm sukbohmang ka ta, miin êk a phît fai rêt ang hin Jeroboam sûngkuo hi a mang dêr hmakhat chun ka phît fai rêt ding a nih.

en: Him that dieth of Jeroboam in the city shall the dogs eat; and him that dieth in the field shall the birds of the heavens eat: for Jehovah hath spoken it.
hmr: Jeroboam sûngkuo laia mi, khawpuia thi taphawthai chu uiin fâng an ta; rama thi taphawthai chu chunglêng vatehaiin fâng an tih; chu chu LALPAIN a hril tah a nih,’ ti rawh.

en: Arise thou therefore, get thee to thy house: and when thy feet enter into the city, the child shall die.
hmr: Chuongchun, tho la, i in tieng fe nâwk el rawh, khawpui sûng i sir phingleh naupang chu a thi ding a nih.

en: And all Israel shall mourn for him, and bury him; for he only of Jeroboam shall come to the grave, because in him there is found some good thing toward Jehovah, the God of Israel, in the house of Jeroboam.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israelhai po po chun sûn an ta, vui an tih; Jeroboam sûngkuo lai chun ama chau chu thlâna sie ding a ni ding a ni sih a; Jeroboam sûngkuo lai hin ama chaua hin LALPA Israelhai Pathien chunga ṭhatna ieng amanih ân lang leiin.

en: Moreover Jehovah will raise him up a king over Israel, who shall cut off the house of Jeroboam that day: but what? even now.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN tu ela Jero- boam sûngkuo hung sukbohmangtu ding Israelhai chunga lal siem a ta; tuta inthawk ngei hin.

en: For Jehovah will smite Israel, as a reed is shaken in the water; and he will root up Israel out of this good land which he gave to their fathers, and will scatter them beyond the River, because they have made their Asherim, provoking Jehovah to anger.
hmr: LALPA chun tuia phairuong kûng inhnîng inhnîng angin Israelhai chu hung vaw hnîng a ta; chuong- chun, LALPA lung suksena an Aserahai chu an siem leiin, an puhai a lo pêk tah, hi ram ṭhataka inthawk hin Israelhai chu la keidawk fai vawng a ta, vadung khêl tienga chun la sukdar vawng a tih.

en: And he will give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam, which he hath sinned, and wherewith he hath made Israel to sin.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai chu thil insuk- suoltira a thaw Jeroboam suolnahai leiin Israelhai chu nghatsan a tih,” a ta.

en: And Jeroboam’s wife arose, and departed, and came to Tirzah: and as she came to the threshold of the house, the child died.
hmr: Chun, Jeroboam nuhmei chu a tho a, a suok tah a, Tirza khuo chu a va tlung a, chun, in kawtkhâr bul a va tlung phingle chun naupang chu a thi tah a.

en: And all Israel buried him, and mourned for him, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spake by his servant Ahijah the prophet.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN a siehlaw zâwlnei Ahija hmanga thu a lo hril ta ang ngei khan Israelhai po po chun an sûn a, an vui tah a.

en: And the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he warred, and how he reigned, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
hmr: Jeroboam chanchin dang, a râl do thu le a rorêl thu chu, ngai ta, Israelhai lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna bua chun a chuong a.

en: And the days which Jeroboam reigned were two and twenty years: and he slept with his fathers, and Nadab his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jeroboam rorêl sûng chu kum sâwmhni le kum hni a na; chun, a puhai kuoma chun a in tah a, a naupa Nadab chu a aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: And Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty and one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which Jehovah had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there: and his mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonitess.
hmr: Chun, Solomon naupa Reho- boam chu Judai ramah ân lal a. An lal tîr lai chun Rehoboam chu kum sâwmli le kum khat mi a na, LALPA- IN a hming inumtirna dinga Israel hnam po pohai laia a thlang khawpui Jerusalema chun kum sâwm le kum sari ân lal a; a nu hming chu Naama, Ammon mi a nih.

en: And Judah did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, and they provoked him to jealousy with their sins which they committed, above all that their fathers had done.
hmr: Judahai chun LALPA mit- hmua chun thil suol an thawh a; an puhai thilthaw po po khûma an suolnahai chun a thîkthu a chawktho pêk a.

en: For they also built them high places, and pillars, and Asherim, on every high hill, and under every green tree;
hmr: Tlâng insâng tina le thing hring tin hmuna hin lungphunhai phunin bâwlhmunhai le Aserahai chenin an siem bawk sih a,

en: and there were also sodomites in the land: they did according to all the abominations of the nations which Jehovah drove out before the children of Israel.
hmr: chu rama chun pasal mâni inzawrhai khawm an um a, Israel thlahai hmaah LALPAIN a hnawt- suok tah hnamhai thilthaw tir- dakum tinrêng ang chu an thaw veh a.

en: And it came to pass in the fifth year of king Rehoboam, that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem;
hmr: Chun, lal Rehoboam inlal kum nga kum chun Aigupta ram lal Sisak chun Jerusalem khuo chu a hang rûn a.

en: and he took away the treasures of the house of Jehovah, and the treasures of the king’s house; he even took away all: and he took away all the shields of gold which Solomon had made.
hmr: LALPA ina rohai le lal rohai chu a lâk a, a rêng el chun a lâk fai vawng a; Solomon rângkachak phaw siem po po khawm kha a lâksa vawng a.

en: And king Rehoboam made in their stead shields of brass, and committed them to the hands of the captains of the guard, who kept the door of the king’s house.
hmr: Chun, lal Rehoboam chun chuong aia chun dâr phawhai a siem a, lal in kawtkhâr vêngtu hotuhai ân kawltir a.

en: And it was so, that, as oft as the king went into the house of Jehovah, the guard bare them, and brought them back into the guard-chamber.
hmr: Chun, lal chu LALPA ina a lût po leh vêngtuhai chun an chawi a; chun, vêngtuhai pindana chun an sie nâwk pei hlak a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
hmr: Rehoboam chanchin le a thil- thaw danghai po po chu Juda lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
hmr: Chun, Jeroboam le Rehoboam chu indo zing zingin an um hlak a.

en: And Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and his mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonitess. And Abijam his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Rehoboam chu a puhai kuomah a in tah a, David khawpuia a puhai kuoma chun an phûm tah a; a nu hming chu Naama, Ammon mi a nih. Chun, a naupa Abijam chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat began Abijam to reign over Judah.
hmr: Tûn Nebat naupa lal Jeroboam chu kum sâwm le kum riet ân lal kum chun Judahai chungah Abijam chu ân lal ṭan a.

en: Three years reigned he in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.
hmr: Jerusalem khuoah kum thum ân lal a, a nu hming chu Maaka, Abisa- lom naunu a nih.

en: And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him; and his heart was not perfect with Jehovah his God, as the heart of David his father.
hmr: A hmaa a pain thil suol a thawhai po po kha a thaw veh a; a pu David lungril angin a lungril chu LALPA a Pathien tienga chun a ṭha famkim ve nawh a.

en: Nevertheless for David’s sake did Jehovah his God give him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him, and to establish Jerusalem;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, David leiin LALPA Pathien chun ama hnunga a naupa la tungdingna ding le Jerusalem khuo inngîr det dingin Jerusalem khuoa chun khâwnvar a pêk a.

en: because David did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, and turned not aside from anything that he commanded him all the days of his life, save only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
hmr: Hit mi Uria chungchâng ti nawa chun Davidin LALPA mithmua thil- ṭha a thaw hlak lei le a dam sûng poa thaw dinga thu a pêk taphawt chu a sêl ngai dêr naw leiin.

en: Now there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
hmr: Rehoboam chu a dam sûng po chu Jeroboam leh an indo zing zing hlak a.

en: And the rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
hmr: Abijam chanchin le a thilthaw danghai po po chu Juda lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Abijam slept with his fathers; and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Abijam le Jeroboam chu an indo hlak a. Chun, Abijam chu a puhai kuoma chun a in tah a, David khaw- puia chun an phûm tah a; ama aiawin a naupa Asa chu ân lal tah a.

en: And in the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Asa to reign over Judah.
hmr: Israel lal Jeroboam chu kum sâwmhni ân lal kum chun Asa chu Judahai chungah ân lal ṭan a.

en: And forty and one years reigned he in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.
hmr: Chun, kum sâwmli le kum khat chu Jerusalemah ân lal a, a pi hming chu Maaka, Abisalom naunu a nih.

en: And Asa did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, as did David his father.
hmr: Asa chun a pu David ang bawkin LALPA mithmua thilṭha a thaw hlak a.

en: And he put away the sodomites out of the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
hmr: Chun, pasal inzawrhai chu a rama inthawkin a hnawt suok a, a puhaiin milim an lo siemhai po po chu a sukbo vawng a.

en: And also Maacah his mother he removed from being queen, because she had made an abominable image for an Asherah; and Asa cut down her image, and burnt it at the brook Kidron.
hmr: A pi Maaka khawm chu milim tirdakumtak Asera a siempêk leiin, a lalnu nina chu a bân a; chun, Asa chun a milim siem chu a sât thlûk a, Kidron vadungah a rawh a.

en: But the high places were not taken away: nevertheless the heart of Asa was perfect with Jehovah all his days.
hmr: Bâwlhmunhai ruok chu a sukbo nawh a, nisienlakhawm, Asa lungril chu a dam sûng po chun LALPA tieng chun a ṭha famkim a nih.

en: And he brought into the house of Jehovah the things that his father had dedicated, and the things that himself had dedicated, silver, and gold, and vessels.
hmr: Chun, a pain thil a lo inhlân tasahai le ama ngeiin a lo inhlân tah, tangkaruohai, rângkachak dâm, bûr le bêlhai chu LALPA inah a lâk lût a.

en: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
hmr: Chun, Asa le Israel lal Baasa chu an inlal sûng po chu an indo zing hlak a.

en: And Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not suffer any one to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
hmr: Israel lal Baasa chun Judahai chu a hang thawh a, Juda lal Asa kuoma lût ding le suok ding dangna dingin Rama khuo a siem a.

en: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of Jehovah, and the treasures of the king’s house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants; and king Asa sent them to Ben-hadad, the son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,
hmr: Chuongchun, Asa chun LALPA ina le lal ina ro la um tangkaruo le rângkachak po po chu a lâk a, a siehlawhai a pêk a; chun, lal Asa chun Damaska khuoa um Suria lal Hezion nau Tabrimon naupa Ben- hadad kuoma chun,

en: There is a league between me and thee, between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent unto thee a present of silver and gold; go, break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
hmr: “Nang le keia kâra le ka pa le i pa kârah thuthlung a um a, ngai ta, lâwmman dingin tangkaruo le râng- kachak ka hung thawn che; thaw ta, Israel lal Baasa hin a min kiensanna dingin a kuoma i thuthlung kha ṭhiek el ta,” tiin a thawn a.

en: And Ben-hadad hearkened unto king Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel, and smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abel-beth-maacah, and all Chinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
hmr: Chun, Benhadad chun lal Asa thu chu a lo pawm a, chuongchun, Israel khuohai chu thaw dingin a sipai hotuhai a tir a. Ijon khuo dâm, Dan khuo dâm, Abel-beth-maaka khuo dâm, Kinneroth biel po po chu, Naphtali ram po po le chun a thawh a.

en: And it came to pass, when Baasha heard thereof, that he left off building Ramah, and dwelt in Tirzah.
hmr: Chun, Baasa chun chu thu chu a lo hriet phingleh Rama khaw siem chu a ma a, Tirza khuoa chun a um tah a.
