en: Then king Asa made a proclamation unto all Judah; none was exempted: and they carried away the stones of Ramah, and the timber thereof, wherewith Baasha had builded; and king Asa built therewith Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Asa chun Judai ram po poa chun thu ân phur vêl tah a; tukhawm a âwl bîk hrim hrim an um nawh, chuongchun, Baasain Rama khaw siemna dinga thing le lung a hmanghai chu an thak a; chuonghai chu hmangin lal Asa chun Mizpa khuo le Benjamin rama Geba khuo a siem a.

en: Now the rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his might, and all that he did, and the cities which he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? But in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.
hmr: Asa chanchin dang po pohai, a thilthawtheizie po pohai, a thilthaw po pohai, a khaw siemhai chu Juda lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih? Ami- ruokchu, a tar hnung chun a kea chun hri ieng amanih a hung invawi tah a.

en: And Asa slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father; and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Asa chu a puhai kuomah a in tah a, a pu David khawpuiah a puhai lai chun an phûm tah a; a naupa Jehosaphat chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: And Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah; and he reigned over Israel two years.
hmr: Chun, Jeroboam naupa Nadab chu Juda lal Asa inlal kum hninaa chun Israelhai chungah ân lal ṭan a; Israelhai chunga chun kum hni ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.
hmr: LALPA mithmuin thil ṭha naw- tak a thaw hlak a; a pa lampui hraw chu a hraw veh a, Israelhai thil insuksuoltira a suksuolna kha a thaw veh a.

en: And Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha smote him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel were laying siege to Gibbethon.
hmr: Chun, Issakar sûnghai laia mi Ahija naupa Baasa chun ama chu a phier rûk a, Philistin mihai chan, Gibbethon khuoah Baasa chun a that tah a, Nadab le Israelhai po po chun Gibbethon khuo chu an inhuol lai tak a nih.

en: Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah did Baasha slay him, and reigned in his stead.
hmr: Juda lal Asa inlal a kum thumnaah a nih Baasa chun a that a, a aiah ân lal chu.

en: And it came to pass that, as soon as he was king, he smote all the house of Jeroboam: he left not to Jeroboam any that breathed, until he had destroyed him; according unto the saying of Jehovah, which he spake by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite;
hmr: Chun, lal a hung ni phing chun a sukchimit dêr hmakhat chun Jeroboam sûnghai po po chu a that a, a dam taphawt chu pakhat khawm Jeroboam chu a hlapêk nawh a; LALPAIN Shilo khuoa mi a siehlaw Ahija hmanga a lo hril ta ang khan,

en: for the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned, and wherewith he made Israel to sin, because of his provocation wherewith he provoked Jehovah, the God of Israel, to anger.
hmr: chu chu Israelhai thil insuk- suoltira a thaw, Jeroboam suolnahai lei le LALPA Israelhai Pathien chu a suklungsen lei a nih.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Nadab chanchin danghai le a thilthaw po pohai chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
hmr: Chun, Asa le Israel lal Baasa chu an inlal sûng po chu an indo zing hlak a.

en: In the third year of Asa king of Judah began Baasha the son of Ahijah to reign over all Israel in Tirzah, and reigned twenty and four years.
hmr: Juda lal Asa inlal kum thumnaa chun Ahija naupa Baasa chu Tirza khuoah Israelhai po po chungah ân lal ṭan a, kum sâwmhni le kum li ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.
hmr: LALPA mithmuin thil ṭhanaw- tak a thaw hlak a, Jeroboam lampui hraw chu a hraw veh a, Israelhai thil insuksuoltirnaa a suksuolna kha a thaw veh a.

en: And the word of Jehovah came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,
hmr: Chun, Baasa chungchâng thuah Hanani naupa Jehu kuomah LALPA thu a hung tlung a,

en: Forasmuch as I exalted thee out of the dust, and made thee prince over my people Israel, and thou hast walked in the way of Jeroboam, and hast made my people Israel to sin, to provoke me to anger with their sins;
hmr: “Pilvuta inthawkin ka dawm sâng cheh a, ka mi Israelhai chunga hin hotuah ka siem cheh a, chun, nangin Jeroboam lampui hraw chu i hrawh a, an suolnahaia an mi suklungsenna dingin ka mi Israelhai chu thil în suksuoltir a;

en: behold, I will utterly sweep away Baasha and his house; and I will make thy house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
hmr: ngai ta, Baasa le a sûnghai hi ka sukbo hlau ding a nih; chuongchun, Nebat naupa Jeroboam sûnghai ang elin i sûnghai hi siem ka tih.

en: Him that dieth of Baasha in the city shall the dogs eat; and him that dieth of his in the field shall the birds of the heavens eat.
hmr: Baasa sûngkuohai laia khawpuia thi taphawthai chu uiin fâng an ta, chun, a sûngkuo laia mi rama thi taphawthai chu chunglêng vatehaiin fâng an tih,” tiin.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Baasha, and what he did, and his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Baasa chanchin danghai, a thilthaw dâm, a thilthawtheizie dâm chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Baasha slept with his fathers, and was buried in Tirzah; and Elah his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Baasa chu a puhai kuoma chun a in tah a, Tirza khuoah an phûm a; a naupa Ela chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: And moreover by the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani came the word of Jehovah against Baasha, and against his house, both because of all the evil that he did in the sight of Jehovah, to provoke him to anger with the work of his hands, in being like the house of Jeroboam, and because he smote him.
hmr: Chun, Baasa le a sûngkuohai chungchâng thua chun a kutsuoka LALPA suklungsenna dinga Jero- boam sûnghai hawina neia LALPA mithmua thil ṭha nawtak a thaw lei le, ama chu a that leiin Hanani naupa zâwlnei Jehu hmanga a hril LALPA thu chu a hung tlung tah a.

en: In the twenty and sixth year of Asa king of Judah began Elah the son of Baasha to reign over Israel in Tirzah, and reigned two years.
hmr: Juda lal Asa inlal kum sâwmhni le kum ruknaah Baasa naupa Ela chu Tirza khuoa Israelhai chungah ân lal ṭan a, kum hni sûng ân lal a.

en: And his servant Zimri, captain of half his chariots, conspired against him. Now he was in Tirzah, drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza, who was over the household in Tirzah:
hmr: Chun, a siehlaw Zimri, a taw- lailîr zâtve chunga hotuin ama chu a phier rûk a, chuong lai chun Tirza khuoa chun, Tirza khuoa a insûng tieng hotu Arza inah a lo dâwn in- rui a;

en: and Zimri went in and smote him, and killed him, in the twenty and seventh year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned in his stead.
hmr: chun, Juda lal Asa inlal kum sâwmhni le kum sari kum chun Zimri chu a va lût a, a thawh a, a that a, ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when he began to reign, as soon as he sat on his throne, that he smote all the house of Baasha: he left him not a single man-child, neither of his kinsfolks, nor of his friends.
hmr: Chun, ama chu a hang inlal ṭan a, a lalṭhungphaa a hang ṭhung phingle chun, Baasa sûnghai po po chu a that vawng a, a laibunghai le a ruolhai laia mi naupasal taphawt chu pakhat khawm a hla nawh.

en: Thus did Zimri destroy all the house of Baasha, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spake against Baasha by Jehu the prophet,
hmr: Chuongchun, zâwlnei Jehu hmanga Baasa chungchâng thu a lo hril ta ang khan, Zimri chun Baasa sûnghai po po chu a sukchimit vawng tah a;

en: for all the sins of Baasha, and the sins of Elah his son, which they sinned, and wherewith they made Israel to sin, to provoke Jehovah, the God of Israel, to anger with their vanities.
hmr: Lalpa Israelhai Pathien chu an khawhlonaa suklungsenna dinga Israelhai thil insuksuoltira an thaw Baasa suolna po po le, a naupa Ela suolna lei chun.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Elah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Ela chanchin danghai le a thilthawhai po po chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: In the twenty and seventh year of Asa king of Judah did Zimri reign seven days in Tirzah. Now the people were encamped against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines.
hmr: Juda lal Asa inlal kum sâwmhni le kum sari kum chun Zimri chu Tirza khuoa chun ni sari ân lal a. Philistin mihai chan, Gibbethon khuo chu mihai chun an inhuol a.

en: And the people that were encamped heard say, Zimri hath conspired, and hath also smitten the king: wherefore all Israel made Omri, the captain of the host, king over Israel that day in the camp.
hmr: Chun, ân huoltuhai chun, Zimri chun lal a phier rûk a, lal a that tah ti mi hril an lo hriet a; chuong- chun, Israelhai po po chun sipai ho- tu Omri chu, chu ni chun an riek- hmuna Israelhai lal dingin an siem tah a.

en: And Omri went up from Gibbethon, and all Israel with him, and they besieged Tirzah.
hmr: Omri chu Israelhai po po leh Gibbethon khuoa inthawk chun an hang feh a, Tirza khuo chu an hang inhuol tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when Zimri saw that the city was taken, that he went into the castle of the king’s house, and burnt the king’s house over him with fire, and died,
hmr: Chun, Zimri chun khuo chu an lâk tah ti a hriet chun, lal ina kula chun a tlânlût a, lal ina chun ân râwkhum a, a thi tah a.

en: for his sins which he sinned in doing that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, in walking in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin which he did, to make Israel to sin.
hmr: LALPA mithmua thil ṭha naw- takhai thawa a suolnahai lei le Jeroboam lampui hraw chu hraw veh a, Israelhai thil insuksuoltira a suol- na leiin.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and his treason that he wrought, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Zimri chanchin danghai le a phier rûkna thuhai chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: Then were the people of Israel divided into two parts: half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king; and half followed Omri.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel mipuihai chu pâwl hniah an hung inṭhe tah a, mipui zâtve chun Ginath naupa Tibni chu lala siem tumin an zui a; chun, a zâtvein Omri chu an zui bawk a.

en: But the people that followed Omri prevailed against the people that followed Tibni the son of Ginath: so Tibni died, and Omri reigned.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Omri zuituhai chun Ginath naupa Tibni zuituhai chu an hne tah a, chuongchun, Tibni chu a thih a, Omri chu ân lal tah a.

en: In the thirty and first year of Asa king of Judah began Omri to reign over Israel, and reigned twelve years: six years reigned he in Tirzah.
hmr: Juda lal Asa inlal kum sâwm- thum le kum khatnaah Omri chu Israelhai chungah ân lal ṭan a, kum sâwm le kum hni sûng ân lal a; Tirza khuoa chun kum ruk ân lal a.

en: And he bought the hill Samaria of Shemer for two talents of silver; and he built on the hill, and called the name of the city which he built, after the name of Shemer, the owner of the hill, Samaria.
hmr: Semer ta Samari tlâng chu tangka talent hniin ân châwk a; chun, tlânga chun khuo a siem a; a khaw siem hminga chun chu tlâng neitu Semer hming chawiin Samari ân puttir a.

en: And Omri did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, and dealt wickedly above all that were before him.
hmr: Omri chun LALPA mithmua thil ṭha nawtakhai chu a thaw hlak a; a hmaa mihai po po nêkin a suksuol nasa bîk lem a.

en: For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and in his sins wherewith he made Israel to sin, to provoke Jehovah, the God of Israel, to anger with their vanities.
hmr: Nebat naupa Jeroboam thaw- dân po po kha a lâk a, an khawhlona leia LALPA Israelhai Pathien suk- lungsenna dinga Israelhai thil ân suksuoltirna ang khan a suol ve sih a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Omri which he did, and his might that he showed, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Omri thilthaw chanchin dang- hai le a thilthawtheizie a suklanghai thu chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: So Omri slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria; and Ahab his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Omri chu a puhai kuoma chun a in tah a, Samari khuoa chun an phûm a; a naupa Ahab chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: And in the thirty and eighth year of Asa king of Judah began Ahab the son of Omri to reign over Israel: and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty and two years.
hmr: Juda lal Asa inlal kum sâwm- thum le kum rietnaah Omri naupa Ahab chu Israel chungah ân lal ṭan a; chun, Omri naupa Ahab chu Samari khuoa chun Israelhai chungah kum sâwmhni le kum hni ân lal a.

en: And Ahab the son of Omri did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah above all that were before him.
hmr: Chun, Omri naupa Ahab chun a hmaa mi po pohai nêkin LALPA hmaa chun thil ṭha nawtak a thaw hlak a.

en: And it came to pass, as if it had been a light thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, that he took to wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Sidonians, and went and served Baal, and worshipped him.
hmr: Chun, Nebat naupa Jeroboam suolna ang thaw ve dâm chu ienga khawm ngailo ni âwmtakin, Zidon mihai lal Ethbaal naunu Jezebel nuhmeiah a nei a; Baal rawng dâm bâwlsanin a biek ve ta el a.

en: And he reared up an altar for Baal in the house of Baal, which he had built in Samaria.
hmr: Samari khuoa Baal in a bâwla chun Baal ta dingin maichâm a siem tah a.

en: And Ahab made the Asherah; and Ahab did yet more to provoke Jehovah, the God of Israel, to anger than all the kings of Israel that were before him.
hmr: Chun, Ahab chun Asera a siem a; a hmaa Israel lalhai po po nêkin Ahab chun LALPA Israelhai Pathien suklungsenna dingin thil a thaw nasa bîk a nih.

en: In his days did Hiel the Beth-elite build Jericho: he laid the foundation thereof with the loss of Abiram his first-born, and set up the gates thereof with the loss of his youngest son Segub, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spake by Joshua the son of Nun.
hmr: Ama ân lal lai chun Bethel mi Hielin Jeriko khuo a siem a, a nau- lutîr Abiram chu chânin a lungphûm chu a phûm a; chun, a nau mitlum Segub chu chânin a kul kawtkhâr- hai chu ân ngîr a, LALPAIN Nun naupa Josua hmanga a lo hril ta ang khan.

en: And Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the sojourners of Gilead, said unto Ahab, As Jehovah, the God of Israel, liveth, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word.
hmr: Tisbe khuo, Gilead rama Tisbe khuoa mi Elija chun Ahab kuoma chun, “LALPA, a hmaa ka ngîrna hlak, Israelhai Pathien hring- na sâlin ka hril a nih; kum ieng zât amani sûng chu ka thu naw chun ruo le dâidaw tla hrim hrim naw nih,” a ta.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto him, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu a kuomah a hung tlung a.

en: Get thee hence, and turn thee eastward, and hide thyself by the brook Cherith, that is before the Jordan.
hmr: “Hitaka inthawk hi suok la, khawsak tieng panin fe la, Jordan bula um Kerith vadunga chun hang inbihmang rawh.

en: And it shall be, that thou shalt drink of the brook; and I have commanded the ravens to feed thee there.
hmr: Chun, chu vadung tui chu tlân i ta, chutaka châwm ding chein vaâkhai thu ka pêk tah a nih,” tiin.

en: So he went and did according unto the word of Jehovah; for he went and dwelt by the brook Cherith, that is before the Jordan.
hmr: Chuongchun, a feh a, LALPA thu ang chun a thaw tah a; Jordan kâwla um Kerith vadunga chun a hang um tah a.

en: And the ravens brought him bread and flesh in the morning, and bread and flesh in the evening; and he drank of the brook.
hmr: Chun, vaâkhai chun zîngkâr hin bei le sâ an hung putpêk hlak a; zântieng chun bei le sâ an hung putpêk nâwk hlak a, chun, vadung tui chu a tlân a.

en: And it came to pass after a while, that the brook dried up, because there was no rain in the land.
hmr: Chun, a nakie deu chun hieng hi a hung na, chu rama chun ruo hrim hrim a sûr naw leiin vadung chu a hung kang tah a.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto him, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu a kuomah a hung tlung a;

en: Arise, get thee to Zarephath, which belongeth to Sidon, and dwell there: behold, I have commanded a widow there to sustain thee.
hmr: Tho la, Zidon rama Zarephath khuoah fe la, chutaka chun um rawh; ngai ta, a châwm ding chein hmeithai pakhat thu ka pêk tah,tiin.

en: So he arose and went to Zarephath; and when he came to the gate of the city, behold, a widow was there gathering sticks: and he called to her, and said, Fetch me, I pray thee, a little water in a vessel, that I may drink.
hmr: Chuongchun, a tho a, Zarephath khuoa chun a fe tah a; chun, chu khaw kul kawtkhâr chu a va tlung chun, ngai ta, hmeithai pakhat thing inkhâwm hi a lo um a; ama chu a hang ko a, bêlin tui tlâwmte mi hung lapêk ta, hang dâwn ka tih,a ta.

en: And as she was going to fetch it, he called to her, and said, Bring me, I pray thee, a morsel of bread in thy hand.
hmr: Chun, la dinga a fe lai chu a hei ko a, bei khawm tlâwmte mi hung chawipêk ta, a ta.

en: And she said, As Jehovah thy God liveth, I have not a cake, but a handful of meal in the jar, and a little oil in the cruse: and, behold, I am gathering two sticks, that I may go in and dress it for me and my son, that we may eat it, and die.
hmr: Ama chun, LALPA i Pathien hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, bei chu chu ka nei nawh a, bêla beiphit vei- khat bak le, bûrah sahriek tlâwmte chau ka nei a; chun, ngai ta, ka feh a, kei le ka naupa ta dinga siemna dingin thingrieu pahni amani chau kân khâwm a na; chuongchun, chu chu fâng kan ta, kan thi el ding a nih,a ta.

en: And Elijah said unto her, Fear not; go and do as thou hast said; but make me thereof a little cake first, and bring it forth unto me, and afterward make for thee and for thy son.
hmr: Chun, Elija chun a kuomah, “Ṭi naw rawh, i hril ang chun va thaw phawt la, amiruokchu, chu chun bei chite bêk mi hung siempêk phawt la, chu chu mi hung chawipêk la, chu zoa chun i ta ding le i naupa ta ding chu i la siem ding annâwm.

en: For thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, The jar of meal shall not waste, neither shall the cruse of oil fail, until the day that Jehovah sendeth rain upon the earth.
hmr: LALPA Israelhai Pathien chun hieng ang hin a ti a nih, ‘LALPAIN hnuoi chunga hin ruo a hung insûrtir hmakhat chun bei phit bêl chu ruok chuong naw nih a, sahriek bûr khawm kang naw nih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: And she went and did according to the saying of Elijah: and she, and he, and her house, did eat many days.
hmr: Chuongchun, Elija hril ang chun a va thawh a, chun, ama le a sûnghai le Elija le chun ni iengzât lai sûng amanih an ring a.

en: The jar of meal wasted not, neither did the cruse of oil fail, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spake by Elijah.
hmr: Elija hmanga a hril LALPA thu ang khan, beiphit bêl chu a ruok chuong nawh a, sahriek bûr khawm chu a kang bawk nawh.

en: And it came to pass after these things, that the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick; and his sickness was so sore, that there was no breath left in him.
hmr: Chun, chuong thil hnunga chun in neitunu, hmeithai naupa chu a na tah a; a na chu a na hle el a; a thuok a tâwp tah a.

en: And she said unto Elijah, What have I to do with thee, O thou man of God? thou art come unto me to bring my sin to remembrance, and to slay my son!
hmr: Chun, ama chun Elija kuomah, “Aw nang Pathien mi, nang le kei hi ieng am ei ni leh? Ka suolna inhriet- suoktir ding le ka naupa mi thatpêk dinga hung i ni hi tie!” a ta.

en: And he said unto her, Give me thy son. And he took him out of her bosom, and carried him up into the chamber, where he abode, and laid him upon his own bed.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “I naupa chu mi hung pe ta,” a ta. Chuongchun, a pawm lai chu a lâk- pêk a, a umna pindana chun a hang pawm a, ama khuma chun ân zâltir a.

en: And he cried unto Jehovah, and said, O Jehovah my God, hast thou also brought evil upon the widow with whom I sojourn, by slaying her son?
hmr: Chun, LALPA chu a ko a, “Aw LALPA ka Pathien, ka umna hmei- thainu chunga hin a naupa hi suk- hlumpêkin thil ṭha naw khawm i hung intlungtir a ni maw?” a ta.

en: And he stretched himself upon the child three times, and cried unto Jehovah, and said, O Jehovah my God, I pray thee, let this child’s soul come into him again.
hmr: Chuongchun, naupang chunga chun vawi thum a bawk a, LALPA chu a ko a, “Aw LALPA ka Pathien, lunginsiettakin hi naupang hringna hi amaa hin hung inumtir nâwk rawh,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah hearkened unto the voice of Elijah; and the soul of the child came into him again, and he revived.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Elija thu chu a lo ngaipêk a, chuongchun, naupang hringna chu amaa chun a hung um nâwk a, a hung har nâwk tah a.

en: And Elijah took the child, and brought him down out of the chamber into the house, and delivered him unto his mother; and Elijah said, See, thy son liveth.
hmr: Elija chun naupang chu a ṭhuoi a, pindana inthawk chun in sûngah a fe thlâkpui a, a nu a pêk tah a; Elija chun, “En ta, i naupa hi a dam nâwk tah,” a ta.

en: And the woman said to Elijah, Now I know that thou art a man of God, and that the word of Jehovah in thy mouth is truth.
hmr: Nuhmei chun Elija kuoma chun, “Tu zet hin chu Pathien mi i na, i baua LALPA thu hi thutak a nih ti ka hung hriet tah,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass after many days, that the word of Jehovah came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, Go, show thyself unto Ahab; and I will send rain upon the earth.
hmr: Chun, ni tamtak hnunga chun, a kum thum kuma chun LAL- PA thu chu Elija kuomah a hung tlung a, “Va fe la, Ahab kuomah vân lang rawh; chuongchun, hnuoi chung- a hin ruo hung insûrtir ka tih,” tiin.

en: And Elijah went to show himself unto Ahab. And the famine was sore in Samaria.
hmr: Chun, Elija chu Ahab kuoma inlangtir ding chun a fe tah a. Samari rama chun ṭâm chu a nasa hle el a.

en: And Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household. (Now Obadiah feared Jehovah greatly:
hmr: Chun, Ahab chun Obadia, a insûng tieng hotu chu a ko a, (Obadia chu LALPA ṭi mi tak a na,

en: for it was so, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of Jehovah, that Obadiah took a hundred prophets, and hid them by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water.)
hmr: Jezebelin LALPA zâwlneihai a râwt rak lai khan Obadia chun zâwl- nei za a ṭhuoi a, pûkah sâwmnga peiin a thuphmang a, bei le tuiin a châwm hlak a nih.)

en: And Ahab said unto Obadiah, Go through the land, unto all the fountains of water, and unto all the brooks: peradventure we may find grass and save the horses and mules alive, that we lose not all the beasts.
hmr: Chun, Ahab chun Obadia kuoma chun, “Tuihnâr po po le varuom umna po po va fang ta khai; sakawrhai le sabengtung lien chi hai hi ei sandam theina dingin hlobet dâm ei hmupêk thei el rawi mawh; chuong naw chun chu ranhai hi chân vawng rawi ei tih,” a ta.

en: So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.
hmr: Chuongchun, ram fang suok ding chu an insem a, Ahab chu a khâtin lampui dangah a feh a; Obadia khawm chu a khâtin lampui dangah a feh a.

en: And as Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he knew him, and fell on his face, and said, Is it thou, my lord Elijah?
hmr: Chun, chuonga Obadia a fe lai chun, ngai ta, Elija le chun an intuok a; ama chun a la hriet a; chuongchun, a bawkkhup a, “Nang i ni maw, ka pu Elija?” a ta.

en: And he answered him, It is I: go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.
hmr: Ama chun a dawn a, “Nih e, fe ta la, ‘Ngai ta, Elija chu sawtaka sawn a um,’ tiin i lalpa va hril rawh,” a ta.

en: And he said, Wherein have I sinned, that thou wouldest deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab, to slay me?
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Thil ieng am ka suksuol a, i siehlaw hi that dinga Ahab kuta pêk i nuom el am a nih a?

en: As Jehovah thy God liveth, there is no nation or kingdom, whither my lord hath not sent to seek thee: and when they said, He is not here, he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they found thee not.
hmr: LALPA i Pathien hringna sâlin ka hril a nih; ka pu hin nangma inzawngtir nawna hnam le ram hrim hrim a nei nawh i sawnnaw, ‘Hitaka hin a um nawh,’ an ti chun, an hmu naw che thuah ram le hnam chu ṭawng ân khâmtir pei a na.

en: And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.
hmr: Tuhin nangin, ‘Fe la, ngai ta, Elija sawtaka sawn a um ie, tiin i pu va hril rawh,’ i ti el a.

en: And it will come to pass, as soon as I am gone from thee, that the Spirit of Jehovah will carry thee whither I know not; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he cannot find thee, he will slay me: but I thy servant fear Jehovah from my youth.
hmr: Ka mâksan phing che hin LALPA thlarauin ka hriet nawnaah la hmang sîng a ti cheh a, chuong- chun, Ahab chu ka va hril a, a hung hmu thei si naw che chun a mi that el ding i sawnnaw; nisienlakhawm, i siehlaw hin ka tleirawla inthawk tah LALPA chu ka ṭi hlak sih a.

en: Was it not told my lord what I did when Jezebel slew the prophets of Jehovah, how I hid a hundred men of Jehovah’s prophets by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water?
hmr: Jezebelin LALPA zâwlneihai a râwt rak laia ka thil thaw, LALPA zâwlneihai laia mi za, sâwmnga pâwla pûka ka thuphmang a, bei le tuia ka châwmzie kha ka pu hi an hril naw che nîng a ti maw?

en: And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here; and he will slay me.
hmr: Tuhin nangin, ‘Fe ta la, ngai ta, Elija chu sawtaka sawn a um ie, tiin i pu va hril rawh,’ i ti el a, mi that ngei a ti le,” a ta.

en: And Elijah said, As Jehovah of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself unto him to-day.
hmr: Elija chun, “A hmaa ka ngîrna hlak sipaihai LALPA hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, vawisûn hin a kuomah kân lang ngei ding a nih,” a ta.

en: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him; and Ahab went to meet Elijah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Obadia chu Ahab va be ding chun a fe tah a, a hril a; chun, Ahab chu Elija hmu tum chun a fe tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said unto him, Is it thou, thou troubler of Israel?
hmr: Chun, Ahab chun Elija chu a va hmu chun a kuomah, “Nang i ni maw, Israelhai suklungzîngtupa?” a ta.

en: And he answered, I have not troubled Israel; but thou, and thy father’s house, in that ye have forsaken the commandments of Jehovah, and thou hast followed the Baalim.
hmr: Ama chun a dawn a, “Israelhai hi ka suklungzîng nawh ie, nang le i pa sûnghaiin annâwm an suk- lungzîng lem chu. LALPA thupêkhai chu nghatsana, Baalhai i pawm lem tâka hin.

en: Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel unto mount Carmel, and the prophets of Baal four hundred and fifty, and the prophets of the Asherah four hundred, that eat at Jezebel’s table.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin Israelhai po po le Baal zâwlnei za li le sâwmnga leh, Asera zâwlnei, Jezebel dawkâna thlaithlêng awt ve hlakhai za li kha ka kuomah Karmel tlângah vân ko khâwmtir rawh,” a ta.

en: So Ahab sent unto all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together unto mount Carmel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ahab chun Israel thlahai po po lai chun mi a tir a, zâwlneihai chu Karmel tlânga chun a ko khâwm a.

en: And Elijah came near unto all the people, and said, How long go ye limping between the two sides? if Jehovah be God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him. And the people answered him not a word.
hmr: Chun, Elija chun mipuihai po po chu a va hnai a, “Lung âwpinkaiin ieng chen am in um ding a na? LALPA chu Pathien a ni chun, ama chu zui unla; chun, Baal chu a ni chun ama chu zui ro,” a ta. Mipuihai chun bau khat khawmin an dawn nawh.

en: Then said Elijah unto the people, I, even I only, am left a prophet of Jehovah; but Baal’s prophets are four hundred and fifty men.
hmr: Chuongchun, Elija chun mipui- hai kuoma chun, “LALPA zâwlnei la um chu keima chau hi ka na, Baal zâwlneihai ruok chu mi za li le sâwmnga an nih.

en: Let them therefore give us two bullocks; and let them choose one bullock for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under; and I will dress the other bullock, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under.
hmr: Chuongchun, bâwngchal pahni mi hung pe hai sienla, anni chun bâwngchal pakhat chu an puol dingin thlang hai sienla, chan nawi hai sienla, thing chungah sie hai sienla, a hnuoia mei sêm loin; chun, keiin bâwngchal pakhat chu buotsai vêng ka ta, thing chunga chun sieng ka ta, mei sêm bîk naw ning ah.

en: And call ye on the name of your god, and I will call on the name of Jehovah; and the God that answereth by fire, let him be God. And all the people answered and said, It is well spoken.
hmr: Chun, nangni chun in pathien hming chu lam unla, kei khawma LALPA hming lam ka ta, chuong- chun, meia hung dawntu Pathien taphawt chu Pathien ni raw se,” a ta. Chun, mi po po chun an dawn a, “Ân dik a nih,” an ti tâwl a.

en: And Elijah said unto the prophets of Baal, Choose you one bullock for yourselves, and dress it first; for ye are many; and call on the name of your god, but put no fire under.
hmr: Chuongchun, Elija chun Baal zâwlneihai kuoma chun, “Nangnîn bâwngchal pakhat hi in puola dingin thlang unla, buotsai hmasa ro, nangni chu in tam deu hi; in pa- thien hming chu ko unla, amiruok- chu, a hnuoiah mei chu sêm naw ro,” a ta.

en: And they took the bullock which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, O Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any that answered. And they leaped about the altar which was made.
hmr: Chun, bâwngchal an puol chu an lâk a, an buotsai tah a, “Aw Baal, mi hung dawn raw khai,” tiin zîngkâra inthawka sûn chenin Baal hming chu an ko a. Nisienlakhawm, riva iengkhawm a um dêr nawh a, a dawntu hrim hrim hlak an um bawk nawh. Chun, an maichâm siem vêla chun an inchâwm an inchâwm el a.

en: And it came to pass at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said, Cry aloud; for he is a god: either he is musing, or he is gone aside, or he is on a journey, or peradventure he sleepeth and must be awaked.
hmr: Chun, sûnlai tak chun Elija chun anni chu tielin, “Khêk inring ta unla, pathien a ni sih a, ân ngaituo hri amanih, annawleh a in hlau a, sukṭhang ding amani khawm nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: And they cried aloud, and cut themselves after their manner with knives and lances, till the blood gushed out upon them.
hmr: Chun, inringtak takin an khêk a, an thaw hlak angin chemtê le fei- haiin an thi suok zawt zawt khawpin an inâtin an insun a.

en: And it was so, when midday was past, that they prophesied until the time of the offering of the evening oblation; but there was neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any that regarded.
hmr: Chun, nisa a hung inher chun zân tieng inthâwi hun chen ding hin an hril ruol duol duol zing a, nisienlakhawm, râwl riva hrim hrim a um nawh a, dawntu ding hrim hrim amanih, a lo ngaisaktu hrim hrim amani khawm an um bawk nawh a.

en: And Elijah said unto all the people, Come near unto me; and all the people came near unto him. And he repaired the altar of Jehovah that was thrown down.
hmr: Chuongchun, Elija chun mipui- hai po po kuoma chun, “Mi hung hnai ta u khai,” a ta; chun, mipuihai po po chun an va hnai a. Chun, LALPA maichâm sukchim ta hnung chu a siemṭhah a.

en: And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, unto whom the word of Jehovah came, saying, Israel shall be thy name.
hmr: Chun, “I hming chu Israel nîng a tih,” ti lo dawngtu Jakob nauhai hnam zât lung sâwm le pahni Elija chun a lâk a.

en: And with the stones he built an altar in the name of Jehovah; and he made a trench about the altar, as great as would contain two measures of seed.
hmr: Chuong lunghai chun LALPA hmingin maichâm a siem a; maichâm vêl chu bu chi tekhâwng hni inleng ding zet hin a cho khur a.

en: And he put the wood in order, and cut the bullock in pieces, and laid it on the wood. And he said, Fill four jars with water, and pour it on the burnt-offering, and on the wood.
hmr: Chun, thing chu a hang sep fel a, bâwngchal chu a chan nâwi a, thing chunga chun a sieh a. Chun, “Bêl pali tuiin suksip unla, pumrawhmang thil inhlân le thing hi hung buokkhum ro,” a ta.

en: And he said, Do it the second time; and they did it the second time. And he said, Do it the third time; and they did it the third time.
hmr: Chun, “Hung buokkhum nâwk ro,” a ta. An hang buokkhum nâwk a. Chun, “A vawithumna dingin hung buokkhum nâwk ro,” a ta; chun, a vawithumna ding chun an thaw nâwk a.

en: And the water ran round about the altar; and he filled the trench also with water.
hmr: Chun, tui chu maichâm vêla chun a luong ta dum dum a; chun, cho khur chu tuiin a suksip bawk a.

en: And it came to pass at the time of the offering of the evening oblation, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, O Jehovah, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that thou art God in Israel, and that I am thy servant, and that I have done all these things at thy word.
hmr: Chun, zântienga inthâwi hun lai chun zâwlnei Elija chun a va pan hnai a, “Aw LALPA, Abraham hai, Isaak hai, Israel hai Pathien, nang hi Israel rama Pathien i ni le, kei hi i siehlaw ka na, hieng po po hi nangma thua thaw ka ni ti vawisûn hin hre tâwl raw hai se.

en: Hear me, O Jehovah, hear me, that this people may know that thou, Jehovah, art God, and that thou hast turned their heart back again.
hmr: Mi lo ngaipêk la, hieng mipuihai hin nang LALPA hi Pathien i na, an lungrilhai în lettir nâwk tah a ni ti an hriet theina dingin aw LALPA, mi lo ngaipêk rawh,” a ta.

en: Then the fire of Jehovah fell, and consumed the burnt-offering, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA mei chu a hung tlah a, pumrawhmang thilin- hlân dâm, thing dâm, pilvut dâm, lung dâm chu a kâng hmang a, cho khur a tui khawm chu a hîp kang ta vawng a.

en: And when all the people saw it, they fell on their faces: and they said, Jehovah, he is God; Jehovah, he is God.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai po poin chu chu an hei hmu chun an bawkkhup a, “LALPA hi a lo nih, Pathien chu, LALPA hi a lo nih, Pathien chu,” an ta.

en: And Elijah said unto them, Take the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape. And they took them; and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and slew them there.
hmr: Chun, Elija chun an kuomah, “Baal zâwlneihai hi man unla, pakhat khawm insuo naw ro,” a ta. Chun, an man a, Elija chun Kison vadunga chun a ṭhuoi thlâk a, chutaka chun a that tâwl a.

en: And Elijah said unto Ahab, Get thee up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain.
hmr: Chuongchun, Elija chun Ahab kuoma chun, “Hang fe la, fain hang dâwn ta rawh, ruopui sûr ding ri a um a nih ie,” a ta.

en: So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he bowed himself down upon the earth, and put his face between his knees.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ahab chu fa le dâwn dingin a hang fe tah a. Chun, Elija chu Karmel tlâng sîp tieng chun a hang feh a; hnuoi tieng a kûn a, a kap kâra chun a hmai a rawl a.

en: And he said to his servant, Go up now, look toward the sea. And he went up, and looked, and said, There is nothing. And he said, Go again seven times.
hmr: A siehlaw kuoma chun, “Hang fe la, tuisuoriet tieng hang thlîr ta khai,” a ta. Chun, a hang feh a, a hang thlîr a, “Iengkhawm a um nawh,” a ta. Ama chun, “Fe nâwk rawh, vawi sari chen,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass at the seventh time, that he said, Behold, there ariseth a cloud out of the sea, as small as a man’s hand. And he said, Go up, say unto Ahab, Make ready thy chariot, and get thee down, that the rain stop thee not.
hmr: Chun, a vawi sarinaa chun, “Ngai ta, tuisuorieta inthawkin mi- hriem kut ruol chau hi sûm a lâwn kai nel nel el,” a ta. Ama chun, “Hang fe la, Ahab kuomah, ‘I tawlailîr buotsai la, fe thla ta rawh, ruoin dang rawi a ti che,’ ti rawh,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass in a little while, that the heavens grew black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel:
hmr: Chun, sâwt nawtêa chun vân chu thli le sûmin a hung dum ta khup el a, ruopui vânâwn a hung sûr tah a. Chun, Ahab chu tawlailîra chuongin Jezreel khuoah a fe tah a.

en: and the hand of Jehovah was on Elijah; and he girded up his loins, and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
hmr: Chun, LALPA kut chu Elija chunga chun a um a; chuongchun, a dier a kei a, Ahab hmaa chun Jezreel khaw lûtna chenin a tlân tah a.

en: And Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and withal how he had slain all the prophets with the sword.
hmr: Ahab chun Elija thilthaw po po, kâwl hnâma zâwlneihai po po a that thuhai leh Jezebel chu a hril a.

en: Then Jezebel sent a messenger unto Elijah, saying, So let the gods do to me, and more also, if I make not thy life as the life of one of them by to-morrow about this time.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jezebel chun Elija kuomah, “khâng mihai laia mi pa- khat hringna anga zîngah hieng tik phât hin i hringna ka siempêk ve naw che chun pathienhai chun an law law mi law el hai sienla, chu nêka nasa lem khawm a,” tiin mi a tir a.

en: And when he saw that, he arose, and went for his life, and came to Beer-sheba, which belongeth to Judah, and left his servant there.
hmr: Chuongchun, a ṭih a, a tho a, a tlânse tah a, Judai rama Beer-seba khuo a va tlung a, chutaka chun a siehlaw chu a mâksan a.

en: But he himself went a day’s journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a juniper-tree: and he requested for himself that he might die, and said, It is enough; now, O Jehovah, take away my life; for I am not better than my fathers.
hmr: Ama ruok chu thlalêrah ni khat lama hlaah a feh a, Juniper thing hnuoia hin a ṭhung a, thi a hni tah a, “A hun tah ie, aw LALPA, tuhin ka hringna hi la el ta, ka puhai nêkin ka ṭha chuong bîk si nawh a,” a ta.

en: And he lay down and slept under a juniper-tree; and, behold, an angel touched him, and said unto him, Arise and eat.
hmr: Chuongchun, Juniper thing hnuoia chun a zâl a, a in tah a; chun, ngai ta, vântirko hin a hung them a, a kuomah, “Tho la, fa rawh,” a ta.

en: And he looked, and, behold, there was at his head a cake baken on the coals, and a cruse of water. And he did eat and drink, and laid him down again.
hmr: Chun, a hei en vêl a, ngai ta, a luthluona chun beiphêk lungsaa em hmin diem le tuiûm hi a lo um a. Chuongchun, a fâk a, a dâwn a, a zâl nâwk tah a.

en: And the angel of Jehovah came again the second time, and touched him, and said, Arise and eat, because the journey is too great for thee.
hmr: Chun, LALPA vântirko chu a hung nâwk a, a hung them a, “Tho la, fa rawh, i fena ding i ta dingin lam hla a nih,” a ta.

en: And he arose, and did eat and drink, and went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights unto Horeb the mount of God.
hmr: Chun, a tho a, a fâkin a dâwn a, chuongchun, chu bu lei chun Pathien tlâng Horeb chenin ni sâwmli le zân sâwmli a feh a.

en: And he came thither unto a cave, and lodged there; and, behold, the word of Jehovah came to him, and he said unto him, What doest thou here, Elijah?
hmr: Chun, chutaka pûk pakhat a va tlung a, chutaka chun a um tah a; chun, ngai ta, LALPA thu a kuomah a hung tlung a, a kuomah, “Hitaka hin ieng am i thawh a, Elija?” a ta.

en: And he said, I have been very jealous for Jehovah, the God of hosts; for the children of Israel have forsaken thy covenant, thrown down thine altars, and slain thy prophets with the sword: and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.
hmr: Ama chun, “LALPA sipaihai Pathien ta ding hin ṭhahnem ka ngai êm êm hlak a, Israel thlahai hlak chun i thuthlung an nghatsan a, i maichâmhai an sukchim a, i zâwl- neihai kâwlhnâmin an sâthlum sih a; a la um chu kei bak hi ka na, ka hring- na mi lâkpêk an tum a nih,” a ta.

en: And he said, Go forth, and stand upon the mount before Jehovah. And, behold, Jehovah passed by, and a great and strong wind rent the mountains, and brake in pieces the rocks before Jehovah; but Jehovah was not in the wind: and after the wind an earthquake; but Jehovah was not in the earthquake:
hmr: Ama chun, “Va suok la, tlânga sawn LALPA hmaah va ngîr rawh,” a ta. Chun, ngai ta, LALPA chu a hung a, thlipui hrâttakin tlâng dâm chu LALPA hmaa chun a hung mût kak a, lungpuihai chu a kawi remrum a, nisienlakhawm, thlia chun LALPA chu a um nawh; chun, thli hrâng zo chun simkhawleihnuoi a hung in- hnîng a; nisienlakhawm, simkhawlei- hnuoi inhnînga chun LALPA chu a um nawh;

en: and after the earthquake a fire; but Jehovah was not in the fire: and after the fire a still small voice.
hmr: Chun, simkhawleihnuoi in- hnîng zo chun mei a hung suok a, nisienlakhawm, meia chun LALPA chu a um nawh;

en: And it was so, when Elijah heard it, that he wrapped his face in his mantle, and went out, and stood in the entrance of the cave. And, behold, there came a voice unto him, and said, What doest thou here, Elijah?
hmr: chun, mei zoa chun râwl innêmtak el hi a hung suok a, chun, Elija chun chu chu a hriet chun a puonin a hmai ân khum a, a va suok a, pûk baua chun a va ngîr a. Chun, ngai ta, râwl chun a kuomah, “Hitaka hin ieng am i thawh a, Elija?” a hung tih a.

en: And he said, I have been very jealous for Jehovah, the God of hosts; for the children of Israel have forsaken thy covenant, thrown down thine altars, and slain thy prophets with the sword; and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “LALPA sipai- hai Pathien ta ding hin ṭhahnem ka ngai êm êm hlak a, Israel thlahai hlak chun i thuthlung an nghatsan a, i maichâmhai an sukchim a, i zâwl- neihai kâwlhnâmin an sât hlum sih a; a la um chu keima bak hi ka na, ka hringna mi lâkpêk an tum a nih,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah said unto him, Go, return on thy way to the wilderness of Damascus: and when thou comest, thou shalt anoint Hazael to be king over Syria;
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN a kuomah, “Fe nâwk ta la, thlalêr tieng Damaska khuoah fe rawh; i va tlung chun Suria lal dingin Hazael hriek nâl i ta;

en: and Jehu the son of Nimshi shalt thou anoint to be king over Israel; and Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel-meholah shalt thou anoint to be prophet in thy room.
hmr: chun, Israel lal dingin Nimsi naupa Jehu chu hriek nâl bawk i tih; chun, nanga aiawa zâwlnei ni dingin Abelmehola khuoa mi Saphat naupa Elisa hriek nâl bawk i tih.

en: And it shall come to pass, that him that escapeth from the sword of Hazael shall Jehu slay; and him that escapeth from the sword of Jehu shall Elisha slay.
hmr: Chun, Hazael kâwlhnâm pum- pel taphawt chu Jehu chun that a ta, Jehu kâwlhnâm pumpel taphawt chu Elisa chun that a tih.

en: Yet will I leave me seven thousand in Israel, all the knees which have not bowed unto Baal, and every mouth which hath not kissed him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Israel rama hin Baal hmaa la dingṭhaṭhuon ngailo le, la fâwp ngailo mi sâng sari ka ta dingin ka hum ding a nih,” a ta.

en: So he departed thence, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who was plowing, with twelve yoke of oxen before him, and he with the twelfth: and Elijah passed over unto him, and cast his mantle upon him.
hmr: Chuongchun, chutaka inthawk chun a suok tah a, Saphat naupa Elisa chu a va hmusuok a, ama chun hnuoi a lo inlet a, a hmaa chun sebâwng tuok sâwm le tuok hni a um a, a sâwm le pahnina chu ama chun a lo khal a; chun, Elija chun a va pan a, a puon chu a vân bâttir a.

en: And he left the oxen, and ran after Elijah, and said, Let me, I pray thee, kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow thee. And he said unto him, Go back again; for what have I done to thee?
hmr: Chun, sebâwnghai chu a mâk- san a, Elija chu a hnawt tah a, “Ka nu le ka pa la va fâwp hri phawt ka tih aw, chuongchun, hung zui ka ti che,” a ta. Ama chun a kuomah, “Va fe nâwk phawt ta la, ieng am ka thawpêk che a?” a ta.

en: And he returned from following him, and took the yoke of oxen, and slew them, and boiled their flesh with the instruments of the oxen, and gave unto the people, and they did eat. Then he arose, and went after Elijah, and ministered unto him.
hmr: Chun, ama a va zui chu a kîr a, sebâwng tuok khat a khal chu a that a, a sa chu sebâwng thuomhnawhai chun a suong a, mihai kuomah a sem a, an fâk tah a. Chuongchun, a tho a, Elija chu a zui a, a rawng a bâwlpêk tah a.

en: Now the days of David drew nigh that he should die; and he charged Solomon his son, saying,
hmr: David thi hun chu a hung hnai tah a, a naupa Solomon chu thu a pêk a,

en: I am going the way of all the earth: be thou strong therefore, and show thyself a man;
hmr: “Leihnuoi po po dân angin ka fe ve ding a ni tah a, chuongchun, hrât- takin um la, patlingtakin um rawh,

en: and keep the charge of Jehovah thy God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his ordinances, and his testimonies, according to that which is written in the law of Moses, that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest, and whithersoever thou turnest thyself;
hmr: i thilthaw taphawta le i nghatna tieng poa i tluongtlung theina dingin Mosie Dân ziek anga, LALPA i Pathienin a lampuihai hraw ding le, a thuruot dâm, a thupêk dâm, a rorêl- hai dâm le, a thuinhriettir pawm dinga a pêkhai hi zâwm rawh;

en: that Jehovah may establish his word which he spake concerning me, saying, If thy children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on the throne of Israel.
hmr: LALPAIN ka chungchâng thua, ‘I thlahaiin an lungril tak le, an lungvar taka ka mithmua thutaka um dinga an umdân an fîmkhur chun Israelhai lalṭhungphaa ṭhung ding tlasam naw ti ni,’ tiha a hril kha a sukdet ding a nih.

en: Moreover thou knowest also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did unto me, even what he did to the two captains of the hosts of Israel, unto Abner the son of Ner, and unto Amasa the son of Jether, whom he slew, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war upon his girdle that was about his loins, and in his shoes that were on his feet.
hmr: Chun, Zeruia naupa Joab mi thawzie, Israelhai sipai hotu pahni Nera naupa Abner le Jether naupa Amasa hai a thawzie ngei kha i hriet a. Khânga a that a, inrem laia indo lai thisen insuoin ân suoh a, a kâwnga a kâwngkhi le a kekawk buna indona thisen a sukkaizie hai kha.

en: Do therefore according to thy wisdom, and let not his hoar head go down to Sheol in peace.
hmr: Chuongchun, i rem hriet dân angin thaw la, a lua kêlsam ṭo hi thlânah lungmuongtakin inliemtir naw rawh.

en: But show kindness unto the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those that eat at thy table; for so they came to me when I fled from Absalom thy brother.
hmr: Gilead mi Barzillai nauhai chunga ruok chun lunginsietna in- langtir la, i dawkâna thlaithlêng awttuah inṭhangtir ve rawh; i unau Absalom leia ka tlân hmang lai khan ka kuomah an hung sih a.

en: And, behold, there is with thee Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjamite, of Bahurim, who cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim; but he came down to meet me at the Jordan, and I sware to him by Jehovah, saying, I will not put thee to death with the sword.
hmr: Chun, Bahurim khuoa mi Benjamin thla, Gera naupa Simei hi i kuomah a um a, ama chun Mahanaim hmuna ka fe lai khan ṭawngsie ṭha nawtak a mîn phur a; amiruokchu, Jordana khan mi tuok dingin a hung thlah a, chutaka chun ‘Kâwlhnâm- in that naw ning che,’ tiin LALPA hming sâlin ṭawng ka lo inkhâm tah a.

en: Now therefore hold him not guiltless, for thou art a wise man; and thou wilt know what thou oughtest to do unto him, and thou shalt bring his hoar head down to Sheol with blood.
hmr: Chuongchun, thiemchang chun chu insuo naw rawh, mi var i ni sih a, a chunga ieng anga thaw ding am a na ti hre el i tih; a lua kêlsam ṭo chu thisen leh thlânah în liemtir ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And David slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David.
hmr: Chun, David chu a puhai kuoma chun a in innghil ve tah a, David khawpuia chun an phûm a.

en: And the days that David reigned over Israel were forty years: seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.
hmr: Israelhai chunga David inlal sûng chu kum sâwmli a na, Hebron khuoah kum sari ân lal a, Jerusalem khuoah kum sâwmthum le kum thum ân lal.

en: And Solomon sat upon the throne of David his father; and his kingdom was established greatly.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chu a pa David lalṭhungphaa chun a ṭhung a, chuongchun, a ram chu nasataka suknghetin a hung um tah a.

en: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bath-sheba the mother of Solomon. And she said, Comest thou peaceably? And he said, Peaceably.
hmr: Chun, Haggith naupa Adonija chu Bathseba Solomon nu kuomah a feh a, ama chun, “Ṭha tieng thua hung am i nih?” a lo tih a.

en: He said moreover, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And she said, Say on.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Ṭha tieng thuah nih e,” a ta. Chun, “I kuomah ieng am a nih hril ding ka nei a,” a ti nâwk a. Ama chun, “Hril ta la,” a ta.

en: And he said, Thou knowest that the kingdom was mine, and that all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign: howbeit the kingdom is turned about, and is become my brother’s; for it was his from Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Ram hi ka ta a ni tah ti le, Israelhai po po khawm hin keima hi lal dingin an mi thlîr zing a nih ti i hriet a, amiruokchu, ram chu ka unaupa ta dingin a hung inlet ta lem a; LALPA lo ruot dânah a ta a ni hrim a nih.

en: And now I ask one petition of thee; deny me not. And she said unto him, Say on.
hmr: Tuhin thil pakhat hni ding che ka nei a, mi remti nawpêk naw hrâm rawh,” a ta. Chun, ama chun a kuom- ah, “Hril ta la,” a ta.

en: And he said, Speak, I pray thee, unto Solomon the king (for he will not say thee nay), that he give me Abishag the Shunammite to wife.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Ka hni che a nih, lal Solomon kuoma chun hril la, (i thu chu a sêl âwm si nawh a) Sunam mi Abisag hi nuhmeiah mîn neitir raw se,” a ta.

en: And Bath-sheba said, Well; I will speak for thee unto the king.
hmr: Chun, Bathseba chun, “Aw le, lal chu lo bepêk ka ti che,” a ta.

en: Bath-sheba therefore went unto king Solomon, to speak unto him for Adonijah. And the king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself unto her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a throne to be set for the king’s mother; and she sat on his right hand.
hmr: Chuongchun, Bathseba chu Adonija va bepêk dingin lal Solomon kuoma chun a fe tah a. Chun, lal chu ama lo lâwm dingin a tho a, a hmaa chun a kûn a, a lalṭhungphaa chun a ṭhung a, chun, lal nu ta ding chun ṭhungpha ân sietir a; a changtienga chun a ṭhung tah a.

en: Then she said, I ask one small petition of thee; deny me not. And the king said unto her, Ask on, my mother; for I will not deny thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, “Thil pakhat chi- terek ka hni ding che a nih, mi remti nawpêk naw hrâm rawh,” a ta. Chun, lal chun a kuomah, “Hni ta la, nu, remti nawpêk naw tawp ka ti che,” a ta.

en: And she said, Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah thy brother to wife.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Sunam mi Abisag hi i unaupa Adonija nuhmeiah inneitir rawh,” a ta.

en: And king Solomon answered and said unto his mother, And why dost thou ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? ask for him the kingdom also; for he is mine elder brother; even for him, and for Abiathar the priest, and for Joab the son of Zeruiah.
hmr: Chun, lal Solomon chun a dawn a, a nu kuoma chun, “Iengtiziea Sunam mi Abisag hi Adonija ta dinga hni am i ni leh? Ram khawm hi hnipêk law law ta la; ama chu ka u a nih an- nâwm, ama ta ding le thiempu Abia- thar ta ding le Zeruia naupa Joab ta ding khawma hni raw chu,” a ta.

en: Then king Solomon sware by Jehovah, saying, God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah hath not spoken this word against his own life.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Solomon chun, “LALPA hming sâlin, Adonija thil hni hin ama chunga thina thuhril a ni naw tâkleh, Pathienin a law law mi law el sienla, chu nêka nasa khawm a.

en: Now therefore as Jehovah liveth, who hath established me, and set me on the throne of David my father, and who hath made me a house, as he promised, surely Adonijah shall be put to death this day.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA a thutiem anga mi sukdet a, ka pa lal David lalṭhungphaa mîn ṭhungtir a, sung- kuo mi lo inngîrpêktu hringna sâlin ka hril hi, Adonija hi vawisûn le le hin sukhlum nghâl ding a nih,” a tih a; ṭawng ân khâm tah a.

en: And king Solomon sent by Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he fell upon him, so that he died.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Solomon chun Jehoiada naupa Benaia chu a tir a, ama chu a va thawh a, a thi tah a.

en: And unto Abiathar the priest said the king, Get thee to Anathoth, unto thine own fields; for thou art worthy of death: but I will not at this time put thee to death, because thou barest the ark of the Lord Jehovah before David my father, and because thou wast afflicted in all wherein my father was afflicted.
hmr: Chun, thiempu Abiathar kuoma chun lal chun, “Anathoth khuoa nanga in le loah fe dai rawh, thi tlâk chu i ni ngei a, amiruokchu, ka pa David hmaa LALPA Pathien bâwm i lo zâwn hlak lei le, ka pa rinum tuornahai po poa chun i lo tuor ve ta hlak leiin tuhin chu chu la sukhlum hri naw ning che,” a ta.

en: So Solomon thrust out Abiathar from being priest unto Jehovah, that he might fulfil the word of Jehovah, which he spake concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun Abiathar chu LALPA thiempu a nina chu a bân tah a; LALPAIN Silo khuoa Eli sûnghai chungchâng thu a hril kha ân tlungtir theina dingin.

en: And the tidings came to Joab; for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though he turned not after Absalom. And Joab fled unto the Tent of Jehovah, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.
hmr: Chun, chu thu chu Joab chun a lo hriet a, Joab chu Absalom tieng khan a ṭhang naw a chu, Adonija tienga ṭhang a ni sih a. Chuong- chun, Joab chu LALPA Puon inah a tlân a, maichâm kihai chu a va chel tah a.

en: And it was told king Solomon, Joab is fled unto the Tent of Jehovah, and, behold, he is by the altar. Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, Go, fall upon him.
hmr: Chun, “LALPA puon inah Joab a tlân a, ngai ta, maichâm bulah a um,” tiin lal Solomon chu an hril a. Chuongchun, lal Solomon chun Jehoiada naupa Benaia chu, “Hang thaw rawh,” tiin a tir a.

en: And Benaiah came to the Tent of Jehovah, and said unto him, Thus saith the king, Come forth. And he said, Nay; but I will die here. And Benaiah brought the king word again, saying, Thus said Joab, and thus he answered me.
hmr: Benaia chu, LALPA puon ina chun a hang feh a, a kuoma chun, “Lalin, ‘Hung thla raw se’, a tih” a ta. Ama chun, “Ni lo e, hitaka hin thi el lem ka tih,” a ta. Benaia chun, “Joab chun hieng ang hin a lo tih a, hieng ang hin a mi lo dawn a nih,” tiin lal kuomah thu ân tlun nâwk a.

en: And the king said unto him, Do as he hath said, and fall upon him, and bury him; that thou mayest take away the blood, which Joab shed without cause, from me and from my father’s house.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a kuomah, “A hril ang chun hang thaw la, phûm rawh, a san um dêr loa Joabin thisen ân suoa inthawka kha kei le ka pa sûnghai chu i sukfihlîm theina ding- in.

en: And Jehovah will return his blood upon his own head, because he fell upon two men more righteous and better than he, and slew them with the sword, and my father David knew it not, to wit, Abner the son of Ner, captain of the host of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, captain of the host of Judah.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama nêka mi ṭha lem le mi fel lem pahni Nera naupa Abner, Israelhai sipai hotu le, Jether naupa Amasa, Judahai sipai hotu kha ka pa David hriet loa a thawh a, kâwlhnâma a that leiin LALPAIN a thisen chu ama lu chung ngeiah hung inlêttir a tih.

en: So shall their blood return upon the head of Joab, and upon the head of his seed for ever: but unto David, and unto his seed, and unto his house, and unto his throne, shall there be peace for ever from Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, an thisen chu Joab lu chung le a thlahai lu chungah kumkhuoin lêt a ta, David chunga dâm, a thlahai chunga dâm, a sûng- hai chunga dâm, a lalṭhungpha chunga dâm ruok chun LALPA kuoma inthawka lungmuongna kum- khuoin um zing lem a tih,” a ta.

en: Then Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up, and fell upon him, and slew him; and he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jehoiada naupa Benaia chu a hang feh a, a hang thawh a, a that tah a; chun, thlalêra ama ina chun an phûm tah a.

en: And the king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his room over the host; and Zadok the priest did the king put in the room of Abiathar.
hmr: Chun, lalin Jehoiada naupa Benaia chu sipaihai chungah a ai ân awtir a, chun, thiempu Zadok chu lalin Abiathar ai ân awtir a.

en: And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Build thee a house in Jerusalem, and dwell there, and go not forth thence any whither.
hmr: Chun, lalin Simei chu ân kotir a, a kuomah, “Jerusalema hin in bâwl la, chutaka chun um la, chutaka inthawk chun khâwlai dang khawm suok naw rawh.

en: For on the day thou goest out, and passest over the brook Kidron, know thou for certain that thou shalt surely die: thy blood shall be upon thine own head.
hmr: I suok ni, Kidron vadung i kân ni le le chun i thi ngei ding a nih ti hre raw khai, chun, i thisen chu nangma lu chunga ngei um a tih,” a ta.

en: And Shimei said unto the king, The saying is good: as my lord the king hath said, so will thy servant do. And Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days.
hmr: Simei chun lal kuomah, “An dik ie, lal ka puin a hril ang chun i siehlaw hin thaw pei a tih,” a ta. Chun, Simei chu Jerusalema chun sâwtrei chu a um a.

en: And it came to pass at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away unto Achish, son of Maacah, king of Gath. And they told Shimei, saying, Behold, thy servants are in Gath.
hmr: Chun, kum thum ân vawi hnung chun Simei siehlawhai pahni chu Gath khaw lal Maaka naupa Akis kuomah an zâm a. Chun, “Ngai ta, i siehlawhai chu Gath khuoah an um,” tiin Simei chu an hril a.

en: And Shimei arose, and saddled his ass, and went to Gath to Achish, to seek his servants; and Shimei went, and brought his servants from Gath.
hmr: Simei chu a tho a, a sabengtung chu a buotsai a, siehlawhai zawng dingin Gath khuoa Akis kuoma chun a fe tah a; chun, Simei chun Gath khuoa inthawk chun a siehlawhai chu a va ṭhuoi tah a.

en: And it was told Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath, and was come again.
hmr: Chun, Simei chu Gath khuoah a va feh a, Jerusalemah a hung nâwk tah, ti Solomon chu an hril a.

en: And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Did I not adjure thee by Jehovah, and protest unto thee, saying, Know for certain, that on the day thou goest out, and walkest abroad any whither, thou shalt surely die? and thou saidst unto me, The saying that I have heard is good.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Simei chu ân kotir a, a kuomah, “ ‘I suok ni, ram danga i suok ni le lein i thi ngei ding a nih,’ ti khan LALPA hming sâlin ṭawng kân khâmtir chein, kân hriet- tir che a ni naw am a nih? chun, nang khawma ka kuomah, ‘I thu hril ka hriet hi a ṭha ie,’ i ti kha.

en: Why then hast thou not kept the oath of Jehovah, and the commandment that I have charged thee with?
hmr: Iengdinga LALPA ṭawng in- khâm le thu ka pêk che kha hlen lo am i nih a?” a ta.

en: The king said moreover to Shimei, Thou knowest all the wickedness which thy heart is privy to, that thou didst to David my father: therefore Jehovah shall return thy wickedness upon thine own head.
hmr: Chun, lal ma chun Simei kuom- ah, “I lungril sûng rîtlozie, ka pa David chunga i thawziehai kha i hriet vawng a, chuongchun, LALPAIN i rîtlona hi nangma lu chunga ngei hung inlêttir a tih.

en: But king Solomon shall be blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before Jehovah for ever.
hmr: Lal Solomon ruok chu mal- sâwmin um a ta, David lalṭhungpha chu LALPA hmaah kumkhuoa sukdet ning a tih,” a ta.

en: So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he went out, and fell upon him, so that he died. And the kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun Jehoiada naupa Benaia chu thu a pêk a, ama chu a va thawh a, a that tah a. Chuongchun, ram chu Solomon kuta suknghetin a um tah a.

en: And Ben-hadad the king of Syria gathered all his host together; and there were thirty and two kings with him, and horses and chariots: and he went up and besieged Samaria, and fought against it.
hmr: Suria lal Benhadad chun sipaihai po po chu ân khâwm vawng a, lal sâwmthum le pahni an ṭhang a, sakawr le tawlailîrhai leh a hang feh a, Samari khuo chu a hang inhuol a, a hang thawh a.

en: And he sent messengers to Ahab king of Israel, into the city, and said unto him, Thus saith Ben-hadad,
hmr: Israel lal Ahab kuoma chun khawpui sûngah mi a tir a, a kuomah, “Benhadad chun hieng ang hin a tih,

en: Thy silver and thy gold is mine; thy wives also and thy children, even the goodliest, are mine.
hmr: ‘I tangka le i rângkachakhai kha ka ta a nih, i nuhmeihai le, i nauhai laia a ṭha ṭhahai kha ka ta vawng a nih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: And the king of Israel answered and said, It is according to thy saying, my lord, O king; I am thine, and all that I have.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chun a lo dawn a, “Aw laltak ka pu, i hril ang chu a ni annâwm, keima le ka nei po po chu i ta a nih,” a ta.

en: And the messengers came again, and said, Thus speaketh Ben-hadad, saying, I sent indeed unto thee, saying, Thou shalt deliver me thy silver, and thy gold, and thy wives, and thy children;
hmr: Chun, a mi tirhai chu an fe nâwk a, “Benhadad chun hieng ang hin a tih, ‘I kuomah, i tangkahai, i rângka- chakhai, i nuhmeihai le i nauhai leh i mi pêk ding a nih, tiin mi ka hung tir luoh a;

en: but I will send my servants unto thee to-morrow about this time, and they shall search thy house, and the houses of thy servants; and it shall be, that whatsoever is pleasant in thine eyes, they shall put it in their hand, and take it away.
hmr: amiruokchu, zîngah hi pha vêla hin ka mihai i kuomah hung tir ka ta, i in le i mihai inhai chu an hung dap ding a nih; chun, i thil ngainat zâwng- hai chu lâng an ta, hung pui vawng an tih,’ tiin,” an ta.

en: Then the king of Israel called all the elders of the land, and said, Mark, I pray you, and see how this man seeketh mischief: for he sent unto me for my wives, and for my children, and for my silver, and for my gold; and I denied him not.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel lal chun a rama upahai po po chu a ko a, “Lo hre ta u khai, hi mipa hin thil ṭha nawtak thaw a tumzie hi; ka kuomah mi a hung tir a, ka nuhmeihai, ka nauhai, ka tangka dâm, ka rângkachak dâm a hung ngên a, ka lo sêl hlak khawm ni si loin,” a ta.

en: And all the elders and all the people said unto him, Hearken thou not, neither consent.
hmr: Chun, upahai po po le mipuihai po po chun a kuomah, “Lo bengkhawn nuom naw rawh, rem khawm lo tipêk naw rawh,” an ta.

en: Wherefore he said unto the messengers of Ben-hadad, Tell my lord the king, All that thou didst send for to thy servant at the first I will do; but this thing I may not do. And the messengers departed, and brought him word again.
hmr: Chuongchun, Benhadad mitirhai kuoma chun, “Laltak ka pu kuoma chun, ‘I siehlaw kuoma mi tira i hung ngên hmasak ang po po khan chu thâwng ka ta, amiruokchu, hi hi chu chu thaw thei naw ning, a tih,’ ti ro,” a ta. Chun, a mitirhai chu an fe nâwk tah a, chu thu chu an vân tlun nâwk a.

en: And Ben-hadad sent unto him, and said, The gods do so unto me, and more also, if the dust of Samaria shall suffice for handfuls for all the people that follow me.
hmr: Chun, Benhadad chun a kuom- ah mi a tir nâwk a, “Ka hnungzuitu- hai po po hin Samari khaw pilvut veikhat chau khawm an changkim thei ding chun pathienhaiin an law law mi law hai sienla, chu nêka nasa khawm a,” a ta.

en: And the king of Israel answered and said, Tell him, Let not him that girdeth on his armor boast himself as he that putteth it off.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chun a dawn a, “‘Mi ân râlthuom zing laiin, ân râl- thuomna hlîp thla ta ang elin an uong ngai nawh ie,’ tiin va hril ro khai,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, when Ben-hadad heard this message, as he was drinking, he and the kings, in the pavilions, that he said unto his servants, Set yourselves in array. And they set themselves in array against the city.
hmr: Chun, ama le a lalhaiin bûktêah zu an lo dâwn laiin, chu thu chu Benhadad chun a lo hriet a, a mihai kuoma chun, “Insiem ro khai,” a ta. Chuongchun, khuo chu do ding chun an insiem tah a.

en: And, behold, a prophet came near unto Ahab king of Israel, and said, Thus saith Jehovah, Hast thou seen all this great multitude? behold, I will deliver it into thy hand this day; and thou shalt know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, zâwlnei pakhat hin Israel lal Ahab chu a va hnai a, “LALPAIN hieng ang hin a tih, ‘Hieng mipui tamtak hi i hmu am? ngai ta, vawisûn hin i kutah ka pêk ding a nih; chuongchun, kei hi LALPA chu ka nih ti hrieng i tih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: And Ahab said, By whom? And he said, Thus saith Jehovah, By the young men of the princes of the provinces. Then he said, Who shall begin the battle? And he answered, Thou.
hmr: Chun, Ahab chun, “Tu hmangin am ie?” a ta. Ama chun, “LALPAIN hieng ang hin a tih, ‘Ram bunghaia tlangvâl hotuhai hmang hin,’ tiin,” a ta. Chun, ama chun, “Tuin am râlrêl a ta?” a ta. Ama chun a dawn a, “Nang- in teh,” a ta.

en: Then he mustered the young men of the princes of the provinces, and they were two hundred and thirty-two: and after them he mustered all the people, even all the children of Israel, being seven thousand.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chun ram bunghaia hotu tlangvâlhai chu a ko khâwm a, za hni le sâwmthum le pahni an na; chuhai zoa chun mi po po, Israel thlahai po po chu a ko khâwm a, sâng sari an nih.

en: And they went out at noon. But Ben-hadad was drinking himself drunk in the pavilions, he and the kings, the thirty and two kings that helped him.
hmr: Chun, sûnchang laitakin an va suok tah a. Benhadad le lalhai, ama ṭhangpuitu lal sâwmthum le pahni- hai ruok chu an bûktêa chun an lo indâwn rui a.

en: And the young men of the princes of the provinces went out first; and Ben-hadad sent out, and they told him, saying, There are men come out from Samaria.
hmr: Chun, ram bunghaia hotu tlangvâlhai chu an va suok hmasah a, chun, Benhadad chun mi a tir a, anni chun, “Samari khuoa inthawka hung suok an um,” tiin an hril a.

en: And he said, Whether they are come out for peace, take them alive; or whether they are come out for war, take them alive.
hmr: Ama chun, “Inrem tuma hung an ni chun a hringin lo man unla, indo tuma hung an ni chun a hring bawkin lo man ro,” a ta.

en: So these went out of the city, the young men of the princes of the provinces, and the army which followed them.
hmr: Chuongchun, chuonghai, ram bunga hotuhai tlangvâlhai chu a hung zuitu sipaihai le chun khuoa inthawk chu an suok a.

en: And they slew every one his man; and the Syrians fled, and Israel pursued them: and Ben-hadad the king of Syria escaped on a horse with horsemen.
hmr: Chun, an va bitum senghai chu an va that a, chuongchun, Suria mi- hai chu an tlânse tah a, Israelhai chun an hnawt a, chun, Suria lal Benhadad chu sakawr chunga chuongin sakawr chung chuong mi- hai leh an tlânsuok tah a.

en: And the king of Israel went out, and smote the horses and chariots, and slew the Syrians with a great slaughter.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chu a va suok a, sakawr le tawlailîrhai chu a va thawh a, Suria mihai chu a va that rak el a.

en: And the prophet came near to the king of Israel, and said unto him, Go, strengthen thyself, and mark, and see what thou doest; for at the return of the year the king of Syria will come up against thee.
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei chun Israel lal chu a va hnai a, a kuomah, “In- sukhrât sau sau la, i thaw dân ding ngaituo raw khai, kum a hung invawi hin Suria lal chun a hung thaw nâwk ding che a nih,” a ta.

en: And the servants of the king of Syria said unto him, Their god is a god of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we: but let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.
hmr: Chun, Suria lalhai chun a kuomah, “An pathien hi tlâng pathien a na, chuleiin, eini nêkin an hrât a ni hi, phaizâwlah thaw ta inla, anni nêk chun hrât lem ngei ei tih.

en: And do this thing: take the kings away, every man out of his place, and put captains in their room;
hmr: Chun, hieng ang hin thaw rawh, lalhai hi an rêngin thleng vawng la, an aia hin ram awptuhai sie lem la,

en: and number thee an army, like the army that thou hast lost, horse for horse, and chariot for chariot; and we will fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they. And he hearkened unto their voice, and did so.
hmr: chun, sipaihai tawlailîr dâm, sakawr dâm, i chân ta zât ang chie kha sipaihai siemṭha nâwk la; chuongchun, phaizâwla thâwng kan ta, anni nêk chun hrât lem ngei kan tih,” an ta. Chun, an thu chu a awi a, chuong ang chun a thaw tah a.

en: And it came to pass at the return of the year, that Ben-hadad mustered the Syrians, and went up to Aphek, to fight against Israel.
hmr: Chun, a kum nâwka chun Benhadad chun Suria mihai chu a kei khâwm a, Israelhai chu thaw dingin Aphek khuoa chun a hang feh a.

en: And the children of Israel were mustered, and were victualled, and went against them: and the children of Israel encamped before them like two little flocks of kids; but the Syrians filled the country.
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai chu an pungkhâwm a, fâk dinghai an thak zet zet a, thaw dingin an inthawk tah a; chun, Israel thlahai chun kêlte tlâwmte ruol hni ang chau tê hin an va ep veh a; Suria mihai ruok chu a ram sip hin an sip mup el a.

en: And a man of God came near and spake unto the king of Israel, and said, Thus saith Jehovah, Because the Syrians have said, Jehovah is a god of the hills, but he is not a god of the valleys; therefore will I deliver all this great multitude into thy hand, and ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Pathien mi chun Israel lal chu a va hnai a, a va biek a, a kuomah, “LALPAIN hieng ang hin a tih, ‘Suria mihaiin LALPA chu tlâng- hai pathien a na, ruom pathien chu a ni nawh an ti a nih; chuleiin, hieng mipui tamtakhai hi i kutah ka pêk ding a nih; chuongchun, kei hi LALPA chu ka nih ti hrieng in tih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: And they encamped one over against the other seven days. And so it was, that in the seventh day the battle was joined; and the children of Israel slew of the Syrians a hundred thousand footmen in one day.
hmr: Chun, ni sari sûng zet chu an inep zing a. Chun, a ni sari ni chun an inthaw tah a; chun, Israel mihai chun Suria mihai chu ni khatah sipai nuoi khat an that a.

en: But the rest fled to Aphek, into the city; and the wall fell upon twenty and seven thousand men that were left. And Ben-hadad fled, and came into the city, into an inner chamber.
hmr: Mi danghai ruok chu Aphekah khawpui sûnga chun an tlânlût a, a la umhai chu mi sîng hni le sâng sari kul chimin a delhlum a. Chun, Benhadad chu a tlânseh a, khawpui sûnga pindan sûngrila a lût a.

en: And his servants said unto him, Behold now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings: let us, we pray thee, put sackcloth on our loins, and ropes upon our heads, and go out to the king of Israel: peradventure he will save thy life.
hmr: Chun, a rawihai chun a kuom- ah, “Ngai ta, Israel sûng kuohai laia lalhai hi mi lunginsietthei tak an nih ti thu kan hriet a, saiip puon bilin, ei lua hin hruia inkhitin Israel lal kuomah mi vân fetir raw khai; ama chun a hla nuom khiet che rawi mawh,” an ta.

en: So they girded sackcloth on their loins, and put ropes on their heads, and came to the king of Israel, and said, Thy servant Ben-hadad saith, I pray thee, let me live. And he said, Is he yet alive? he is my brother.
hmr: Chuongchun, saiip puon chu an bil a, an lua chun hruiin an inkhit a, Israel lal kuoma chun an va feh a, “I siehlaw Benhadad chun, ‘Lunginsiet- takin mi hla raw se,’ a ti che,” an ta. Ama chun, “A la dam a ni maw? Ka naupa a ni annâwm,” a ta.

en: Now the men observed diligently, and hasted to catch whether it were his mind; and they said, Thy brother Ben-hadad. Then he said, Go ye, bring him. Then Ben-hadad came forth to him; and he caused him to come up into the chariot.
hmr: Chuong mihai chun ngaiṭha- takin, a lungril thu tak a hril a ni ringin, “I unaupa Benhadad kha a nih,” an lo ti var a. Chuongchun, ama chun, “Va fe unla, ama chu hung ṭhuoi ro,” a ta. Chuongchun, Benhadad chu a hung suok a, a kuomah a feh a; chun, ama chun tawlailîrah a lo in- chuongtir a.

en: And Ben-hadad said unto him, The cities which my father took from thy father I will restore; and thou shalt make streets for thee in Damascus, as my father made in Samaria. And I, said Ahab, will let thee go with this covenant. So he made a covenant with him, and let him go.
hmr: Chun, Benhadad chun a kuom- ah, “Ka pain i pa kuoma inthawka khuo a lo lâkhai kha pe kîr nâwk ka ta; chun, ka pain Samari khuoa dâwrpui hmun a siem ang khan Damaska khuoah i dâwrpui hmun ding i siem ve ding annâwm,” a ta. Chun, Ahab chun, “Hi thuthlung le hin infetir ka ti che,” a ta. Chuong- chun, a kuomah thu a thlung a, ân fetir tah a.

en: And a certain man of the sons of the prophets said unto his fellow by the word of Jehovah, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man refused to smite him.
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei naupahai laia mi pakhat hin LALPA thuin a ruolpa kuomah, “Mi hang vaw ta khai,” a ta.

en: Then said he unto him, Because thou hast not obeyed the voice of Jehovah, behold, as soon as thou art departed from me, a lion shall slay thee. And as soon as he was departed from him, a lion found him, and slew him.
hmr: Ama chun a vuok nuom nawh a, Chuongchun, a kuomah, “LALPA thu chu i awi naw leiin, ngai ta, nang hin i mi liemsan phingleh, sakeibakneiin lo sêng a ti che,” a ta. Chun, ama chu a liemsan phingle chun sakeibak- neiin a lo hmuh a, a se tah a.

en: Then he found another man, and said, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man smote him, smiting and wounding him.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi dang a va hmu nâwk a, “Mi hang vaw ta khai,” a ta. Ama chun a hang vuok a, a vuok sil tah a.

en: So the prophet departed, and waited for the king by the way, and disguised himself with his headband over his eyes.
hmr: Chuongchun, zâwlnei chu a feh a, lampuia hin lal chu a lo inchân a, a chal khitnaa a mit inkhumin ân siem danglam a.

en: And as the king passed by, he cried unto the king; and he said, Thy servant went out into the midst of the battle; and, behold, a man turned aside, and brought a man unto me, and said, Keep this man: if by any means he be missing, then shall thy life be for his life, or else thou shalt pay a talent of silver.
hmr: Chun, lal a hung tlung chun lal chu a lo ko a, “I siehlaw hin indona rûnpui hmunah ka va feh a; chun, ngai ta, mi pakhat hi a hung nghah a, ka kuomah mi pakhat a hung ṭhuoi a, ‘Ama hi lo vêng tlat rawh, a tlân- hmang hlau chun a hringna aiah i hringna chân i tih, annawleh tangka talent khat i pêk ding a nih,’ a ta.

en: And as thy servant was busy here and there, he was gone. And the king of Israel said unto him, So shall thy judgment be; thyself hast decided it.
hmr: Chun, i siehlaw hi ka buoi êm kâr chun a lo fe hmang dai el tah a,” a ta. Chun, Israel lal chun a kuomah, “Chuong ang tak chu a nih, i chunga thu tlu chu, nangma ngeiin i suk- thlûk diem ta chu teh,” a ta.

en: And he hasted, and took the headband away from his eyes; and the king of Israel discerned him that he was of the prophets.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a mita inthawk chun a chal khitna chu a hlîp ta vak a; chun, Israel lal chun zâwlneihai laia mi a nih ti a hriet tah a.

en: And he said unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, Because thou hast let go out of thy hand the man whom I had devoted to destruction, therefore thy life shall go for his life, and thy people for his people.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “LALPA chun hieng ang hin a tih, ‘Ṭawngsie ka înphur ta chu în suo ta leiin a hringna aiah i hringna; a mihai aiah i mihai chân i tih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: And the king of Israel went to his house heavy and displeased, and came to Samaria.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chu ngûitak le lungâwi nawtakin a fe tah a; Samari khuoa chun a fe tah a.

en: And it came to pass after these things, that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard, which was in Jezreel, hard by the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.
hmr: Chun, Jezreel mi Naboth chun grêp huon a nei a, chu chu Jezreela Samari lal Ahab in bul ela um a nih.

en: And Ahab spake unto Naboth, saying, Give me thy vineyard, that I may have it for a garden of herbs, because it is near unto my house; and I will give thee for it a better vineyard than it: or, if it seem good to thee, I will give thee the worth of it in money.
hmr: Chun, Ahab chun Naboth chu, “Ka in bul a ni lei hin i grêp huon hi thlai huon dingin mi pe raw khai, a aia chun grêp huon ṭha lem pêng ka ti che; annawleh i nuom lem chun a tangkain a man tâwk chu pêng ka ti che,” a ta, a biek a.

en: And Naboth said to Ahab, Jehovah forbid it me, that I should give the inheritance of my fathers unto thee.
hmr: Chun, Naboth chun Ahab kuom- ah, “Ka puhai ro hang pêk che chu ka ta dingin a âwmin a âwm nawh ie,” a tih a.

en: And Ahab came into his house heavy and displeased because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him; for he had said, I will not give thee the inheritance of my fathers. And he laid him down upon his bed, and turned away his face, and would eat no bread.
hmr: Chun, Jezreel mi Naboth chun a kuoma chuong ang thu chu a hril lei chun Ahab chu ngûitak le lungâwi nawtakin a inah a lût tah a, “Ka puhai ro pe thei naw ning che,” a ti tlat sih a. Chuongchun, a khuma chun a zâl a, khingtieng a nghah a, bu hrim hrim khawm a fâk nuom ta nawh a.

en: But Jezebel his wife came to him, and said unto him, Why is thy spirit so sad, that thou eatest no bread?
hmr: Chuongchun, a nuhmei Jezebel chu a va feh a, a kuomah, “Iengtiziea i lungril chuong lâwma a lungngai a, bu hrim hrim i fâk naw am a ni leh?” a ta.

en: And he said unto her, Because I spake unto Naboth the Jezreelite, and said unto him, Give me thy vineyard for money; or else, if it please thee, I will give thee another vineyard for it: and he answered, I will not give thee my vineyard.
hmr: Ama chun a kuomah, “Jezreel mi Naboth chu ka va biek a, a kuomah, ‘I grêp huon hi min châwktir rawh, annawleh i dit lem chun a aiah grêp huon dang pêng ka ti che,’ ka tih a, ama chun, ‘Ka grêp huon chu pe thei naw ning che,’ tiin a mi dawn annâwm ie,” a ta.

en: And Jezebel his wife said unto him, Dost thou now govern the kingdom of Israel? arise, and eat bread, and let thy heart be merry: I will give thee the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.
