hmr: Chun, a nuhmei Jezebel chun a kuomah, “Israel ram lal hi i nih a ni naw am a nih? Tho la, bu fa la, lungril hlimtakin um raw khai, Jezreel mi Naboth grêp huon chu keiin pêng ka ti che,” a ta.

en: So she wrote letters in Ahab’s name, and sealed them with his seal, and sent the letters unto the elders and to the nobles that were in his city, and that dwelt with Naboth.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ahab hming chun lekha a ziek a, a namna chun a nam a; chun, lekha chu a umna khuoa Naboth tuolbâwm upahai le mi ṭhahai kuomah ân phur a.

en: And she wrote in the letters, saying, Proclaim a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people:
hmr: Chun, lekhaa chun, “Bu nghei thu lo phuong unla, mipui lai Naboth chu inhmatâwngtir unla,

en: and set two men, base fellows, before him, and let them bear witness against him, saying, Thou didst curse God and the king. And then carry him out, and stone him to death.
hmr: mi pahni Belial nauhai a hmaa chun inṭhungtir unla, ‘Pathien le lal i hrilsiet a nih,’ tia a hêktu dingin lo siem ro. Chun, ama chu ṭhuoi suok unla, lo dêng hlum ro,” a ta.

en: And the men of his city, even the elders and the nobles who dwelt in his city, did as Jezebel had sent unto them, according as it was written in the letters which she had sent unto them.
hmr: Chun, a umna khuoa mi, a umna khuoa um upahai le mi ṭhahai chun Jezebelin ân phur lekhaa a ziek ang chun an thawh a.

en: They proclaimed a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people.
hmr: Bu nghei thu chu an phuong a, mipuihai lai Naboth chu an inhma- tâwngtir a.

en: And the two men, the base fellows, came in and sat before him: and the base fellows bare witness against him, even against Naboth, in the presence of the people, saying, Naboth did curse God and the king. Then they carried him forth out of the city, and stoned him to death with stones.
hmr: Chun, mi pahni Belial nauhai chu a hmaa chun an va ṭhung a; chun, Belial mihai chun mipuihai hmaa chun, “Naboth hin Pathien le lal a hrilsiet a nih,” tiin ama Naboth chu an hêk a. Chuongchun, khuoa in- thawk chun an ṭhuoi suok a, lungin an dêng a, a thi tah a.

en: Then they sent to Jezebel, saying, Naboth is stoned, and is dead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jezebel kuoma chun, “Naboth chu lungin an dêng a, a thi tah,” tiin mi an tir a.

en: And it came to pass, when Jezebel heard that Naboth was stoned, and was dead, that Jezebel said to Ahab, Arise, take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, which he refused to give thee for money; for Naboth is not alive, but dead.
hmr: Chun, Jezebelin Naboth chu lungin an dêng a, a thi tah ti a hrietin Jezebel chun Ahab kuoma chun, “Tho la, Jezreel mi Naboth grêp huon, ân châwktir phal naw che kha nei ta raw le, Naboth chu a dam ta nawh a, a thi tah a nih,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, that Ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, to take possession of it.
hmr: Chun, Ahab chun Naboth a thi tah ti a hrietin Jezreel mi Naboth grêp huon chu nei dinga fe thla dingin Ahab chu a tho tah a.

en: And the word of Jehovah came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu Tisbe mi Elija kuoma chun a hung tlung tah a.

en: Arise, go down to meet Ahab king of Israel, who dwelleth in Samaria: behold, he is in the vineyard of Naboth, whither he is gone down to take possession of it.
hmr: “Tho la, Samari khuoa um, Israel lal Ahab be dingin zu fe raw khai, ngai ta, Naboth grêp huona chun a um a; nei tumin chutaka chun a fe thla a nih.

en: And thou shalt speak unto him, saying, Thus saith Jehovah, Hast thou killed, and also taken possession? And thou shalt speak unto him, saying, Thus saith Jehovah, In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth shall dogs lick thy blood, even thine.
hmr: A kuoma chun, ‘LALPAIN hieng ang hin a tih, I that a, i neipêk nâwk nghâl a ni maw? tiin,’ ti la, a kuomah, ‘LALPAIN hieng ang hin a tih, Uiin Naboth thisen an liekna hmun ngeia hin nanga thisen khawm hi an liek ve ding a nih, tiin,’ ti rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Ahab said to Elijah, Hast thou found me, O mine enemy? And he answered, I have found thee, because thou hast sold thyself to do that which is evil in the sight of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Ahab chun Elija kuomah, “I mi hung hmu ta maw, ka hmêl- mapa?” a ta. Chun, ama chun a dawn a, “Ka hmu ta che a ni hi, LALPA mithmua thil ṭha naw thaw dingin inzawr ta che chu.

en: Behold, I will bring evil upon thee, and will utterly sweep thee away and will cut off from Ahab every man-child, and him that is shut up and him that is left at large in Israel:
hmr: Ngai ta, i chunga hin thil ṭha- naw hung intlungtir ka ta, hung suk- bohmang ka ti cheh a, Ahaba inthawk hin naupasal taphawt chu Israel rama mi khuokhira um amanih, khuokhir naw amani khawm chu sukbohmang ka ta,

en: and I will make thy house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah for the provocation wherewith thou hast provoked me to anger, and hast made Israel to sin.
hmr: nangin i mi suklungsen lei le, Israelhai chu thil în suksuoltir leiin Nebat naupa Jeroboam sûnghai le Ahija naupa Baasa sûnghai ang elin i sûnghai hi siem ka tih,” a ta.

en: And of Jezebel also spake Jehovah, saying, The dogs shall eat Jezebel by the rampart of Jezreel.
hmr: Chun, Jezebel chungchâng thu khawm LALPAIN a hril a, “Jezreel khaw kul bulah Jezebel hi uiin la fâng an tih.

en: Him that dieth of Ahab in the city the dogs shall eat; and him that dieth in the field shall the birds of the heavens eat.
hmr: Ahab sûngkuohai laia mi khawpuia thihai po chu uiin fâng an ta; rama thihai po chu chunglêng vatehaiin fâng an tih,” tiin.

en: (But there was none like unto Ahab, who did sell himself to do that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, whom Jezebel his wife stirred up.
hmr: (A nuhmei Jezebel infuipawr a, LALPA mithmua thil ṭha naw thaw dinga inzawr Ahab ang hrim hrim hi tukhawm an um nawh.

en: And he did very abominably in following idols, according to all that the Amorites did, whom Jehovah cast out before the children of Israel.)
hmr: LALPAIN Israel thlahai hmaa a hnawtsuok Amor mihai thilthaw tin- rêng ang, milimhai bein thil tirdak- umtakin a thaw hlak a).

en: And it came to pass, when Ahab heard those words, that he rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his flesh, and fasted, and lay in sackcloth, and went softly.
hmr: Chun, Ahab chun chuong thu chu a hriet chun a puon a keithlêr a, saiip puon a sil a, bu a nghei a, saiip puon chungah a zâl a, ngûitakin ân lawn vêl a.

en: And the word of Jehovah came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu Tisbe mi Elija kuoma chun a hung tlung a,

en: Seest thou how Ahab humbleth himself before me? because he humbleth himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days; but in his son’s day will I bring the evil upon his house.
hmr: “Ahab ka hmaa an ngaitlâwm- zie hi i hmu am? Ka hmaa an ngai- tlâwm lei hin ama dam sûng hin chu a chungah thil ṭha naw intlungtir naw ning, a naupaa inthawk ruok chun a sûnghai chungah thil ṭha naw in- tlungtir ka tih,” tiin.

en: And they continued three years without war between Syria and Israel.
hmr: Chun, kum thum sûng chu Suriahai le Israelhai chu indo loin an um a.

en: And it came to pass in the third year, that Jehoshaphat the king of Judah came down to the king of Israel.
hmr: Chun, a kum thum kum chun Juda lal Jehosaphat chu Israel lal kuomah a zu feh a.

en: And the king of Israel said unto his servants, Know ye that Ramoth-gilead is ours, and we are still, and take it not out of the hand of the king of Syria?
hmr: Israel lal chun a siehlawhai kuomah, “Ramoth-gilead khuo hi eini ta a nih ti hre zing sih a, iengtizieha Suria lal hi lâkpêk loa um am ei ni aw?” a ta. Chun, Jehosaphat kuoma chun, “Ramoth-gilead khuo hi mi hang thawpui ve nuom i tim chu?” a ta.

en: And he said unto Jehoshaphat, Wilt thou go with me to battle to Ramoth-gilead? And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, I am as thou art, my people as thy people, my horses as thy horses.
hmr: Chun, Jehosaphat chun Israel lal kuoma chun, “Kei le nang, i mihai le ka mihai chu pumkhat ei na, ka sakawrhai le i sakawrhai chu pum- khat an nih annâwm,” a ta.

en: And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel, Inquire first, I pray thee, for the word of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Jehosaphat chun Israel lal kuoma chun, “LALPA thu chu la ngai hri phawt la tie,” a ta.

en: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, about four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall I go against Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up; for the Lord will deliver it into the hand of the king.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel lal chun zâwlneihai mi za li lai a ko khâwm a, an kuomah, “Ramoth-gilead khuo hi thaw dingin ka hang inthawk ding am inthawk lo ding?” a ta. Anni chun, “Hang inthawk rawh, LALPAIN lal kuta hin a pêk ding a nih,” an ta.

en: But Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of Jehovah besides, that we may inquire of him?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Jehosaphat chun, “Hitaka hin LALPA zâwlnei dang tu amani bêk ka hang râwn ding hi an um naw am a ni aw?” a ta.

en: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man by whom we may inquire of Jehovah, Micaiah the son of Imlah: but I hate him; for he doth not prophesy good concerning me, but evil. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chun Jehosaphat kuoma chun, “LALPA mi râwnpêk ding Imla naupa Mikaia kha chu a la um kha maw, nisienlakhawm, ama hi chu ka theida zâwngtak a nih; ka chungchâng thu hi a se tieng ngawt naw chu a ṭha tieng a hril hrim hrim ngai nawh,” a ta. Chun, Jehosaphat chun, “Lal hin chuong ang chun chu ti naw raw se khai,” a ta.

en: Then the king of Israel called an officer, and said, Fetch quickly Micaiah the son of Imlah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel lal chun hotu pakhat a hang ko a, “Imla naupa Mikaia kha hung ṭhuoi vak ta,” a ta.

en: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah were sitting each on his throne, arrayed in their robes, in an open place at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets were prophesying before them.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal le Juda lal Jehosaphat chu Samari khaw kul kawtkhâr lûtna bula hrizâwla chun an lal puona inthuomin an lalṭhung- pha ve vea chun an ṭhung a; chun, zâwlneihai po po chun an hmaa chun thu an hril a.

en: And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made him horns of iron, and said, Thus saith Jehovah, With these shalt thou push the Syrians, until they be consumed.
hmr: Chun, Kenaan naupa Zedekia chun thîr kihai a siempêk a, “LALPA chun hieng ang hin a tih, ‘Hienghai hin Suria mihai chu chimit dêr khawpin sik i tih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramoth-gilead, and prosper; for Jehovah will deliver it into the hand of the king.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin zâwlnei po pohai chun, “Ramoth-gileada chun hang fe la, hang hlawtling raw khai, LALPA chun lal kuta hin a pêk ding a nih,” tiin an hril a.

en: And the messenger that went to call Micaiah spake unto him, saying, Behold now, the words of the prophets declare good unto the king with one mouth: let thy word, I pray thee, be like the word of one of them, and speak thou good.
hmr: Chun, Mikaia va ko dinga an tir chun a kuomah, “Ngai ta khai, zâwl- neihai hin thu inang vawngin a ṭha tiengin lal kuoma hin thu an hril seng a, an hril ta ang seng chun hang hril ve la, a ṭha tiengin hang hril ve rawh aw,” tiin a hril a.

en: And Micaiah said, As Jehovah liveth, what Jehovah saith unto me, that will I speak.
hmr: Mikaia ruok chun, “LALPA hringna sâlin ka hril a nih, LALPAIN ka kuoma a hril chu a nih ka hang hril ding chu,” a ta.

en: And when he was come to the king, the king said unto him, Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall we forbear? And he answered him, Go up and prosper; and Jehovah will deliver it into the hand of the king.
hmr: Chun, lal kuoma a hang tlung chun, lal chun a kuomah, “Mikaia, Ramoth-gilead khuo thaw dingin ka hang inthawk ding am a ni, hang inthawk lo ding?” a ta. Chun, ama chun a dawn a, “Hang inthawk la, hang hlawtling raw khai, LALPA chun lal kutah a pêk ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And the king said unto him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou speak unto me nothing but the truth in the name of Jehovah?
hmr: Chun, lal chun a kuomah, “Thu- tak ngawt naw chu LALPA hminga ka kuoma hril lo dingin vawi iengzât rau am ṭawng kân khâmtir ding che a ni leh?” a ta.

en: And he said, I saw all Israel scattered upon the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd: and Jehovah said, These have no master; let them return every man to his house in peace.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Israelhai po po vêngtu neilo berâm angin tlânga an indar vawng ka hmuh a, LALPA- IN, ‘Hienghai hin hotu an nei ta nawh a, mi tin mâni in tieng seng lung- muongtakin fe diel el ta raw hai se,’ a ti a nih,” a ta.

en: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chun Jeho- saphat kuomah, “Ka chungchâng thu hi a se tieng ngawt naw chu a ṭha tieng hrim hrim chu hril naw ni ti ka hril che a ni naw am a ni kha?” a ta.

en: And Micaiah said, Therefore hear thou the word of Jehovah: I saw Jehovah sitting on his throne, and all the host of heaven standing by him on his right hand and on his left.
hmr: Chun, Mikaia chun, “Chuleiin, LALPA thu hi lo ngai ta u, LALPA chu a lalṭhungphaa ṭhung ka hmuh a, vâna mipuihai po po, a changtieng le vawitienga ngîrhai leh.

en: And Jehovah said, Who shall entice Ahab, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead? And one said on this manner; and another said on that manner.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN, ‘Ahab hi Ramoth-gilead khuoa hang feh a, râla thi dingin tuin am thlêm an ta?’ a ti a nih, pakhatin hieng hin a ta, mi dangin chuong chun a ta.

en: And there came forth a spirit, and stood before Jehovah, and said, I will entice him.
hmr: Chuongchun, thlarau pakhat hi a hung suok a, LALPA hmaa chun a ngîr a, ‘Keiin thlêm ka tih,’ a ta.

en: And Jehovah said unto him, Wherewith? And he said, I will go forth, and will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And he said, Thou shalt entice him, and shalt prevail also: go forth, and do so.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN a kuomah, ‘Iengtin am ie?’ a ta. Chun, ama chun, ‘Va fêng ka ta, zâwlnei po pohai hmûra chun thlarau khêlinhlipah vân chang ka tih,’ a ta. Chun, ama chun, ‘Thlêm ngei i ta, hlaw khawm hlawtling ngei i tih, va fe la, chuong ang chun va thaw raw leh,’ a ta.

en: Now therefore, behold, Jehovah hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these thy prophets; and Jehovah hath spoken evil concerning thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, ngai ta, LALPAIN hieng i zâwlneihai po po hmûra hin thlarau khêlinhlip a sieh a, i chungchâng thu hi a ṭha naw tiengin LALPAIN a hril tah a nih,” a ta.

en: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and smote Micaiah on the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of Jehovah from me to speak unto thee?
hmr: Chuongchun, Kenaan naupa Zedekia chun a hung hnai a, Mikaia bienga chun a hung ben a, “LALPA thlarau chun i kuoma thu hril dingin khawtieng am a mi mâksan leh?” a ta.

en: And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see on that day, when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
hmr: Mikaia chun, “Ngai rawh, pin- dan sûngrila inbi dinga i lût ni chun la hrieng i tih,” a ta.

en: And the king of Israel said, Take Micaiah, and carry him back unto Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son;
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chun, “Mikaia hi ṭhuoi unla, khawpui awptu Amon le lal naupa Joas kuomah fepui ta u;

en: and say, Thus saith the king, Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I come in peace.
hmr: chun, lalin hieng ang hin a tih, ‘Hi mipa hi lung inah khum unla, lungmuongtaka ka hung nâwk hma- khat chun rinumna tui lo pe ro,’ tiin, ti ro,” a ta.

en: And Micaiah said, If thou return at all in peace, Jehovah hath not spoken by me. And he said, Hear, ye peoples, all of you.
hmr: Chun, Mikaia chun, “Lung- muongtaka i hung nâwk tâk leh, LALPAIN kei mi hmang hin thu a hril naw nîng a tih,” a ta. Chun, ama ma chun, “Nangni mipuihai, in rêngin lo hre seng ro,” a ta.

en: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel lal le Juda lal Jehosaphat chu Ramoth-gileada chun an hang feh a.

en: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself, and go into the battle; but put thou on thy robes. And the king of Israel disguised himself, and went into the battle.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chun Jehosa- phat kuomah, “Insiem danglam ka ta, indonaa chun hang fe vêng ka tih a, nang ruok chun chu i lal puon sil la,” a ta. Chuongchun, Israel lal chu ân siem danglam a, indonaa chun a hang feh a.

en: Now the king of Syria had commanded the thirty and two captains of his chariots, saying, Fight neither with small nor great, save only with the king of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Suria lal chun a tawlailîr chunga hotu sâwmthum le pahnihai kuoma chun, “Israel lal ngawt naw chu, mi lien khawm, mi chîn khawm a tu tukhawm thaw naw ro,” tiin thu a pêk a.

en: And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, Surely it is the king of Israel; and they turned aside to fight against him: and Jehoshaphat cried out.
hmr: Chun, tawlailîr chunga hotuhai chun Jehosaphat an hei hmu chun, “Israel lal a ni ngei el leh,” an ta; chuongchun, thaw tum chun an inhuol tah a; chun, Jehosaphat chu a khêk suok a.

en: And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.
hmr: Chun, tawlailîr chunga hotuhai chun Israel lal a ni nawh ti an hriet chun, an hnawt lai chu an lêt nâwk tah a.

en: And a certain man drew his bow at a venture, and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the armor: wherefore he said unto the driver of his chariot, Turn thy hand, and carry me out of the host; for I am sore wounded.
hmr: Chun, mi pakhat hin tum bîk neilo hin a thalngul a kuoi a, Israel lal chu âwmphaw le âwmphaw inkârah a kâp a, chuongchun, a tawlailîr khaltu kuoma chun, “Kei her la, sipaihai laia inthawk hi mi suokpui raw khai, hliemna natak ka tuok ta hi,” a ta.

en: And the battle increased that day: and the king was stayed up in his chariot against the Syrians, and died at even; and the blood ran out of the wound into the bottom of the chariot.
hmr: Chun, chu ni chun inthawna chu a nasa ta hle el a, lal chu a tawlailîra chun Suria mihai hmua chun an inngîrtir a, chun, zântieng chun a thi tah a; ama inhliemnaa inthawk chun thisen chu tawlailîr sûnga chun a luong dup dup a.

en: And there went a cry throughout the host about the going down of the sun, saying, Every man to his city, and every man to his country.
hmr: Chun, nisa tlâk tâwm lai vêl chun, sipaihai lai chun, “Mi tin mâni in tieng seng, mi tin mâni ram tieng seng fe vawng ta raw hai se,” tiin an khêk vêl ta rak el a.

en: So the king died, and was brought to Samaria; and they buried the king in Samaria.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chu a thi tah a, Samari khuoa chun an lûtpui a; Samari khuoa chun lal chu an phûm tah a.

en: And they washed the chariot by the pool of Samaria; and the dogs licked up his blood (now the harlots washed themselves there); according unto the word of Jehovah which he spake.
hmr: Chun, Samari khaw dil panga chun tawlailîr chu an sâwp a; chun, LALPA thu hril ta ang ngei khan a thisen chu uiin an liek tah a; (chutaka chun nawchizawrhai chu an insâwp hlak).

en: Now the rest of the acts of Ahab, and all that he did, and the ivory house which he built, and all the cities that he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Chuongchun, Ahab chanchin danghai, a thilthaw po pohai, a saiha in bâwl dâm, a khaw siemhai po po chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: So Ahab slept with his fathers; and Ahaziah his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ahab chu a puhai kuoma chun a in tah a; chun, a nau- pa Ahazia chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: And Jehoshaphat the son of Asa began to reign over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal Ahab inlal kum linaah Asa naupa Jehosaphat chu Judahai chunga chun ân lal ṭan a.

en: Jehoshaphat was thirty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
hmr: Jehosaphat chu ân lal ṭan lai chun kum sâwmthum le kum nga a na; Jerusalem khuoa chun kum sâwmhni le kum nga ro a rêl a. A nu hming chu Azuba, Silhi naunu a nih.

en: And he walked in all the way of Asa his father; he turned not aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah: howbeit the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
hmr: A pa Asa lampui hraw po po chu a hraw veh a; pêtsan dêr loin LALPA mithmuah thilṭha a thaw hlak a, bâwlhmunhai chu a sukbo vawng nawh a, bâwlhmunahai chun mihai chu an inthâwiin riminhnikhai chu an la raw zing hlak a.

en: And Jehoshaphat made peace with the king of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Jehosaphat chun Israel lal le inremna a siem a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, and his might that he showed, and how he warred, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
hmr: Chuongchun, Jehosaphat chan- chin danghai dâm, a thilthawtheizie a suklang thuhai dâm, a râl do thu- hai chu Juda lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And the remnant of the sodomites, that remained in the days of his father Asa, he put away out of the land.
hmr: Chun, a pa Asa dam laia pasal inzawrhai a la umhai kha a rama inthawkin a hnawt suok vawng a.

en: And there was no king in Edom: a deputy was king.
hmr: Chun, Edom rama chun lal an um nawh a, lal aiawtu chun ro a rêl a.

en: Jehoshaphat made ships of Tarshish to go to Ophir for gold: but they went not; for the ships were broken at Ezion-geber.
hmr: Jehosaphat chun Ophira râng- kachak phur ding Tarsis lawnghai a tuk a, nisienlakhawm, an fe ta nawh a; Ezion-geber hmuna chun lawnghai chu a se ta vawng sih a.

en: Then said Ahaziah the son of Ahab unto Jehoshaphat, Let my servants go with thy servants in the ships. But Jehoshaphat would not.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ahab naupa Aha- zia chun Jehosaphat kuomah, “Ka mihai hi i mihai leh lawngah fe hmunkhat raw hai se chu,” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, Jehosaphat chun a remti nawh a.

en: And Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father; And Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Jehosaphat chu a puhai kuomah a in tah a, a puhai lai, a pu David khawpuia chun an phûm tah a; chun, a naupa Jehoram chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: Ahaziah the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and he reigned two years over Israel.
hmr: Chun, Juda lal Jehosaphat inlal kum sâwm le kum sari kum chun Ahab naupa Ahazia chu Samari khuoa chun Israelhai chungah ân lal ṭan a; Israelhai chunga chun kum hni ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, and walked in the way of his father, and in the way of his mother, and in the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, wherein he made Israel to sin.
hmr: Chun, LALPA mithmua chun thil ṭhanaw a thaw hlak a, a nu le a pa lampui hrawhai, Nebat naupa Israel- hai thil insuksuoltirtu Jeroboam lampui hrawhai chu a hraw ve hlak a.

en: And he served Baal, and worshipped him, and provoked to anger Jehovah, the God of Israel, according to all that his father had done.
hmr: Chun, a pa thaw ang taphawt thawin Baal rawng a bâwl a, a biek hlak a, LALPA Israelhai Pathien chu a suklungsen hlak.

en: And Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh’s daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of Jehovah, and the wall of Jerusalem round about.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun Aigupta lal Pharao le inkungkeina a siem a, Pharao naunu a nei a, ama in le LALPA in a bâwl hma le, Jerusalem khuo kula ân huol vêl hmakhat chun David khawpuia chun ân umtir a.

en: Only the people sacrificed in the high places, because there was no house built for the name of Jehovah until those days.
hmr: Mipuihai chu bâwlhmunahai an inthâwi el hlak a, chu hma chun LALPA hming ta dinga in bâwl a la um hri naw leiin.

en: And Solomon loved Jehovah, walking in the statutes of David his father: only he sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
hmr: Solomon chun LALPA chu a hmangai a, a pa David thuruothai chu a zâwm hlak a, bâwlhmunahai ân thâwi a, rim inhnikhai a raw el hlaka chu.

en: And the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there; for that was the great high place: a thousand burnt-offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar.
hmr: Chun, lal chu inthâwi dingin Gibeon khuoah a feh a, chu chu bâwl- hmun ropuitak a ni sih a; Solomon chun chu maichâm chunga chun pumrawhmang thilinhlân sâng khat zet ân hlân a.

en: In Gibeon Jehovah appeared to Solomon in a dream by night; and God said, Ask what I shall give thee.
hmr: Chun, Gibeon khuoa chun zânah LALPA chu Solomon kuomah a mangah a hung inlâr a; chun, Pa- thienin, “Hni ta, ieng am a na ka pêk ding che?” a ta.

en: And Solomon said, Thou hast showed unto thy servant David my father great lovingkindness, according as he walked before thee in truth, and in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with thee; and thou hast kept for him this great lovingkindness, that thou hast given him a son to sit on his throne, as it is this day.
hmr: Solomon chun, “I siehlaw ka pa David kha i mithmua thutak le, felnaa leh, lungril indiktak puta a um ang pei khan nang chun a kuomah lunginsietna nasatak în langtir a, nangin hi lunginsietna nasatak hi a ta dingin i vopêk a, nangin a lal- ṭhungphaa ṭhung ding naupa i pêk a, vawisûna a hung um ta ang ngei hin.

en: And now, O Jehovah my God, thou hast made thy servant king instead of David my father: and I am but a little child; I know not how to go out or come in.
hmr: Chuongchun, aw LALPA ka Pathien, nang chun i siehlaw hi ka pa David aia chun lalah i lo siem tah a; kei chu chu naupangsie el ka la na, thu hung tieng le fe tieng khawm hi ka la hriet nawh a,

en: And thy servant is in the midst of thy people which thou hast chosen, a great people, that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude.
hmr: I siehlaw hi i mihai i thlanghai, mi tamtak, an tam leia tiem sêng ruollo le, a zât hriet sêng ruol lohai lai hin a um a na.

en: Give thy servant therefore an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and evil; for who is able to judge this thy great people?
hmr: Chuongchun, i mihai rorêlpêkna dingin i siehlaw hi hrietna lungril hung pe la, a sie le a ṭha ka thlier theina dingin, i mi hieng zât zozai hi tuin am ro rêlpêk thei a ta le?” a ta.

en: And the speech pleased the Lord, that Solomon had asked this thing.
hmr: Chun, Solomonin chu thil chu a hni leiin, chu thuhril chun LALPA a suklâwm hleh a.

en: And God said unto him, Because thou hast asked this thing, and hast not asked for thyself long life, neither hast asked riches for thyself, nor hast asked the life of thine enemies, but hast asked for thyself understanding to discern justice;
hmr: Chun, Pathien chun a kuomah, “Nangin i ta dinga dam sâwtna hni lo a, hieng ang hi i hni lem leiin le, i ta dinga hausakna khawm hni lo a, i hmêlmahai thina ding khawm hni lo a, i ta dinga rorêl thiemna i hni leiin, ngai ta, i hni ang chun ka thaw tah a;

en: behold, I have done according to thy word: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there hath been none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee.
hmr: ngai ta, varna le hrietna lungril ka pêk che a nih; chuongchun, i hmaah nangma ang hrim hrim tu- khawm an um nawh a, i hnunga khawm nanga ang hrim hrim chu tukhawm hung um ta naw bawk an tih.

en: And I have also given thee that which thou hast not asked, both riches and honor, so that there shall not be any among the kings like unto thee, all thy days.
hmr: Chun, i hni naw hausakna le ropuina khawm ka pêk bawk che; Chuongchun, i dam sûngin lalhai lai chun nanga ang hrim hrim um naw ni hai.

en: And if thou wilt walk in my ways, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as thy father David did walk, then I will lengthen thy days.
hmr: I pa Davidin a hraw anga, ka thuruothai le ka thupêkhai pawm dinga ka lampuihai i hraw chun in- dam sâwttir bawk ka ti che,” a ta.

en: And Solomon awoke; and, behold, it was a dream: and he came to Jerusalem, and stood before the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, and offered up burnt-offerings, and offered peace-offerings, and made a feast to all his servants.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chu a hang har a, ngai ta, mang a lo ni zing el a; chun, Jerusalemah a feh a, LALPA thu- thlung bâwm hmaah a ngîr a, pumrawhmang thilinhlân le inremna thilinhlân ân hlân a; a siehlaw po pohai ta dingin ruoi a ṭheh a.

en: Then there came two women that were harlots, unto the king, and stood before him.
hmr: Nuhmei pahni nawchizawr, lal kuoma chun an hung a, ama hmaah an hang ngîr a.

en: And the one woman said, Oh, my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house; and I was delivered of a child with her in the house.
hmr: Chun, nuhmei pakhat chun, “Aw ka lalpa, hi nuhmei le hin in khata um ve ve kan na, chu ina a um ve lai chun nau ka nei a.

en: And it came to pass the third day after I was delivered, that this woman was delivered also; and we were together; there was no stranger with us in the house, save we two in the house.
hmr: Chun, ka nau nei ni thum hnunga chun hi nuhmei khawm hin a nei veh a; um hmunkhat kan na, chu ina um keini pahni chau naw chu, chu ina chun tukhawm mikhuol um an um nawh a.

en: And this woman’s child died in the night, because she lay upon it.
hmr: Chun, hi nuhmei nau hi zânah a lo thih a; a delhlum a nih.

en: And she arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while thy handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom.
hmr: Chuongchun, zân lai chun a tho a, i suoknu hi a in kârin ka naupa ka kuoma um chu a lâk a, a pawm a, a nau thi chu a mîn pawmtir a.

en: And when I rose in the morning to give my child suck, behold, it was dead; but when I had looked at it in the morning, behold, it was not my son, whom I did bear.
hmr: A zînga zîngkâra ka nau nêne pe dinga ka hang tho chun a thi a lo ni zing el a, nisienkhawm, zîngkâra ka hang en chieng chun, ngai ta, ka naupa, ka inei kha a lo ni ta dêr da el a,” a ta.

en: And the other woman said, Nay; but the living is my son, and the dead is thy son. And this said, No; but the dead is thy son, and the living is my son. Thus they spake before the king.
hmr: Nuhmei dang chun, “Ni lo, a dam lem hi ka naupa a na, a thi hi i naupa a nih,” a ti veh a. Pakhat chun, “Ni lo, a thi hi i naupa a na, a dam hi keia naupa a nih,” a lo ti tlat bawk a. Chuong ang chun lal hmaa chun an hril ve ve a.

en: Then said the king, The one saith, This is my son that liveth, and thy son is the dead: and the other saith, Nay; but thy son is the dead, and my son is the living.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun, “Pakhat- in, ‘A dam lem hi ka naupa a na, a thi hi i naupa a nih,’ a tih a, chun, pa- khatin, ‘Ni lo, a thi hi i naupa a na, a dam hi ka naupa a nih,’ a ti bawk sih a,” a ta.

en: And the king said, Fetch me a sword. And they brought a sword before the king.
hmr: Chun, lal chun, “Kâwlhnâm mi hung lapêk ta u,” a ta. Chuongchun, kâwlhnâm chu lal hmaa chun an hung lâk a.

en: And the king said, Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to the other.
hmr: Chun, lal chun, “Nautê a dam kha tum hni insuo unla, a chenve chu pakhat kha pe unla, a chenve chu pakhat kha pe ro,” a ta.

en: Then spake the woman whose the living child was unto the king, for her heart yearned over her son, and she said, Oh, my lord, give her the living child, and in no wise slay it. But the other said, It shall be neither mine nor thine; divide it.
hmr: Chuongchun, nautê dam lem a nu chun nautê chu a lainat êm êm el sih a; lal kuoma chun, “Aw ka lalpa, nautê dam hi ama kha pe el rawh, a that chu that lul naw raw khai,” a ta. Pakhat lem chun, “Chang bîk naw tawp ka tih, nang khawma chang bîk naw bawk i tih, tanbawng el ro,” a ta.

en: Then the king answered and said, Give her the living child, and in no wise slay it: she is the mother thereof.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun a dawn a, “Nautê dam kha a hmasanu kha pe ro, that dêr naw ro, ama ngei kha a nu a ni kha,” a ta.

en: And all Israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged; and they feared the king: for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do justice.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai po po chun chu thua lal rorêl dân chu an lo hriet a; lal chu an ṭi ta hle el a; rorêlna dinga Pathien varna amaa chun a um ti an hriet ta sih a.

en: And king Solomon was king over all Israel.
hmr: Lal Solomon chu Israelhai po po chungah lalin a um tah a.

en: And these were the princes whom he had: Azariah the son of Zadok, the priest;
hmr: Hienghai hi a mi lien neihai chu an nih: Zadok naupa Azaria chu thiempu a na, Sisa naupahai Eliho- reph le Ahija chu lekha ziektu an na,

en: Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder;
hmr: Ahilud naupa Jehosaphat chu chanchin ziektu a na.

en: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the host; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;
hmr: Jehoiada naupa Benaia chu sipai hotu a na; Zadok le Abiathar chu thiempu an nih;

en: and Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers; and Zabud the son of Nathan was chief minister, and the king’s friend;
hmr: Nathan naupa Azaria chu hotu- hai chunga mi a na; Nathan naupa Zabud chu thiempu le lal ruolpa a na,

en: and Ahishar was over the household; and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the men subject to taskwork.
hmr: Ahisar chu insûng tieng hotu a na; Abda naupa Adoniram chu sin- thawa ruoi luihai hotu a nih.

en: And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, who provided victuals for the king and his household: each man had to make provision for a month in the year.
hmr: Solomon chun Israel po pohai chunga chun hotu sâwmpahni a nei a, chuonghai chun lal ta ding le a sûngkuohai ta ding chun fâk ding an ngaituo hlak a, mi pakhatin kum khatah thla khat pei fâk ding a ngaituo ding a nih.

en: And these are their names: Ben-hur, in the hill-country of Ephraim;
hmr: Chun, hieng hi an hminghai chu a nih: Ephraim tlâng ramah Ben-hur;

en: Ben-deker, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Beth-shemesh, and Elon-beth-hanan;
hmr: Makaz khuoa dâm, Saalbim khuoa dâm, Beth-semes khuoa dâm, Elonbeth-hanan khuoa dâm chun Ben-dekar a na;

en: Ben-hesed, in Arubboth (to him pertained Socoh, and all the land of Hepher);
hmr: Aruboth rama chun Ben-hesed a na, ama chun Soko le Hepher ram po po a chang sah a;

en: Ben-abinadab, in all the height of Dor (he had Taphath the daughter of Solomon to wife);
hmr: Dor zosâng ram po poah, Ben-abinadab a na; ama chun Solomon naunu Taphath chu nu- hmeiah a nei a;

en: Baana the son of Ahilud, in Taanach and Megiddo, and all Beth-shean which is beside Zarethan, beneath Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah, as far as beyond Jokmeam;
hmr: Taanak khuo le Megiddo khuoa dâm, Jezreel khaw hnuoi Zarethan khaw bula um Beth-sean biel po poa dâm, Beth-seana inthawka Abel- meholah-a dâm, Jokmeam ram dep chenin Ahilud naupa Baana a na;

en: Ben-geber, in Ramoth-gilead (to him pertained the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; even to him pertained the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, threescore great cities with walls and brazen bars);
hmr: Ramoth-gilead khuoah Ben- geber, ama chun Manasse naupa Jair khuo, Gilead rama umhai chu a chang sah a; Basan rama Argob biel, khaw ropuitak tak khaw sâwmruk, kul le a kalna dâr tluon neihai khawm a chang sah a;

en: Ahinadab the son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;
hmr: Mahanaim khuoah Iddo naupa Ahinadab a na;

en: Ahimaaz, in Naphtali (he also took Basemath the daughter of Solomon to wife);
hmr: Naphtali ramah Ahimaz a na; ama khawm chun Solomon naunu Basemath chu nuhmeiah a nei a;

en: Baana the son of Hushai, in Asher and Bealoth;
hmr: Aser le Bealoth khuohaia chun Husai naupa Baana a na;

en: Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar;
hmr: Issakar ramah Parua naupa Jehosaphat a na;

en: Shimei the son of Ela, in Benjamin;
hmr: Benjamin ramah Ela naupa Simei a na;

en: Geber the son of Uri, in the land of Gilead, the country of Sihon king of the Amorites and of Og king of Bashan; and he was the only officer that was in the land.
hmr: Amorhai lal Sihon le Basan lal Og ram Gilead ramah Uria naupa Geber; chu rama chun hotu pakhat a um.

en: Judah and Israel were many as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking and making merry.
hmr: Judahai le Israelhai chu tui- suoriet pang ṭieu phaiphin zât zetin an tam a: an fâkin an dâwn a, hlimtakin an um hlak a.

en: And Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the River unto the land of the Philistines, and unto the border of Egypt: they brought tribute, and served Solomon all the days of his life.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun Vadunga inthawkin Philistin mihai ram le Aigupta ramri chenin ram po po chunga chun ro a rêl a; lâwm- manhai an hung chawi hlak a, Solomon dam sûng po chun a rawng an bâwl hlak a.

en: And Solomon’s provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and threescore measures of meal,
hmr: Solomon ni khat fâk khawp chu beiphit inditak tekhâwng sâwmthum le, beiphit narân tekhâwng sâwmruk a nih;

en: ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and a hundred sheep, besides harts, and gazelles, and roebucks, and fatted fowl.
hmr: chun, bâwngchal thâutak sâwm, bâwngchal tla mi sâwmhni leh, berâm za leh, chuong naw khawm chu sakhihai dâm, sangaihai dâm, sakhi chalhai dâm, âr châwm thâuhai leh a nih.

en: For he had dominion over all the region on this side the River, from Tiphsah even to Gaza, over all the kings on this side the River: and he had peace on all sides round about him.
hmr: Vadung râltieng ram po po, Tipsaa inthawka Gaza chenin; Va- dung râla lalhai po po chunga chun ân lal a; a vêla mihai po po le chun râlmuongin an um hlak a.

en: And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig-tree, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, all the days of Solomon.
hmr: Chun, Solomon dam sûng po chun Judahai le Israelhai chu Dana inthawka Beer-seba khuo chenin mi tin mâni grêphrui bula le mâni thei- chang kûng bula chun lungmuong- takin an um seng a.

en: And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun a tawlailîr siena dingin sakawr in sîng li le, sakawr chung chuong mi sîng khat le sâng hni a nei a.

en: And those officers provided victuals for king Solomon, and for all that came unto king Solomon’s table, every man in his month; they let nothing be lacking.
hmr: Chuong hotuhai chun mâni chan thla peiah Solomon le lal Solomon dawkâna hung awt vetuhai po po fâk ding chu an ngaituo hlak a; pêk kim lo an nei ngai nawh.

en: Barley also and straw for the horses and swift steeds brought they unto the place where the officers were, every man according to his charge.
hmr: Mi tinin an thaw dinga ruot ang peiin an umna ding hmuna chun sakawrhai le ran tlân hrâttakhai ta dingin buṭei le bupâwlhai an hung siekhâwl hlak a.

en: And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea-shore.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin Solomon chu varna le hrietna nasatak le, lungril lienna tuisuoriet panga ṭieu phaiphin ang el a pêk a.

en: And Solomon’s wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east, and all the wisdom of Egypt.
hmr: Solomon varna chun khawsak nauhai po po varna le Aigupta mihai varna po po chu a khûm vawng a.

en: For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Calcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all the nations round about.
hmr: Mi po po nêkin a var lem a; Mahol nauhai, Ezra mi Ethan hai, Heman hai, Kalkol hai, Darda hai nêk khawmin; chuongchun, a vêl hnam po po lai chun a hming ân thang tah a.

en: And he spake three thousand proverbs; and his songs were a thousand and five.
hmr: Thuvarhai sâng thum a hril a; chun, a hlahai chu sâng khat le panga a nih.

en: And he spake of trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall; he spake also of beasts, and of birds, and of creeping things, and of fishes.
hmr: Thing chanchin hai khawm, Lebanon tlânga sidar thinga in- thawka kula hung ṭo suok hussop chenin a hril hlak a; sa chanchin dâm, vate chanchin dâm, bawkinvâka lâwn mi chanchin dâm, nga chanchin dâm khawm a hril thei a.

en: And there came of all peoples to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon varna chanchin hre taphawthai chu khaw- vêla lalhai po poa inthawkin chi tina mi a varna ngai dingin an hung hlak a.

en: And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants unto Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father: for Hiram was ever a lover of David.
hmr: Chun, Tura lal Hiram chun Solomon kuoma chun a siehlaw- hai a tir a, a pa aia lal dingin hriek an nâl ti a lo hriet sih a; Hiram chu David ngainatu a ni rawp hlak hrim a.

en: And Solomon sent to Hiram, saying,
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun Hiram kuoma chun,

en: Thou knowest how that David my father could not build a house for the name of Jehovah his God for the wars which were about him on every side, until Jehovah put them under the soles of his feet.
hmr: “Ka pa David khan LALPAIN a hmêlmahai a ke hnuoia a sie hmakhat khan chu a vêl kil tin kil tanga indonahai lei khan, LALPA a Pathien hming dingin in a bâwl thei nawh ti i hriet a.

en: But now Jehovah my God hath given me rest on every side; there is neither adversary, nor evil occurrence.
hmr: Tu ruok hin chu LALPA ka Pathien chun kil tinah muongna a mîn neitir tah a, hmêlmahai khawm an um ta naw bawk a.

en: And, behold, I purpose to build a house for the name of Jehovah my God, as Jehovah spake unto David my father, saying, Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room, he shall build the house for my name.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka pa David kuoma, ‘I naupa i aia i lalṭhungpha kân hluotir ding chun ka hming dingin in chu la bâwl a tih,’ tia a lo hril ta ang khan, LALPA ka Pathien hming dinga in bâwl ka tum a.

en: Now therefore command thou that they cut me cedar-trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants; and I will give thee hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt say: for thou knowest that there is not among us any that knoweth how to cut timber like unto the Sidonians.
hmr: Chuongchun, Lebanon tlânga mi sidar thinghai mi phûrpêk dingin thu pe la, ka siehlawhai khawm i sie- hlawhai lai hung ṭhang vêng an ta; chun, i siehlawhai hlaw ding chu i hril ang taphawtin pe pei ka ti che; Zidon mihai anga thing phûr thiem keini lai tukhawm an um nawh ti i hriet sih a,” tiin mi a tir a.

en: And it came to pass, when Hiram heard the words of Solomon, that he rejoiced greatly, and said, Blessed be Jehovah this day, who hath given unto David a wise son over this great people.
hmr: Chun, Hiramin Solomon thu a lo hriet chun a lâwm ta êm êm el a, “Hieng mi tamtak chunga rorêl dinga naupa vartak David kuoma petu LALPA chu vawisûn hin inpâkin um raw se,” a ta.

en: And Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, I have heard the message which thou hast sent unto me: I will do all thy desire concerning timber of cedar, and concerning timber of fir.
hmr: Chun, Hiram chun Solomon kuomah, “I thu mi hung incha chu ka lo hriet a, sidar thing thu le fâr thing chu i mamaw ang peiin lo thâwng ka tih.

en: My servants shall bring them down from Lebanon unto the sea; and I will make them into rafts to go by sea unto the place that thou shalt appoint me, and will cause them to be broken up there, and thou shalt receive them; and thou shalt accomplish my desire, in giving food for my household.
hmr: Ka siehlawhaiin Lebanon tlânga inthawkin tuisuoriet chenin hung la thlâng an ta; chun, i hmun mi ruotpêk dinga tuisuorieta tawl dingin intêltir ka ta; chun, chu hmuna chun insuttir ka ta, nangin lo lâng i ta; chun, nang khawma ka sûngkuohai fâk ding tumin ka mamaw chu i lo phuhrûk ve thung ding annâwm,” tiin mi a tir a.

en: So Hiram gave Solomon timber of cedar and timber of fir according to all his desire.
hmr: Chuongchun, Hiram chun sidar thing le fâr thing chu Solomon chu a mamaw ang ang chun a pêk a.

en: And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat for food to his household, and twenty measures of pure oil: thus gave Solomon to Hiram year by year.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun Hiram chu a sûngkuohai fâk dingin bu tekhâwng sîng hni le hriek sâwr tekhâwng sâwmhni a pêk a, chu chu Solomonin kum tina Hiram a pêk ang dân chu a nih.

en: And Jehovah gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him; and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon; and they two made a league together.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN a tiem ang ngeiin Solomon chu varna a pêk a, chun, Hiram le Solomon inkâra chun inremna a um a, an pahni chun thu an thlung ve ve tah a.

en: And king Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and the levy was thirty thousand men.
hmr: Chun, lal Solomon chun Israel mihai po po laia chun mi sinthawa ruoi lui pâwl a siem a; ruoi lui pâwl chu mi sîng thum an nih.

en: And he sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses; a month they were in Lebanon, and two months at home: and Adoniram was over the men subject to taskwork.
hmr: Lebanona chun thla khata in- thlâk peiin sîng khat a tir hlak a, thla khat Lebanona chun an hang um a, thla hni chu anni in tieng, Adoniram chu sinthawa ruoi luihai hotu a nih.

en: And Solomon had threescore and ten thousand that bare burdens, and fourscore thousand that were hewers in the mountains;
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun thil phur mi sîng sari le, lung sut mi sîng riet tlânghaia chun a nei a;

en: besides Solomon’s chief officers that were over the work, three thousand and three hundred, who bare rule over the people that wrought in the work.
hmr: Chuonghai chu tiem loin Solomon chun a sin chunga hotubîk, sinthaw vêngtu sâng thum le za thum a nei bawk a.

en: And the king commanded, and they hewed out great stones, costly stones, to lay the foundation of the house with wrought stone.
hmr: Chun, lal thupêk angin lung- phûm chu lung sutsaa rem dingin lung lientak tak el, lung man tamtak takhai an hung lâk a.

en: And Solomon’s builders and Hiram’s builders and the Gebalites did fashion them, and prepared the timber and the stones to build the house.
hmr: Chun, in bâwltuhai Solomon mihai le Hiram mihai le Gebal mihai chun lunghai chu an sut a, in bâwlna ding chun thing le lunghai chu an buotsai a.

en: And it came to pass in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon’s reign over Israel, in the month Ziv, which is the second month, that he began to build the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Israel thlahai Aigupta rama an suok chena inthawk kum za li le kum sâwmrietna kum, Israelhai chunga Solomon inlal kum lina, Ziv thla, thla hninaa chun LALPA in bâwl chu a ṭan a.

en: And the house which king Solomon built for Jehovah, the length thereof was threescore cubits, and the breadth thereof twenty cubits, and the height thereof thirty cubits.
hmr: Chun, Solomonin LALPA ta dinga a in bâwl chu a dung tieng tawng sâwmruk a na, a khang tieng chu tawng sâwmhni a na, ân sâng tieng chu tawng sâwmthum a nih.

en: And the porch before the temple of the house, twenty cubits was the length thereof, according to the breadth of the house; and ten cubits was the breadth thereof before the house.
hmr: Chun, chu ina Hmun inthieng hmaa tuolpûk chu a in khang tieng chen tawng sâwmhnia sei a na, a hma tienga mi khang tieng chu tawng sâwm a nih.

en: And for the house he made windows of fixed lattice-work.
hmr: Chun, ina chun tukverhai a sûnga inthawka a puotienga chîn zuihai chu a siem a.

en: And against the wall of the house he built stories round about, against the walls of the house round about, both of the temple and of the oracle; and he made side-chambers round about.
hmr: Chun, in bang vêlin, biekna in bang vêla khawm, biekna hmun inthieng bang vêla khawm chun, chu in bang sik chun in sâwng nei a bâwl a; chun, a vêl el chun pindanhai a siem a;

en: The nethermost story was five cubits broad, and the middle was six cubits broad, and the third was seven cubits broad; for on the outside he made offsets in the wall of the house round about, that the beams should not have hold in the walls of the house.
hmr: a sâwng hnuoi hnung tak chu a khang tieng tawng nga a na, a laia mi chu a khang tieng tawng ruk a na, a pathumna chu a khang tieng tawng sari a nih; kalkhanghai chu in banga chun rawl ngai loin, a puotienga chun a vêlin a bang hrûla chun ân nghatna a siem a.

en: And the house, when it was in building, was built of stone made ready at the quarry; and there was neither hammer nor axe nor any tool of iron heard in the house, while it was in building.
hmr: Chun, in chu an bâwl lai chun, lung a chona hmuna sut sa vawnga bâwl a na, chuongchun, an bâwl sûng po chu tubau ri dâm, hreipui ri dâm, thîr hriemhrei ri hrim hrim chu ina chun hriet a ni nawh a.

en: The door for the middle side-chambers was in the right side of the house: and they went up by winding stairs into the middle story, and out of the middle into the third.
hmr: Pindan lailungtakhai kawtkhâr chu, chu in changtieng panga chun a um a, a laia chun kailâwn inhera hin an lâwn kai a; chun, a lailunga inthawk chun a pathumnaah.

en: So he built the house, and finished it; and he covered the house with beams and planks of cedar.
hmr: Chuongchun, in chu a hang bâwl a, a zo tah a, in chu sidar tlungpûm le a phêkin ân khum a.

en: And he built the stories against all the house, each five cubits high: and they rested on the house with timber of cedar.
hmr: Chun, a in sâwng neihai chu in sik vawngin tawng nga senga insângin a bâwl a; chuonghai chu in le chun sidar thinga zawm a nih.

en: And the word of Jehovah came to Solomon, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu Solomon kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Concerning this house which thou art building, if thou wilt walk in my statutes, and execute mine ordinances, and keep all my commandments to walk in them; then will I establish my word with thee, which I spake unto David thy father.
hmr: “Hi in bâwl lai mêk chungchâng thu hi ka thuruothai i pawm a, ka rorêlhai i zâwm a, ka thupêk po pohai zâwm dinga i pawm phawt chun, i pa David kuoma ka lo hril tah ka thu kha i chungah sukdet ka tih.

en: And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will not forsake my people Israel.
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai laia hin chêng ka ta, ka mi Israelhai hi thlathlam naw ning ah,” tiin.

en: So Solomon built the house, and finished it.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun in chu a bâwl a, a zo tah a.

en: And he built the walls of the house within with boards of cedar: from the floor of the house unto the walls of the ceiling, he covered them on the inside with wood; and he covered the floor of the house with boards of fir.
hmr: In sûng tienga bang ding chun sidar thingphêk a hmang a, a ṭuonga inthawka a inchung thuo bang chen chun thingphêk a bel vawng a, a ṭuonga chun fâr thing phêk a pha sah a.

en: And he built twenty cubits on the hinder part of the house with boards of cedar from the floor unto the walls of the ceiling: he built them for it within, for an oracle, even for the most holy place.
hmr: Chun, in chawrtieng pang tawng sâwmhni chu a ṭuonga in- thawka a bang chenin sidar thing- phêkhaiin a siem vawng a, a biekna hmun, Hmun Inthieng tak ta ding khawm chun a sûngtienga chun a hmang a.

en: And the house, that is, the temple before the oracle, was forty cubits long.
hmr: Chun, biekna hmun hma tieng biek in sûng chu a dung tawng sâwm- li a na.

en: And there was cedar on the house within, carved with knops and open flowers: all was cedar; there was no stone seen.
hmr: Chun, insûng tienga chun a kumûm le a pâr, pâr lima ker mawi sidar thing a um a, a rêng chun sidar thing vawng a nih; lung hrim hrim ân lang nawh a.

en: And he prepared an oracle in the midst of the house within, to set there the ark of the covenant of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, LALPA thuthlung bâwm siena dingin a sûngah hmun in- thiengtak a buotsai a.

en: And within the oracle was a space of twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in breadth, and twenty cubits in the height thereof; and he overlaid it with pure gold: and he covered the altar with cedar.
hmr: Chun, chu hmun inthiengtak chu a dung tieng tawng sâwmhni, a khang tieng tawng sâwmhni, ân sâng tieng tawng sâwmhni a nih; chu chu rângkachak hlirhlakin ân luon a; chun, sidar maichâm chu ân luon bawk a.

en: So Solomon overlaid the house within with pure gold: and he drew chains of gold across before the oracle; and he overlaid it with gold.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun chu in sûng tieng chu rângkachak in- thiengin ân luon vawng a; chun, hmun inthiengtak hma tieng chu rângkachak khaidiethaiin a daidan a; chu chu rângkachakin ân luon a.

en: And the whole house he overlaid with gold, until all the house was finished: also the whole altar that belonged to the oracle he overlaid with gold.
hmr: Chun, in chu a rênga a zo chenin a pumin rângkachak inthiengin ân luon pei a; hmun inthienga maichâm pumpui khawm chu rângkachak inthiengin ân luon a.

en: And in the oracle he made two cherubim of olive-wood, each ten cubits high.
hmr: Chun, hmun inthienga chun tawng sâwmhni ve vea insângin cherub pahni Oliv thingin a siem a.

en: And five cubits was the one wing of the cherub, and five cubits the other wing of the cherub: from the uttermost part of the one wing unto the uttermost part of the other were ten cubits.
hmr: Cherub thla pakhat chu tawng nga a na, cherub thla khingtieng chu tawng nga bawk a nih; thla pakhat hmawra inthawka thla khingtieng hmawr inkâr chu tawng sâwm a nih.

en: And the other cherub was ten cubits: both the cherubim were of one measure and one form.
hmr: Cherub pakhat insângtieng chu tawng sâwm a na, cherubhai chu intie chie le pieng dân inang ve ve a nih.

en: The height of the one cherub was ten cubits, and so was it of the other cherub.
hmr: Cherub pakhat insâng tieng chu tawng sâwm a na, cherub pakhat khawm chu, chu chen bawk chu a nih.

en: And he set the cherubim within the inner house; and the wings of the cherubim were stretched forth, so that the wing of the one touched the one wall, and the wing of the other cherub touched the other wall; and their wings touched one another in the midst of the house.
hmr: Chun, cherubhai chu insûng ril lema chun a sieh a; chun, cherubhai thla chu ân zar a, pakhat thla chun bang khingtieng a va tâwk a, cherub pakhat thla khawm chun bang khing- tieng chu a tâwk bawk a; chu in lailungtaka chun an thla le an thla chu ân tâwk a.

en: And he overlaid the cherubim with gold.
hmr: Chun, cherubhai chu rângka- chak inthiengin ân luon a.

en: And he carved all the walls of the house round about with carved figures of cherubim and palm-trees and open flowers, within and without.
hmr: In bang po po chu a vêlin cherubhai intûm thing le pâr par ta sa limhai leh, ker mawiin sûngtieng le a puotienga chun a siem a.

en: And the floor of the house he overlaid with gold, within and without.
hmr: A in ṭuong chu sûngtieng le a puotienga chun rângkachak in- thiengin ân luon a.

en: And for the entrance of the oracle he made doors of olive-wood: the lintel and door-posts were a fifth part of the wall.
hmr: Chun, hmun inthiengtak lûtna dinga chun Oliv thingin kawtkhâr a siem a, kawtkhâr lu chung le kawt- khâr bienghai chu a bang hmun ngaa ṭhea hmun khat tie a nih.

en: So he made two doors of olive-wood; and he carved upon them carvings of cherubim and palm-trees and open flowers, and overlaid them with gold; and he spread the gold upon the cherubim, and upon the palm-trees.
hmr: Chuongchun, Oliv thingin kawtkhâr pahni a siem a, chutaka chun cherubhai, intûm thing le pâr par tasahai lim dâm ker mawiin a siem a, chuong chu rângkachakin ân luon a; chun, cherubhai le intûm thinghai chu rângkachak a nâl a.

en: So also made he for the entrance of the temple door-posts of olive-wood, out of a fourth part of the wall;
hmr: Chun, biekin lûtna dingin bang hmun lia ṭhea hmun khat ruolin Oliv kawtkhâr ban a siem bawk a,

en: and two doors of fir-wood: the two leaves of the one door were folding, and the two leaves of the other door were folding.
hmr: fâr thing kawtkhâr pahni leh; kawtkhâr pakhata phêk hni chu thlep thei a na, kawtkhâr pakhata phêk hnihai khawm chu thlep thei ma a nih.

en: And he carved thereon cherubim and palm-trees and open flowers; and he overlaid them with gold fitted upon the graven work.
hmr: Chuonghaia chun cherubhai, intûm thinghai pâr par tasahai lim chu a ker a, chuong ker mawihai chu innâmtakin rângkachakin ân luon a.

en: And he built the inner court with three courses of hewn stone, and a course of cedar beams.
hmr: Biekin huon sûng tuollai sûng- ril lem chu lung sut sâwng thum le sidar thingphêk thuo khatin a siem a.

en: In the fourth year was the foundation of the house of Jehovah laid, in the month Ziv.
hmr: A kum lina Ziv thlaa chun LALPA in lungphûm chu rem a na,

en: And in the eleventh year, in the month Bul, which is the eighth month, was the house finished throughout all the parts thereof, and according to all the fashion of it. So was he seven years in building it.
hmr: chun, kum sâwm le kum khatna Bul thla, thla rietnaah in chu remruot ang chiein, a iengkim chu zo vawng a na. Chuongchun, kum sari sûng a bâwl a nih.

en: And Solomon was building his own house thirteen years, and he finished all his house.
hmr: Solomon chun ama in chu kum sâwm le kum thum a bâwl a, a in chu a zo vawng a.

en: For he built the house of the forest of Lebanon; the length thereof was a hundred cubits, and the breadth thereof fifty cubits, and the height thereof thirty cubits, upon four rows of cedar pillars, with cedar beams upon the pillars.
hmr: Lebanon Rampui In sidar ban tlar li, ban chunga sidar thingphêk chunga chun a bâwl bawk a; a dung- tieng chu tawng za a na, a khangtieng chu tawng sâwmnga a na, ân sâng- tieng chu tawng sâwmthum a nih.

en: And it was covered with cedar above over the forty and five beams, that were upon the pillars; fifteen in a row.
hmr: Chun, banhai sâwmli panga chunga innghat pindanhai chunga chun sidar thingphêkhaia inkhum a na, banhai chu tlar khata chun sâwm le panga pei a nih.

en: And there were beams in three rows, and window was over against window in three ranks.
hmr: Tlar thumin tukver a um a, var le varhai chu ân ep vawng a.

en: And all the doors and posts were made square with beams: and window was over against window in three ranks.
hmr: Kawtkhârhai le banhai po po chu thingphêkin kil li neia siem a na, var le varhai chu tlar thumin ân ep vawng a.

en: And he made the porch of pillars; the length thereof was fifty cubits, and the breadth thereof thirty cubits; and a porch before them; and pillars and a threshold before them.
hmr: Chun, tuolpûk chu ban neiin a siem a, a dungtieng chu tawng sâwm- nga a na, a khangtieng chu tawng sâwmthum a na; chun, chuong hmaa- hai chun tuolpûk a siem a, banhai le a hmaa lûtna kailâwnhai leh.

en: And he made the porch of the throne where he was to judge, even the porch of judgment: and it was covered with cedar from floor to floor.
hmr: Chun, a rorêlna ding lalṭhung- pha tuolpûk, rorêlna tuolpûk chu a siem bawk a, chu chu ṭuong khing- tienga inthawka khingtieng chena sidar thinga inkhum a nih.

en: And his house where he was to dwell, the other court within the porch, was of the like work. He made also a house for Pharaoh’s daughter (whom Solomon had taken to wife), like unto this porch.
hmr: Chun, a umna dingin tuolpûk sûng, huon sûng tuollai danga um chu chuong ang bawk chun siem a na. Chun, Pharao naunu (Solomonin nu- hmeia a inei) chu tuolpûk ang bawk chun a in a bâwlpêk a.

en: All these were of costly stones, even of hewn stone, according to measure, sawed with saws, within and without, even from the foundation unto the coping, and so on the outside unto the great court.
hmr: Chuong po po chu lung man tamtak tak, a huntâwk ang chiea sut, âtnaa âta bâwl a na, a sûngtieng khawm, a puotieng khawm, lung- phûma inthawka a lêr chenin; chun, chuong ang bawkin tuol tieng chun inhuon sûng tuolzâwl khawlai lientak chenin.

en: And the foundation was of costly stones, even great stones, stones of ten cubits, and stones of eight cubits.
hmr: Chun, lungphûmhai chu lung man tamtak tak, lung lientak tak tawng sâwm dâm, tawng riet dâma rem a nih.

en: And above were costly stones, even hewn stone, according to measure, and cedar-wood.
hmr: Chun, chu chung tieng chu lung man tamtak tak, lung a huntâwk ang chiea sut le sidar thing a na.

en: And the great court round about had three courses of hewn stone, and a course of cedar beams; like as the inner court of the house of Jehovah, and the porch of the house.
hmr: A vêlin inhuon sûng tuolzâwl lientak chu lung sut sâwmthum le Sidar thingphêk thuo khata inhuon a na; LALPA in inhuon sûng tuollai sûngril lem leh, in tuolpûk ang bawk khan.

en: And king Solomon sent and fetched Hiram out of Tyre.
hmr: Chun, lal Solomon chun mi a tir a, Tura khuoa inthawk chun Hiram a ko a.

en: He was the son of a widow of the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a worker in brass; and he was filled with wisdom and understanding and skill, to work all works in brass. And he came to king Solomon, and wrought all his work.
hmr: Ama chu Naphtali hnam hmeithai nau a na, a pa chu Tura khuoa mi dâr suttu a na, ama dâr sut kawnga hrim hrim chun a varin a hrietthiemin a themthiem hle el a. Lal Solomon kuoma chun a feh a, a sin po po chu a thawpêk vawng a.

en: For he fashioned the two pillars of brass, eighteen cubits high apiece: and a line of twelve cubits compassed either of them about.
hmr: Dâr ban pahni a sûng kaw- rawngin, tawng sâwm pariet ve vea insângin a siem a, a lienzie chu tawng sâwmpahni ve ve le inchi li ve vea saa inkuol a nih.

en: And he made two capitals of molten brass, to set upon the tops of the pillars: the height of the one capital was five cubits, and the height of the other capital was five cubits.
hmr: Ban sîpa sie dingin dâr sung bâwk pahni a siem a, bâwk pakhat insâng tieng chu tawng nga a na, bâwk pakhat insâng tieng khawm chu tawng nga bawk a nih.

en: There were nets of checker-work, and wreaths of chain-work, for the capitals which were upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one capital, and seven for the other capital.
hmr: Ban sîpa bâwkhaia chun ṭiel chikchek le, inher chîlchielhai hi a um a, bâwk pakhata chun pasari a na, pakhat danga khawm chun pasari bawk.

en: So he made the pillars; and there were two rows round about upon the one network, to cover the capitals that were upon the top of the pillars: and so did he for the other capital.
hmr: Chuongchun, banhai chu a siem a, chuong ban sîpa a bâwkhai tuomna ding chun ṭiel chikchek theibufaihai leh pakhat chunga chun a vêlin tlar hni a um a; chuong ang bawk chun bâwk pakhat chunga khawm chun ân umtir a.

en: And the capitals that were upon the top of the pillars in the porch were of lily-work, four cubits.
hmr: Chun, tuolpûka ban sîphaia bâwka chun lili lim hi a chuong a, tawng li a nih.

en: And there were capitals above also upon the two pillars, close by the belly which was beside the network: and the pomegranates were two hundred, in rows round about upon the other capital.
hmr: Chun, ban pahni sîpa bâwkhaia chun a reia ṭiel chikchek bul ela chun theibufaihai lim a um bawk a; chun, theibufaihai chu chuong bâwkhaia chun za hni ve vea intlarin a um a.

en: And he set up the pillars at the porch of the temple: and he set up the right pillar, and called the name thereof Jachin; and he set up the left pillar, and called the name thereof Boaz.
hmr: Chun, biek in tuolpûkhaia chun banhai chu ân ngîrtir a, changtieng ban chu ân ngîr a, a hminga chun Jakin ân bûk a, chun, vawitieng ban chu ân ngîr a, a hminga chun Boaz ân bûk a.

en: And upon the top of the pillars was lily-work: so was the work of the pillars finished.
hmr: Chun, ban sîpa chun lili lim a chuong a; chuongchun, ban tieng sin chu zo a ni tah a.

en: And he made the molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim, round in compass, and the height thereof was five cubits; and a line of thirty cubits compassed it round about.
hmr: Chun, dâr tuizêng, a reia in- thawka a rei khingtieng chena tawng sâwm tla, ân sâng tieng tawng nga a sung a; a rei chu tawng sâwmthum biel vêl a nih.

en: And under the brim of it round about there were knops which did compass it, for ten cubits, compassing the sea round about: the knops were in two rows, cast when it was cast.
hmr: A rei hnuoia chun kumûm lim hin a vêlsuok a, tawng sâwm a na, tuizêng rei vêla chun a um a; chuong kumûmhai chu tlar hniin an um a; sung sa nghâl an nih.

en: It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north, and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east; and the sea was set upon them above, and all their hinder parts were inward.
hmr: Chu chu bâwngchal sâwm le pahni chungah ân nghat a, pathumin hmartieng an nghah a, pathumin thlangtieng an nghah a, pathumin simtieng an nghah a, pathumin saktieng an nghah a. Chun, zêng chu an chungah ân ṭhut a, an mei tieng chun sûng tieng chu a ngha seng a;

en: And it was a handbreadth thick: and the brim thereof was wrought like the brim of a cup, like the flower of a lily: it held two thousand baths.
hmr: kutpha bawka sa a nih; a rei chu lili pâr ang, no rei anga siem a na, bath sâng hni keng a nih.

en: And he made the ten bases of brass; four cubits was the length of one base, and four cubits the breadth thereof, and three cubits the height of it.
hmr: Chun, inṭhutna sâwm dârin a siem a, inṭhutna pakhat seizie chu tawng li a na, a khangtieng chu tawng li bawk a na, ân sâng tieng chu tawng thum a nih.

en: And the work of the bases was on this manner: they had panels; and there were panels between the ledges;
hmr: Chun, inṭhutnahai siem dân chu hieng ang hi a nih: chuonghai chun khur a nei a, a khurhai chu a reihai inkâra chun a um a;

en: and on the panels that were between the ledges were lions, oxen, and cherubim; and upon the ledges there was a pedestal above; and beneath the lions and oxen were wreaths of hanging work.
hmr: chun, a reihai inkâra khurhaia chun sakeibakneihai, bâwngchalhai, cherubhai a chuong a; a rei chunga chun innghatna a um a; chun, sakeibakneihai le bâwngchal hnuoia chun cheimawinahai a um nghien a.

en: And every base had four brazen wheels, and axles of brass; and the four feet thereof had undersetters: beneath the laver were the undersetters molten, with wreaths at the side of each.
hmr: Chun, inṭhutnahaia chun dâr tawlailîr pali le dâr kalru a um seng a, a kihai palia chun ân nghatna a um seng a, insâwpna bêl hnuoi tieng chun ân nghatna sunga sung a um a, a rei senga chun cheimawina a um seng a.

en: And the mouth of it within the capital and above was a cubit: and the mouth thereof was round after the work of a pedestal, a cubit and a half; and also upon the mouth of it were gravings, and their panels were foursquare, not round.
hmr: Chun, a suonkuol bau rei chu tawng khat tla a na, a rei tlâng chu suonkuol anga chêng a na, tawng khat le a chenve a nih, chun, a rei tlânghai chu cheimawi a na, a khur- hai chu kil li a na, a chêng nawh a.

en: And the four wheels were underneath the panels; and the axletrees of the wheels were in the base: and the height of a wheel was a cubit and half a cubit.
hmr: Chun, tawlailîr palihai chu a khur hnuoi tiengahai chun a um a; chun, tawlailîr kalruhai chu inṭhut- naahai chun a um a, tawlailîr insâng tieng chu tawng khat le a chenve a nih.

en: And the work of the wheels was like the work of a chariot wheel: their axletrees, and their felloes, and their spokes, and their naves, were all molten.
hmr: Chu tawlailîrhai siem dân chu sakawr tawlailîr ke siem dân ang hi a na, a tlungzamhai, a suonkuolhai, a sunkalnahai, a laibâwkhai chu sung vawng a nih.

en: And there were four undersetters at the four corners of each base: the undersetters thereof were of the base itself.
hmr: Chun, inṭhutna kil li senga chun innghatna pali a um a, chuong innghatnahai chu inṭhutna le chun pumkhat vawng an nih.

en: And in the top of the base was there a round compass half a cubit high; and on the top of the base the stays thereof and the panels thereof were of the same.
hmr: Chun, inṭhutna chunga chun suonkuol, tawng chenvea insâng hi a um a, inṭhutna chunga ân ṭhutna kalhai le a khurhai chu pumkhat vawng an nih.

en: And on the plates of the stays thereof, and on the panels thereof, he graved cherubim, lions, and palm-trees, according to the space of each, with wreaths round about.
hmr: Chun, ân ṭhutna kephêkahai le, a khurahai chun a lienzie ang peiin cherubhai, sakeibakneihai, intûm thinghai ân chuongtir a, a vêl chun cheimawina hi a um seng a.

en: After this manner he made the ten bases: all of them had one casting, one measure, and one form.
hmr: Chuong ang vawng chun in- ṭhutna sâwmhai chu a siem a, a rêng chun pakhata sung an ni vawng a, intie seng, siem dân inang vawng an nih.

en: And he made ten lavers of brass: one laver contained forty baths; and every laver was four cubits; and upon every one of the ten bases one laver.
hmr: Chun, insâwpna bêl sâwm dârin a siem a, maihûn pakhat chun bath sâwmli a dawng a; maihûn chu tawng li seng a na, inṭhutna sâwm chunga chun maihûn pakhat chu ân ṭhut pei a.

en: And he set the bases, five on the right side of the house, and five on the left side of the house: and he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward, toward the south.
hmr: Chun, inṭhutnahai chu in changtieng chun panga ân ṭhut a, vawitieng panga chun panga, chun, tuizêng chu in changtieng panga saktienga sim nghain ân ṭhut a.

en: And Hiram made the lavers, and the shovels, and the basins. So Hiram made an end of doing all the work that he wrought for king Solomon in the house of Jehovah:
hmr: Chun, Hiram chun insâwpna bêlhai, vutluohai, maihûnhai a siem a.

en: the two pillars, and the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the pillars; and the two networks to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the pillars;
hmr: Chuongchun, Hiram chun LALPA in ta dinga Solomon a siem- pêk po po chu a zo vawng ta a; ban pahni dâm, ban sîpa bêl anga inbâwkhai pahni, ban sîpa bêl anga inbâwk tuomna ṭiel chikchekhai pahni,

en: and the four hundred pomegranates for the two networks; two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were upon the pillars;
hmr: chu tuomna ṭiel chikchek ta dinga theibufai za lihai dâm, ban sîpa bêl anga inbâwk pahni tuomna dinga ṭiel chikchek ve ve ta dinga theibufai tlar hnihai kha;

en: and the ten bases, and the ten lavers on the bases;
hmr: chun, inṭhutna sâwm le inṭhut- na chunga insâwpna bêl sâwmhai dâm,

en: and the one sea, and the twelve oxen under the sea;
hmr: tuizêng pakhat le tuizêng hnuoia sebâwngchal sâwm le pahni- hai dâm,

en: and the pots, and the shovels, and the basins: even all these vessels, which Hiram made for king Solomon, in the house of Jehovah, were of burnished brass.
hmr: bêlhai, vutluohai le maihûnhai le dâm, chuong bûr le bêlhai po po Hiramin LALPA in dinga Solomon a siempêkhai chu dâr nâwt tlêt ruok a nih.

en: In the plain of the Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zarethan.
hmr: Jordan phaizâwlah, Sukkoth le Zarethan inkâra bepil hmunah a nih lalpa chun a sung chu.

en: And Solomon left all the vessels unweighed, because they were exceeding many: the weight of the brass could not be found out.
hmr: Chun, Solomonin chuong, bûr le bêlhai po po chu a tam êm leiin bûk suok loin a sie el a, dâr bûk zât chu hriet suok ruol a ni nawh.

en: And Solomon made all the vessels that were in the house of Jehovah: the golden altar, and the table whereupon the showbread was, of gold;
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun LALPA ina bûr le bêl um po pohai chu a siem a, rângkachak maichâm le entirna bei siena dawkân chu rângkachakin;

en: and the candlesticks, five on the right side, and five on the left, before the oracle, of pure gold; and the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs, of gold;
hmr: chun, hmun inthieng hma zâwna khâwnvar siena changtienga panga le vawitienga panga chu râng- kachak inthiengin; pârhai le, khâwn- varhai le chaichehai chu rângkachak bawkin;

en: and the cups, and the snuffers, and the basins, and the spoons, and the firepans, of pure gold; and the hinges, both for the doors of the inner house, the most holy place, and for the doors of the house, to wit, of the temple, of gold.
hmr: nohai, khâwnvar puon chepna- hai, maihûnhai, haihawhai, rimin- hnik thlêng, meilâknahai, rângka- chak hlîr hlak vawngin; in sûngril lem, hmun inthiengtak kawtkhâra- hai le, in (biek in chu) kawtkhâr inbûknahai chu rângkachakin.

en: Thus all the work that king Solomon wrought in the house of Jehovah was finished. And Solomon brought in the things which David his father had dedicated, even the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, and put them in the treasuries of the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Solomon chun LALPA in dinga a siem po po chu a zo ta vawng a. Chuongchun, Solomon chun a pa David lo inhlân sa tah tangkaruohai, rângkachak dâm, bûr le bêlhai chu a lâklût a, LALPA ina rohai lai chun a sie tah a.

en: Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the princes of the fathers’ houses of the children of Israel, unto king Solomon in Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of Jehovah out of the city of David, which is Zion.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun Israel upahai le, an hnam lusahai po po dâm, Israel thlahai sûngkuo upahai chu Jerusalem khuoa lal Solomon kuoma chun David khawpui Ziona inthawkin LALPA thuthlung bâwm zâwn dingin a ko khâwm tâwl a.

en: And all the men of Israel assembled themselves unto king Solomon at the feast, in the month Ethanim, which is the seventh month.
hmr: Chun, Israel mi po pohai chu Ethanim thla (thla sarinaa chun) ruoiṭhenaah lal Solomon kuoma chun an inkhâwm ṭeu tâwl a.

en: And all the elders of Israel came, and the priests took up the ark.
hmr: Chun, Israel upahai po po chu an hung a, thiempuhai chun bâwm chu an zâwn a.

en: And they brought up the ark of Jehovah, and the tent of meeting, and all the holy vessels that were in the Tent; even these did the priests and the Levites bring up.
hmr: LALPA bâwm le inbiekna puon in le, puon ina bûr le bêl inthienghai po po chu an zâwn a; chuonghai chu thiempuhai le Levi chihai chun an zâwn a.

en: And king Solomon and all the congregation of Israel, that were assembled unto him, were with him before the ark, sacrificing sheep and oxen, that could not be counted nor numbered for multitude.
hmr: Chun, lal Solomon le Israel mi pungkhâwm po po, a kuoma hung inkhâwmhai chu bâwm hmaa chun an um tâwl a; berâm le bâwngchal a tam leia tiem sêng ruol lo le a zât hriet sêng ruol lo chun an inthâwi a.

en: And the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of Jehovah unto its place, into the oracle of the house, to the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim.
hmr: Chuongchun, thiempuhai chun LALPA thuthlung bâwm chu a umna dinga chun an lâklût a, in sûnga biekna hmun, hmun inthiengtakah, cherubhai thla hnuoia chun.

en: For the cherubim spread forth their wings over the place of the ark, and the cherubim covered the ark and the staves thereof above.
hmr: Cherubhai chun bâwm umna chung zâwna chun an thlahai an zâr zing sih a; cherubhai chun bâwm le a zâwnfunghai chu an huop vawng a.

en: And the staves were so long that the ends of the staves were seen from the holy place before the oracle; but they were not seen without: and there they are unto this day.
hmr: Chun, a zâwnfunghai chu a sei khawp a, a zâwnfung hmawrhai chu biekna hmun hma, hmun inthienga inthawk chun ân hmu thei a: tuola inthawk ruok chun ân lang nawh; tu chen hin chutaka chun a la um zing a nih.

en: There was nothing in the ark save the two tables of stone which Moses put there at Horeb, when Jehovah made a covenant with the children of Israel, when they came out of the land of Egypt.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawka an suok a, LALPAIN Israel thlahai kuoma thu a thlung laia Mosiein Horeb tlânga lungphêk pahni a siehai chau naw kha chu, chu bâwm sûnga chun iengkhawm a um nawh.

en: And it came to pass, when the priests were come out of the holy place, that the cloud filled the house of Jehovah,
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai chu hmun inthienga inthawka an hung suok phingle chun LALPA in chu sûm chun a hung sip ta mup el a;

en: so that the priests could not stand to minister by reason of the cloud; for the glory of Jehovah filled the house of Jehovah.
hmr: chuongchun, sûm lei chun thiempuhai chu rawngbâwlin an um thei ta naw hiel a, LALPA ropuinain LALPA in chu a suksip vawng ta sih a.

en: Then spake Solomon, Jehovah hath said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun thu a hril tah a, “LALPAIN, ‘Inthim sa- mupa chun um ka tih,’ a ti hrim a.

en: I have surely built thee a house of habitation, a place for thee to dwell in for ever.
hmr: I chêngna ding in, kumkhuoa i umna ding in ka bâwlpêk ta che a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And the king turned his face about, and blessed all the assembly of Israel: and all the assembly of Israel stood.
hmr: Chun, lal chu a hnungtieng chun a nghah a, Israel hung pung- khâwmhai po po chu mal a sâwm a, chuongchun, Israelhai pungkhâwm- hai po po chu an ngîr ṭhuop a.

en: And he said, Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, who spake with his mouth unto David my father, and hath with his hand fulfilled it, saying,
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “LALPA Israelhai Pathien, ka pa David kuom- a ama bau ngei a,

en: Since the day that I brought forth my people Israel out of Egypt, I chose no city out of all the tribes of Israel to build a house, that my name might be there; but I chose David to be over my people Israel.
hmr: ‘Aigupta rama inthawka ka mi Israelhai ka ṭhuoi suok nia inthawkin Israelhai hnam laia khâwlai khuo khawm hi ka hming umna dinga in bâwlna dingin ka la thlang ngai nawh a, amiruokchu, ka mi Israelhai hotu ding chun David hi ka thlang a nih,’ tia lo hriltu ama kut ngeia hung suk- puitlingtu hi inpâkin um raw se.

en: Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
hmr: Ka pa David khan Israelhai Pathien, LALPA hming ta dinga in bâwl a lungrilin a lo tum hlak a.

en: But Jehovah said unto David my father, Whereas it was in thy heart to build a house for my name, thou didst well that it was in thy heart:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPAIN ka pa David kuoma chun, ‘I lungrila chun ka hming ta dinga in bâwl i tum hlak a, hieng ang lungril i lo put hi i thaw ṭha a;

en: nevertheless thou shalt not build the house; but thy son that shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house for my name.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, nang chun chu in chu bâwl naw ti nih; i naupa i ṭhalbea la suok ding chun, ka hming dingin in chu la bâwl lem a tih,’ a lo ti tah a.
